review: The problem with PUBG on PC from the point of view of a casual gamer.Let me start by saying that I'm just a "casual" gamer not a hardcore competitive gamer (I haven't played any online competitive games prior to the battle royale craze). I'll also say that I enjoy the battle royale game format I play PUBG on mobile and I'm fairly good at it (I win sometimes not all the time and I average around 3 4 kills per game).But unfortunately I just can't recommend the PC game. Here's why The simple problem is the type of gamers that you get on PC they tend to be experienced competitive gamers with all the expensive gaming gear.I find that playing on PC has two main problems one people just seem to know where you are (somehow they just do). Most of the time I get killed by people I haven't even seen. I can be hiding in a building not making a sound for 5 minutes and someone will throw a grenade through the window (this has happened to me many times).The second problem on PC is the accuracy that players have most of the time I can barely get one shot off at someone before they have headshotted me. I have popped out from behind a wall and opened up at someone at point blank range on full auto and they still somehow managed to kill me with a single headshot. Again this has happened many times.(To those who will say that my game strategy must be bad I play the same way on PC as I do on mobile which I'm fairly decent at.)Don't even bother trying to play PUBG on PC with an Xbox Controller (which I used to do) you will just get wiped out very badly. I bougt a proper Corsair gaming mouse (12 000 DPI) which admittedly makes long range shots slightly easier but I still can't seem to fire more than one shot at somone before they have headshotted me. I don't even like playing with KBM I prefer a controller but there's just no way you can play with a controller against KBM players.And there really are a lot of cheaters on PC. I'd heard there were but I can confirm it is indeed true. I report a lot of players for suspected cheating and literally almost every time I log into the game I see a message telling me that someone I reported has been banned for cheating.I've been playing on PC for four months now and I've not even got a single win. It's got to the point where I class myself as doing well if I can just land and find a gun. And sometimes I can't even do that I've been shot and killed on the chute before no kidding.I'm seriously considering uninstalling and deleting the game now and buying a console instead just so that I won't have to play against the cheaters and KBM noscopers.What is needed is matchmaking based on skill level and controller type so that players with similar stats play together and controller/KBM players are kept separate. Apparently this is just too complicated to implement though.If you want to play competitive games on PC firstly you're going to need all the expensive gear mechanical keyboard with macro keys high DPI mouse headset with virtual 7.1 surround sound etc high refresh rate monitor etc. (and of course an expensive PC). And on top of that you're going to need years of experience and practice before you get to be anywhere near good.So my recommendation is that if you're just a casual gamer like me and you want to play PUBG play it on console or mobile not PC.

review: The game is laggy buggy badly optimized and terrible overall but still one of the greatest ones I've ever played.I don't even know when was the last time I enjoyed a game as much as PUBG. It feels bad when you bug into a wall and can't get out or your opponent kills you while you're behind a tree but these "phenomena" are very very rare.The reason for the mixed reviews is that multiple million people play this game and the ones who have a problem are loader than the ones who don't. Lately big companies like EA are milking people for DLCs and additional content that should have been included in the game. In PUBG this is not the case. You get what you pay for. A ****ing big map or rather two a dozen guns vehicles and 99 opponents. No trick anywhere. The feeling when you reach top 10 and hear an AWM boom ing to your left your heart beating like Mayweather simply gives an undescribable feeling which alone justifies the 30 cost. When you're playing with your buddies is when gameplay gets really great. What's better than shooting around in a 8km x 8km map? Shooting around as a team of 4 while yelling at each other that HE'S RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME WHY CAN'T YOU HIT HIM YOU PLEB.ConclusionThis is an overall good game with optimization issues. If you a game that looks blade sharp this is not for you. But if you're looking for an amazing Battle Royale game then what are you waiting for?!

review: I have changed my mind about this game. A while ago I saw this game as a fun game that could grow into something amazing. Now I see that I was wrong. In my opinion this game is no longer enjoyable solo and barely fun with squads. One reason this game sucks is because it is just a repeat every single game. You join a game you deploy you get loot you survive a little then you either win nothing or die. When you die towards the end it's a punch in the face. You wasted 15 20 minutes doing nothing to barely something then you lose it all. However repeating action is something that occurs in every fps game but I find in pubg it feels exactly the same every time. Another reason is the greedy devs. When the game started the devs thought their game wouldn't amount to anything but now that it has the devs have become the devil child of EA and Activision. Some of the microtransaction are so stupid. The third reason is the god awful servers. I couldn't tell you the amount of times I have died because of the laggy servers. I've had moments when I get shot I take cover then I just die. Then the deathcam is no help because the deathcam is just as bad as the servers. I have to say pubg was a great game at one point but now its just pure garbage. I am very disappointed with this game.

review: This game is nowhere near perfect and its current mixed reviews rating is completely fair. However I've definitely gotten my money's worth out of this game and it is pretty fun at times. There are some frustrating mechanics and bugs that need to be tweaked though (e.g. losing too much health after getting out of vehicles that are slowing to a stop brakes in cars being a bit buggy). Also the servers (at least in Oceania) still lag every few games and I'm still frequently prompted with the 'too many logins' alert all the time.This game gets a whole lot better when played with friends compared to playing alone. I've had more memorable moments looting with friends than actually engaging in gunfights with enemies. There's a good variety of guns to use now and the scarcity of rarer items on the map seems to be pretty well balanced. The points reward system is also a nice incentive to keep people playing however the amount gained from coming anywhere but top 3 in squad matches is pretty poor. Also the developers overwriting their original decision to not have micro transactions in early access is also pretty sketchy.Overall this is a pretty enjoyable game that needs a fair bit of work done to it if the developers want to keep the game alive. Based on the current state of the game I wouldn't be surprised if a similar more polished game comes along over the next 12 months and steals the spotlight completely.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Unfortunately I can't recommend this game. It's fun and addictive unless you have any but high end computer and even then the technical and server issues often make it completely unplayable. The game releases tomorrow and as of now the test server (the one that will be released in some hours as the real deal) has a build that crashes dozens of times in a row for a significant portion of players and no fix seems to be in sight. Even if you are lucky enough to not experience this a lot (you will and I guarantee YOU WILL experience some crashes) the rubber banding missing textures invisible obstacles impossible damage outcomes and piles upon piles of other bugs will surely ruin the gaming experience for you and soon make the whole ordeal sour.3/10 that is if it actually runs.

review: This was the first game I installed with my first build PC my Nvidia GPU (GeForce Experience) pretty much introduced me to this game. The cover caught my attention a badass dude walking away from an explosion me vs. 99 other players every man for themselves my WWE fanboy side screech out Royal Rumble vibes and I was instantly bought it. The first 100 hours was a pain I felt life was judging my choice of playing this game sacrificing my time my family and career all for a chicken dinner. I still haven't won a damn chicken in Solo either I'm really unlucky or I'm bad at the game and need to "get good." Nope getting good watching "how to" and "Tip &amp Tricks" youtube videos about PUBG isn't going to make you a pro neither playing over 300 hours will or even streaming the damn game and having your viewers witness you making either top 20 5 place (if you did win 1st good on you). Also never get the hype on a game never.This game can be addicting and I don't mean a good way maybe it's the trends that society keep pushing us to be the best but from what I learn in this game. You really need to be lucky to win. You need to have the luck to land somewhere that has guns you can pick up instantly so you can shoot and kill first and have a better chance of winning cause you're still alive. You need to have the luck not to join a server with a hacker that doesn't one shot kill you out of nowhere. You need to have the luck for PUBG to favor your spot so blue zone doesn't screw up your plan of survival so you don't have to run in the middle of the field and hope you don't get blaze assaults from campers. You need to have the luck to be paired up with decent teammates communication is critical but 70% I still end up with Chinese players and they can sometimes be a and kill me for not speaking their language. If life is a gamble then me I'm now afraid to go outside.Features I beg the blue hole company to do Add a report button after watching deathcam footage Pubg_help is zero helpful. Have a mute button on selective players. Revel all 100 players' names on the server so I can find out who the is mic spamming. If chinse players want to play on the NA servers especially for squad pair them up and leave it as so. Not being racist I know they want to enjoy the game as much as I do Let them have their group and let me have mine. Allow BP to obtain keys I don't want another CS GO lotto scam going on. Add a "Add friend" button I personally find the "follow" feature a bit creepy someone whom I'm not friends on steam added me to his team and asked me "Do you remember me?" Then he started mic spamming and it took me a while to find the leave group button Move the "Leave Group" somewhere easy to find. Tweak the vehicle driving mechanics it's getting there some cars still flip and glitch but its finally getting there Adjust the terrains on the maps all of them. Overal It'll take a while to get used to playing PUBG for beginners you'll either hate it or enjoy playing with friends.

review: If you are someone who is a solid FPS player and loves the challenge of climbing leaderboards to prove your skill then be ready to waste your time grinding matches to only be killed by someone using aimbot/wallhack/scripts/ESP...the list goes on and on. I enjoyed this game the fist 300 hours I put into it gaining skill and accumulating a good amount of double digit frag wins. The most recent 50 hours of gameplay I have sunk into this game has almost 100% made me quit playing entirely. The constant frustration of wasting 25 minutes of looting/killing/running...to only be killed by someone who magically headshots the last 5 remaining people in an instant nearly EVERY match is disgusting. Also learn chinese...you'll understand later if you buy it.

review: I'm harsh with it but i'd rather say "I do not recommend this game YET" I personnally have plenty of things to hate on this game the base concept is awesome and the spread mechanic for players and weapons is neat same for the zone red areas and care packages.The bad things they really should work on The way their server and our client communicate I often find myself shooting the head of my enemy only to realise I am not my connection is not the issue since I run around 80Mbps download and often have a ping of around 5mbps in most other games We should be able to cancel some interactions like climbing The game is not fluid you must make ONE action at the time and it is incredibly frustrating not being able to shoot during some small actions that require an incredible amount of time like opening doors crouching getting an item and even aiming seems to take a bit of time in which you cant shoot I often seem to notice there's some sort of delay when trying to shoot aim move make an action in general. fokken hackers everywhere and I swear the god there's a lot of em
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As much as I love this game the hacking in it has gotten worse and worse. Bluehole or whoever runs this sh*t needs to build a software program that runs all types of hacks out there and picks up on them. It's not like they don't have the damn money to do it. Last couple games I've played I've been killed with snippers or M16 with headshots from 1000 yards away or longer. After reviewing the kill cam there is no possible way half of the hits could have hit me. You can clearly see the aimbots when they look threw their scopes and there is no swaying in there movement also. every time I look down a scope I get sway none of this bs steady hand sh*t. I've also noticed that half the players that end up killing me this way or from the Asian community I feel you guys should fix it where everyone plays on their dedicated server region. I'm tired of going into games where it is riddled by people who can't one comunicate with you at all or they just straight up hack. Eithere this game gets fixed soon or your gonna lose a lot of good people out there that actally enjoy this game. And before anyone says anything smart. No I'm not the greatest at the game but I'm also not that sh*tty at it either. So to the PUBG corporation you guys really need to work on a system that will band these hackers or at least get rid of a majority of them. If I wanted this type of hacking I'd go play COD suck a**. Hopefully you guys look into this and not past it.

review: The amount of hackers just keeps getting worse.... Most of the changes (aside from a new map and some occasional gear) actually unbalance the game. I also preferred the pacing earlier on as well. the game feels much more arcadey with a focus on speed and spastic actions rather than the past slow and tactical approaches to situations.I have pretty decent net 100mbps and a very powerful rig but I am somehow still plagued by rubber banding latency issues being shot around corners before the other players avatar clears it etc etc. I actually had more fun the first few months after launch even though there were some wonky issues like falling through floors and bugs of that nature. At least I wasn't constantly raging about dying during a shoot out where me and my adversary were looking right at each other just to watch the death cam and it show that I never even fired my gun.

review: Overrated? Yes. Complete No. PUBG is a huge anomaly. In a time where shooters are oversaturated and par for the course Battlegrounds changes the formula adding a fresh coat of paint. It's a really great concept and if you purchase this game you'll have fun. Well if you can run it. It's horribly optimized with a Radeon RX560 and i5 7600k I can barely achieve 60 frames at low settings with common frame drops. The game is also really buggy with awkward input lag as well. At this price I just can't recommend it. It also lacks in diversity with only two maps with very similar looking " battlegrounds ." Although I'm sure with the amount of press this game is getting by full release it should be a great game.

review: Absolutly Fantastic game. Probalby the best BR game i have played. The game is in early access and not optimized well so if you have a lower end computer I would recomend some upgrades or waiting. I personaly run a Amd 6300 overclocked to 4.2 and a xfx 470 and i have 16 gb of ram. I run the game very well considering.I see a lot of negativity about people with 1080's that are struggling. Love to know what cpus they are running. Probably a lot of bottlenecking going on. As far as the gameplay fantastic and a great team to back it up. I look forward to the final product in 6 months.Edit I no longer recomend this game. The game was a blast to play in Alpha Beta was fun as well but thats when it finally started going down hill. The game has been out of early access for a while now as in fully released game. It feels like a early Beta build. Loads of bugs including reloaded shotgun wont fire. Imbalanced weapons with aim punch imbalanced damage poor hitboxes poor car mechanics. FPS drops like crazy. This game seems to get worse and worse yet they add more maps and more skins and bullcrap that does not improve upon the base game that is so flawed what soever. This game has so much potential yet it is going no where but down. I feel like the only reason i play this game/ rather put up with it. Is to play with friends.

review: Utterly trash of a game. And thats coming from someone who played it for more than 600 hours. Ever since the beginning the servers were always ily optimised for the game due to its enormous size with 100 players in it but nothing was ever done to help improve the quality of the gameplay and server. Instead the developers chose to push out aesthetics that doesnt even matter in the game and t crates to milk the living daylight out of this game. I will admit that this game is currently the best Battle royale game out there right now but due its sketchy developers and shady way of running the game its player base has been on a downward spiral over the years. Now with the new updates of supposedly "improvement" of the FPS i've been hard crashing every 5 minutes in the game. I even thought its my GPU's fault so i went to buy a whole new GPU to test it out and while i got improvement in FPS my game still crashes extremely frequently. The guys over at BlueBalls will not give a about the actual quality of the game until everyone is sick and tired of the completely unforgivable that we as the players are going through and finally boycotting this ass game. Hell maybe once they are finally done with milking the out of this game they would just leave it to rot and create new games and judging by the way this game is ultimately heading to self destruction i wouldn't be too surprised if that was the case.

review: I can say for sure that I will never play this game again.In the beginning the game looked very promising but now it's just a disaster.Instead of fixing bugs or performance issues the developers are rather implementing new skins and new lootboxes. First there was just on key to unlock boxes which was okay I guess but now you have to buy specific keys to open specific lootboxes with real money.And if that wasn't enough you can now buy a so called Event Pass which gives you instant access to specific clothes and skins. You can also gain EXP through playing the game. If you reach a specific level you simply unlock stuff. Sounds good right? Yeah if there wasn't a stupid level cap which resets daily. I mean come the f*ck on! If someone pays for this stupid pass and plays a lot why in the hell limit the amount of level ups he can get?!?In summery the future of PUBG looks really dark. A lot of other developers are making similar and better games and it's just a matter of time before everyone stops playing this everlasting Alpha version of a game. The developers showed once more that they simply don't care about their fans and that they are just in it for the money. They try to get every last penny out of this game because they know that at one point everyone will have left for a game of one of their competitors.

review: Gee what can I say PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a fun game that is plagued by issues that the developers have yet to address in its current state its very unoptimized server issues low variable tickrate 5 40 tick max(ever try to pick up a gun and it lags this is the reason why) no options for localized play(lan) ping limit or regional locking ( you will literaly play with people from all over the planet speaking of which our friends in the east (CHINA!!!) more often than not tend to use cheats to level the playing field use open mics dispite the language gap and introduce massive spikes and griefing on the us server due to playing in another country now im not saying everyone in China cheats but as a matter of facts its not frowed upon over there to use these methods in gaming but thats neither here or there back to PubG. Potenitally one of the best games ever if the framework(server issues) get resolved a ping limit is introduced(no more than 120) along with more centralized servers for every region ( e.g us east us centeral us west ) dont get me wrong these issues aside its an amazing game lots of fun stories with friends its always a good time until your reminded of these things mentioned I have faith the devs will fix these issues over a period of time just not in the time desired but overall i recommend this game to anyone just make sure you have a halfway decent rig otherwise you will have issues

review: This game is very nice but i will not write here pros and cons but my experience from my FIRST game. I landed in small village. There was good loot (scar vests backpacks etc.). I felt like unstopable force with these amounts of bullets and great weapons. I also found military car. And then i saw drop so i drived there. i looted crate and then one guy with no equip but with shotgun killed me with 1 shot in my back (or 2 dont know now). So what i want to say is in this game you are never save never know if somebody is scoping you. Its a lot about tactics and luck to find good loot. Only thing that is bad about this game is its price because 30 euro for multyplayer battle royale game is too much. I know it is still in early acces but games like rust have much more content for better price. Oh and i almost forgot about Lags and on lower spec. computers texture mish mash mostly on houses. but still this is a great game and i recomend it.That was what i wrote around 3 months ago. Now the game is out and its buggy as hell. Its just unfinished. Do i have to say more ?When in early acecess 8/10Now 5/10 is max i can give it.

review: I have one thing to report for fixing Starting the game leaves me stuck on a black screen but the game loads fine after I hit any button on my keyboard. Running Windows 7 with MSI Z97S motherboard Intel i5 4440 and Radeon R7 370 (outdated tech). Even with my outdated tech I still get solid 45fps can be 60 sometimes if I drop all settings.This game runs much better on my computer after the 1.0 patch. I can run higher graphics settings and still get more fps than before. Th gun control feels a lot more polished as well and the audio is perceptively better for me now with surround sound headphones. There was longer loading times at first but that seems to have fixed itself. The new map is awesome! Less hacker sitings than before so far even though I still get paired with groups of Chinese/Koreans/I don't even know what they are saying teams when playing random squad mode and I would suggest the devs region lock the severs... problem is if someone is using a VPN (like most of China and a few other countries) they can still log into any sever they want and appear to be from that country. Not really an obvious way for anyone to fix that problem... but that is the wonder and magic of VPNs. So far I can only understand some of the negative reviews I have read specifically the ones that say they either can't load the game or they have net lag / really long loading time. It would help if you report your specs but instead you all continue to gripe without giving any info It's completely useless without info. Not everyone has your problem so it is most likely related to your PCs. Also if you are complaining about aspecs of the gamemode itself battle royale then don't buy games that say "Battle Royale" In there description. If you don't like 20 30 minute rounds of survival deathmatch then go back to CS GO! Is that hard to figure out?? If I don't like MMOs I'm not going to buy an MMO and then say in the review "This game is stupid why can't I have a single player version?" *Facepalm* All in all one of my favorite shooters being developed and a great battle royale!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a great game but the major problems that exist are probably not going to be fixed not because the PUBG team doesn't want to fix them but because they revolve around massive amounts of players using the game at the same time. This mainly includes server lag and hosting issues. There are invisible objects in the new map that I've found driving up mountains in cars that don't affect player entities. They do affect bikes trucks and minibuses. This is an example of a problem that just comes with having such a massive map and not enough testing to fix all of the little problems. As for the gameplay itself I would recommend PUBG to GROUPS of friends. Playing by yourself isn't anywhere near as much fun as going for a backflip in a bike in the final circle with a friend stuck on the back who can't get off. The guns handle well but it can be hard to get used to the shooting as there isn't anywhere to really practice.

review: Post Early Access and this game is riddled with just as many bugs as it was three months ago. The game has gotten progressively worse and server lag makes the start of a match unplayable. The game itself is a great concept and is fun when it briefly works but bullet registration parachute deployment server lag awful crate system and hackers make maybe 1/10 matches enjoyable. Battle Eye is probably the worst anti cheat you could have for a game and no region lock allows hackers from China to flood NA servers and ruin the experience for everyone. Hit registration is the worst of any game I have ever played as you can have your sights right on the target and miss simply because either the bullet never registered or the server lag and de synced from client side that to the server you weren't even aiming close. Vehicle controls were ruined during official release and the can just randomly cause damage and stop if you hit a bump in a weird way. Also at the start of matches you can randomly take damage from landing somewhere and the delay for falling out of your parachute makes the experience feel broken and out of place. The parachute deployment has gotten worse with time rather than better making the start of matches even more unplayable. This game is And Blue Ball is likely not going to make it better. They have already milked so muching ing money off of it its ridiculous. Do not give them more money until the game is completely playable because in its current state it isn't.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: My apologies if I didn't give this game enough time to play but I don't see the point of going on. The first game I had one of my teammates drove up to me shot me then shot me again (killing me). The second game I couldn't understand anyone (they spoke a different language). The third game was more fair but still not enjoyable.If I am going to be intentionally teamkilled on the first game why should I keep playing? If I can't understand my teammates and therefore am unable to communicate with them effectively what's the point of trying to learn from/with others in squads? Overall I don't reccomend this because I can respect dying from an enemy but from your own team?Edit I tried a 4th game just to see if I overlooked anything (in squads) and it seems like I didn't. Everyont spoke a different language and this one teammate killed me revived me killed me revived me and the cycle went on. He kept saying things that I couldn't understand so I dropped everything on the ground and he still teamkilled me. I really don't see the point of playing this game (in squads at least) when half of your deaths aren't even from the enemy they are from your teammates.

This was not part of the system when I downloaded the game and frankly I feel ripped off. Had I known this was going to be part of the rewards mix I never would've bought the game it's greedy and soul less. Thank you bluehole for contributing the downfall of gaming.

review: This game is poorly made. People parachuting just appears out of nowhere. Loot system is so crap one day you will find level 2 items everywhere next day you cant even find a level 1 backpack in 5 houses. You will find ammo but no matching gun or attachments for smg's everywhere but no smg. Overall this game sucks. Not Worth your hard earned cash. This game shouldve been free or even better. Pubg Corp should pay you to play it. Sound is unbalanced. Cars are louder than gunshots. Vehicle mechanics suck. Cars flip for no reason crashes into invisble walls. Vehicles spawn when you drive them without them there is no vehicles especialy outside the white circle. Certain areas gets bombared by Red Zones other areas dont even smell one. This Game is unbalanced AS F....K!!!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Okay I'll start by saying this This game has come a long way from being barely playable with insane bugs and fps drops to a smooth experience fun gameplay and a nice time killer. I recommend this to anyone who likes a good ol' battle royale and also likes more realism graphics guns and so on. Pros A fun battle royale game that is also challenging. Amazing graphics. Smooth experience most of the time. Big weapon choice. Event mode third and first person modes. Regional servers. Rewarding crates that don't always require a key to open.Cons Only two maps. Sometimes lags and fps drops happen.

review: This game is amazing tbh i dont know why there are so many people giving it negative reviews well actually i know they keep on crying about the optimization the game has been out for like what 8 months? and everyone expects it to run like butter no its just not possible optimization comes after they add everything necessary in that way it makes it possible to optimize everything instead of doing it slowly and maybe having some errors later. Oh and 1 more thing my pc is pure garbage i mean its not the worst i had one even worse before AND I COULD STILL PLAY IT dont come at me saying "oh the lag fps are so bad" playing at 60 fps is ing amazing u dont notice any lag or fps i understand if u want to feel more smooth but with 60 u no longer lag i play with like 30 prob and i feel good of course it lags a bit and stuff but its normal since my pc is garbage stop crying about the fps and just lower the graphics to low and u will be able to play it if u cant with that im sorry but your pc is like 15 years old like my old one was so just buy a decent one and you're ready to go. Another reason for bad reviews camping someone that uses this as an excuse is actually stupid im sorry the one who camps is the player not the game the game is not at fault and camping is a tactic even if you don't like it just learn how to deal with it. "my biggest mistake was buying this game on alpha/beta it has so many bugs!" ... its just as you said YOU bought the game KNOWING it was early alpha/beta OF COURSE it has bugs ITS ALPHA like what???? ur job is to report those bugs and have them fixed by the pubg team but tbh i myself haven't seen any bugs except for one that would happen when you're sprinting with a he grenade out and looking to the left and your guy would look but it was fixed soon after no major bugs nothing nothing like what i saw people talking about "invisible walls" i never saw 1 invisible wall on pubg i have no idea wtf hes talking about. Now the reasons behind the good reviews The game is amazing for some reason you just love the fact that you're playing among another 99 people to survive in a small island and that makes u excited it makes your heart beat faster it has a very tactical gameplay since u have to think the better locations not just for looting but the best locations u should go through to get to the final circle without risking to loose best places for shooting with cover everything. As far as i've seen there are also most no bugs and if there are bugs it normal its early alpha u bought the game knowing it was early alpha. Another reason the devs actually want the game to go somewhere in just 8 months of develpment this game looks more completed than games like DayZ which has been in early alpha for 4 years the devs of pubg have prooved to us that they actually keep up with what they say the fps have improved since it was released they released a promised new map (well it wasn't released into the full game yet its just later today) and i actually believe in their capabilities to make this an amazing game. So now we reach the conclusion FPS could be much better but they the game is playable (as i said my pc is garbage and i can play it decently well) and the fps are going to be improved later when they have everything they want in the game done. Hackers personally i haven't seen any hackers but ok i guess some people are just salty. The game has hackers yes like every other game but from what i've seen its rare to find one. Bugs this should'nt even be in here the game is EARLY ALPHA YOU BOUGHT IT KNOWING it was EARLY ALPHA of COURSE it HAS BUGS THAT'S WHY ITS IN ALPHA! But from my experience there are basicly no bugs or very rare ones to happen and if they do happen just report them to the pubg team. The game is amazing it has amazing graphics good maps and it has a tactical side to it it's fun to play the game with friends. This game makes your heart beat faster with it's unique battleroyale experience (oh and btw h1z1's battleroyoale took the idea from PlayerUnknown the mind behind pubg) The devs actually want to do something with this game i personally trust the devs i dont ask everyone to trust them but i do i believe that they can go far with this game and they know it too.

review: 其实这款游戏的可玩性很高 但我却不推荐 真的是很累心 服务器不稳定的问题我觉得可以接受 无非是挂加速 我可以忍受你们服务器够烂 可是现在的外挂横行 真的是一点游戏体验都没有 当你在丛林里和别人对枪 对方蹲着出来比摩托车还快 怼到你脸上给你一盆子 还各种嘲讽 真的感觉没意思 从以前的团队指向性很明确的游戏到现在的神仙打架 我是个爱国的人 但在这里我要骂一些国人 开外挂的大部分都是国人 我真的是感到羞耻 开外挂的那些中国人 我希望你们能自知廉耻 不是你开挂杀了几个外国人你就牛逼了 有本事就公平竞技 杀不掉至少输得起 开外挂玩游戏 真他妈的丢人 除了丢人我无话可说 真正让中国电子竞技不能蓬勃的不是人家广电 就是你们这帮开发外挂和买外挂的 不要总推锅给人家广电 输又输不起 打还打不过 这就是这些开挂玩游戏的人脆弱心灵 开个挂找点自尊心 以为有钱买挂多了不起 真的是畸形心理 蓝洞如果再不重视这个问题 抓紧修复这个外挂问题 那真的是离黄不远了 说真的 外挂问题要比服务器问题严重的多 以至于现在可以先抓紧治理外挂再修复服务器了 不然只能自食苦果 .

review: Give it a shot I can't say every negative review here is false. People are just done with it. I get it cause this game has been in the development since a long time and still it has the dsync issues hackers poor optimization poor hitreg and bugs with new updates (which does get resolved kinda quickly) We really want this game to be way better than this. It's not built on UE4 and hence it's perfomance is significantly worse. The wrong company made the right game and that is exactly why these issues exist. The fix pubg campaign is working. I know a lot of people would disagree to it but they probably are too arrogant to notice. There is a significant drop in the number of hackers and aimbotters. I did stumbled upon an aimbotter like yesterday and I reported him. Today I started the game and got the message that he was banned. Battleye anticheat is probably the best I have ever seen since I know how brutal it is in Rainbow six siege.Although pubg also has battleye but it doesn't seem to work that well at all. WE DESERVE that kind of anti cheat and it's probably in the works. They are also adding another anti cheat to the game. If you are wondering to buy the game I would say it deserves a chance. Yeah it's been a long time already but better late than never. THE fix pubg campign ends by december I guess and we shall see where it leads us to. Hopefully a better game.

review: i hate this game. like a lot. but i still play it. and you should too. this game has had consistent problems with cheaters. whether it be in general or the huge influxes that come from China. it also has optimization problems requiring the newer line of cards to run successfully. though most people nowadays will at least have a 1060 the optimization is still not what it could be. requiring keys for cosmetics in a game people still class as early access and incomplete no matter what steam says is a joke.certain regional servers are absolute wank forcing them to use others lowering the overall experience of those players.connection problems during peak times doesn't help. though understandable with over 3 times the active player base than any other game on steam.Umbrella terms like "Xenophobic" used by the creator to desribe concerned players who simply see the immeadiate solution to region lock Chinese players in response to the invasion of OC / NA servers is also a problem. not with the game but with the team as a whole.fixing how an energy drink looks in game instead of fixing the anti cheatthese are all very bad. but you should still probably get this game if you already haven't. it's an enjoyable experience and can honestly be more intense than other options like CSGO H1 or Fortnite if you want to get your fix of FPS action. at the very least enjoy the game and if there's concern's you have like the rest of us you can voice it.

review: The game brings out a quite new and exciting gameplay. You drop onto a land with others grab your gears and fight your own way out. The final phase of it is extremely blood rushing and it gives you a huge feeling of accomplishment after winning it. The worst part of the game is the infinite Chinese players spamming words in all chat. Chinese players are invading every server and they have the largest grp of cheaters as well really giving you headaches when you try to climb up the rank. A region lock will be super good. Even though the game itself is not that good due to the poor graphic and number of bugs. But the gun shooting of the game is really impressive and real. If you ask me I definitely recommend this game for fun. Its price is not high. Even though the game will become boring after 150+ hrs and a few wins It definitely worth the price you paid.

review: This game is really good. Don't believe any of that Chinese hackers BS because I personally haven't encountered any so far. (I'll update once I encounter some.) What you're getting is a solid 100 player battle royale experience that's like no other game I've ever played. But even with the 1.0 update the load times are pretty slow and there are a lot of rendering issues. Matchmaking is nice and fast and even with the poor optimization I still get a decent 60fps on my rig with an I7 6700 a GTX 970 and 8gb of RAM on mostly Ultra settings. If you don't have a fast PC or are concerned about Chinese hackers I'd strongly recommend going with Fortnite (It's not on Steam it's on Epic Games and it's F2P.) Overall I'd recommend this game but be aware that it still has issues worth taking into account.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDITED and recommended I can t in good faith recommend this game. Even in early access. Why?At the beginning the updates made sense. They implement more content because the game was short of it. They improve some things and fixed some bugs... They implemented 4 different weather/enviroment... And they were good communicators.What's the problem then?The game runs like hell even in very decent machines. It affects the game play so people with the recommended requirements or even above find themselves in situations where the FPS (frames per seconds) drops below 30fps.A good example of this is two players one inside a town facing the fields 45FPS another one outside facing the town 25FPSThere are some problems with the high amount of players that are hard to fix. And then there are small annoying mistakes that stay there forever.For example 2 or 3 months to fix the autoselection of servers to the AS (asian servers). Every damn time you choose to play you MUST CHANGE THE SERVER TO NA or EU or whatever. It took them 2 months... And still you can't have a default play mode so you don't have to choose it over and over again... Meaning I don't play 3rd person view and I have to manually change it every f*(ing time I play. It's not so hard to implement.Another thing is the main menu. As you might have heard is a plain website. Yes like the one you have in your firefox or chrome but fullscreen. So if it fails you have to restart it. There must be a reason for this but i find it DUMB.Lately the communication between players and developers is getting stucked in the waiting process of getting something that really matters. More updates no one cares about... Same lack of optimization same annoying default selection same hackers same laggy servers. Bluehole is not addressing this things because they don't want to answer 10 times to the same questions. But if you don't fix the game how do you expect people not to complaing with the huge amount of new players coming.So people know that before 2018 there should be Vaulting system (be ready for all the rest of the real problems to come back). Which is very cool. New map which should be a must by now. FFS. New weapons Always cool and kind of easy. Optimization. FFS FFS FFS FFS FFS .... MORE PROFIT.Good things about the game. 1. If you have NASA PC you'll rule over the rest.2. The fashion. Everyone is playing battle royale games nowadays.3. The "realism". It's not insurgency or squad but it's kind of.4. Playing duo or squad. 5. Each game is different (or it used to be).6. If you don't get your head blown by a sniper or a camper and you get into an actual fight with other player it can be really really funny.The bad things of the gameplay.1. Low FPS2. Delay charging textures that affect the gameplay (it's kind of fixed).3. Being so difficult there should be some improving method for new players like a single player tutorial thing.4. after 2 months playing things are repetitive.5. Everyone is streaming 24 hours / day so you probably will s&amp ck at it for a long long time.If you are a mainstream player get it right now though.TLDR laggy buggy and bad optimized piece of work here. Came to edit my review.Now that the biggest problem (frames per second) is fixed I think the gameplay has improved a lot.The lag is still there but not as annoying as before. Just sometimes makes looting impossible at the beginning of the round.Still can't set FPP (first person perspective) by default . kudos to the developers. But still some things need fix.

review: Well this game sure is fun. The battle royale concept from that classic Japaneese movie sure makes a great game! You drop out of an airplane and scavenge for weapons in a remote island. So the game will be 70% looting. The next 20% will be searching for other players or on the move from the rapidly closing blue zone. The last 10% is a 100% thriller fighting other players. 99 other people want to win. Big odds huh? And if you do win you get that sweet chicken dinner. 99 people dead for a dinner. Sounds fun.

review: This game is so bad. As shooters go the lag is so bad that you can't shoot at a person and hit them if they are moving. I've walked into a building where no one was and then suddenly someone appeared in front of me and shot at me and would bounce around back and forth and I couldn't hit them. Then when I watch the death cam. They didn't hit me either but I still died. The concept is unique. Getting dropped off a plane to a landing point of your choosing. Then fighting everyone to the death with whatever you can scavenge.. But why are we all jumping out of the same plane if we are all enemies? Why do some players always win especially when they are obviously cheating? Why isn't the anti cheat system any good? I don't recommend this game to anyone unless you are a cheater and can show off your total lack of skill by having the computer play the game for you. Even then don't buy it. Not worth it. I wouldn't want to encourage the developers of this game to give up on fixing the problems with it. My copy was given to me by someone I helped on Ark Survival Evolved. I'd give it back if I knew how. P.S. if you want to play me at a game of skill I'll see you on CS GO.

review: PUBG is made addictive for its simple premise you and roughly 100 people (friends included or excluded) scavenge two large maps fight eachother and chase map limiting circles to ultimately become the last man/team standing. There is enough content as there is to sustain its popularity it s got decent shooting mechanics but is weighed down by a lot of environmental issues and shoddy vehicle physics. Item wise almost everything serves its purpose there s just a lot of guns that don t do a whole lot by means of damage. Aside from that I think this game isn t that great because of the development corners that had to be cut to push this game to 1.0 . It wowed people by putting features that they ve had in test servers for months before an official implementation that was not very different from what many had had for months before. The game is still as poorly optimized as ever though it is no longer laggy. True shills of this game would applaud the devs working over the holidays to fix it but really if they knew they were going to ship out something that underperformed before the holiidays then they re just doing the hasty patchwork that wouldn t ve been done if we hadn t raised a fuss over this. There was no real rush to have it go to full launch and they really should have taken their time with it to smooth out terrain issues and server localization. You re still going to buy this game because your friends have it but something tells me that the rest of anything good that will come from this game will happen at much slower intervals or in DLC now that it s been fully released.

review: This game is comparable to minecraft once a good game ruined by updates but at least minecraft is playable. Theyve made 900 million dollars off this game and what have they done thats noticeable? Its been a whole year and the most notable thing theyve changed is the UI a couple guns vaulting and a new map. Dont get me wrong fotnite but at least its constantly updated and is playable. It gets constant updates and new guns every in other week why is that so hard for Pubg to do? "pubg is more realistic" no but thats no excuse to make 3 versions of the same gun with a different looks. Ive got 400 hours on this game and I've had fun times but that was earlier last year when it first launched. I myself don't have many bugs to complain about but my friends are riddled with them. Sometimes there map looks like a potato and its not like they have bad computers its just bugs that cause it. It's been a year with the same bugs and same generic feel. This game will die faster than the wave of open world games a couple years back like dayz sa. This is a unoptimized pile of generic battle royale that takes your money and then uses that money to pay their devs to make more crates for you to buy. they dont care about the players just give them money so they can be happy and do nothing with it. off player unknown

I dont mind if the game crashes I will get back to the game. I dont mind if someone kills me in fair fight. BUT! If you cheat and kill me gets my blood boiling.(Cheating shouldnt be tolerated)+ Fun+ Better than H1z1+ Weapons are more realistic than CSGO Not that easy to memorize the pattern of shooting of different types of guns+ Movement is more realistic than CSGO+ COD is unplayable+ Battlefield is just...+ Solo is fun + Duo is super fun + Squad is just hyper funThis is MORE important than anything else! Cheating! Theres tons of cheating players. I had maybe 1 or 2 before October after that its like every 5th game. Players from other regions with insane rubber or lag Minor bugs arent that important but..

review: I put over 100 hours into the game in 3 weeks (23 days). Lets do some math 23 days * 24 hours/day 552 hours total possible hours.100/552 0.18.Since my purchase I've spent 18% of my life playing this game but wait. I slept every day for about 8 9 hours.23 days * 8.5 hoursOfSleep/day 195.5 hours of sleep.552 total hours 195.5 hours of sleep 356.5 total possible hours. Lets check that % now.100 hoursOfGameplay / 356.5 possible hours 0.28.Take note I work part time and go to school.I worked a total of 57 hours in the last 23 days. Lets take that into consideration 356.5 possible hours 57 FMLHours 300 possible hours.I started class this most recent Monday and have spent 20 hours in school so far.300 possible hours 20 schoolHours 280 possible hours.100 gameplayHours / 280 possible hours 0.36I spent about 36% of my free time since buying the game playing PUBG. This doesn't include pooping homework showering eating brushing my teeth eating flossing eating and driving.I'd add up those and round that percent to about 45%.This is a good game and I'd highly recommend it.

review: The game was really nice and fun before 1.0 release. When the 1.0 came out it started lagging and glitching so bad that it s literally unplayable for me! For example when I see I m behind a corner another person can see 3 metres from the corner so he can kill me even though I think Im save. BUT THIS IS JUST 1 THING and there are many of them for example motorcycle issues rubberbanding (that is fixed but still)... The worst thing on this is the ignorance from developers. Community is spamming their discord and social media that they want to choose map and they always answer "we are working on it". I know nothing about it but it s nearly 2 weeks from 1.0 release and the map selection is not still out and it s not even ANNOUNCED yet and how long can it take to make such a simple thing like map selection? If you re asking "should I buy it?"... NO! Not until they fix it and make it at least as nice as it was before. I hope that the hype around it will stop.

review: A game that was refreshing and new upon release with lots of promise and faith in its development team seems to have only gone downhill in the past few months.Core problems Frequent server maintenance.Controverisal advertisements in the game on buildings etc.Server delay / lag desync.Cheaters speed hackers mainlyInconsistency with guns mainly shotgunsUnderlying problems The lack of new content despite record breaking sales. Updates and content have decreased majorly while sales have been through the roof. There used to be a monthly update that would introduce new guns and now it seems new guns aren't even added every two months.The lack of a new map vehicles calibers gametypes new ANYTHING. With exception for slight map changes and a handful of guns the game is exactly how it launched 8 months ago.Pet peeves Your selected gamemode will revert to TPP after every game. Why isn't this fixed?Absolutely terrible cosmetics.Overall incompetence by developers to create new content have reliable or timely updates and their terrible communication with the community about planned content for the game.The sound of a car engine while you are driving is louder than a shotgun blast in your face.They've been working on a "Quiet area" for the starting lobby for like 4 months.If you've played one match of PUBG you've played a thousand matches of PUBG.

review: This game is very fun and intense but has been completely ruined by chinese players hacking. Not to mention the discourteous nature of many of the chinese players (screaming at you in chinese the entire game while you try to talk to your buddies team killing ect) Devs could make a huge difference in quality for the average player by restricting or region locking servers. Perhaps just locking region for the first 20 or so hours of game or with recent reports would be a good way to keep the nonsense off the (best) NA servers. The game itself however is great. Devs are doing great with optimizing and adding new content. But this unfortunately is very hard to enjoy with the horrible cheating. Devs have tried very hard to remedy this from what I can see but they are in over their heads with the sheer volume of players. More aggressive measures need to be taken to preserve the integrity of the game for those of us who make up the majority of the playerbase and also paid full price for this game. Will change my rating if and when this is fixed.

review: I love this game but i can not reccomend it to anyone looking for a "good time." I picked it up back when it first game out and it had that obvious early access feel to it. But as we are getting closer to release the bugs and lag are still here and probobly will be here for a while. When this game makes it to console it will bring down the standard of quality for every game to come. So we will have Pay to Win in AAA games and "released" games will be mid stage early access titles. At first its flaws bounce off of you the game is fun and intense and enjoyable. As time goes on each bug will become more glaring and slowly suck what little joy you did have out. cons loot is often stubborn leaving you stuck in one spot trying to swipe things over if you use the inventory or mashing F sound design is wildy innacurate. (added car horns but you can hear them barely before you can actually hear the engine bullets sound like they come from the wrong directions in close quarters many annoying background sounds that are just enough like a car in the distance to break immersion.) bullets in transit do not deliver damage if you die before delivery. Not so much a big deal in solo but in squads or duo that last bullet could drop someone. hit registration seems iffy at best and feels like a battlefield game on release. WILL stick Asain players in your game regardless of PING terrain is flawed enough that vehicles are more dangerous that helpfull because one polly at a slightly bad angle can stop you or flip you like there is no suspension. almost unplayable solo Pros The core mechanics of the game are obscenely fun which is why it is as popular as it is. there are chances for some great events to happen fun with friends but it will anger you if you are close enough and are comfortable being a little aggressive with eachother. Chicken dinner is satisfying but not satisfying enough to justify. 6.5 / 10 Player Unknown himself doubts the games polish declaring that it is not "Esport Ready." What i hear when he says that is "this game is garbage once you get past its surface and expose the little flaws that we just cant fix we eventually will be able to fix them but eh."I'm glad he made his money as he is obviously talented but this will be one of the last big early access games. because by the time the game is released everyone is done with it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The reviews...my goodness. This game is the future of FPS. Begins with looting and desperate gunfights as your learn how to position yourself on the map. Its basically a git gud game. Once you do then you can operate as a team know when to loot and when to ditch. Learn how to tell if a house is ouccpied. Spend 80% of the game preparing for a gunfight and trust me you feel some adrenaline win or lose. Feels better to win.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game I'd say is hands down the best game in the "battle royale" category.It has great graphics and a realistic feel and tops all the other battle royale games. It's main competator is probably H1Z1 which has slowly started to go down hill and is getting worse and worse I didn't say Fortnite because the idea is the same but both play out extremly different.Now some of you may be wondering "if it's such a good game why don't you have a lot of hours on it?" The thing is this is for my preferance it isn't a game where I would sit down and play for 7 hours straight as I do with others. The reason behind this is it can get quite repeatative and I sometimes get mad when I die in top 5 even though this happens I still keep coming back to it and that is a sign of a good game.I'm glad that the game is $29.99 because if it were $59.99 I would think it was a poor choise of money. Not saying it's a bad game but just wanted to put that out. I feel like this game is more of a "don't know what to play" type. So more of a side game. In conclusion if your looking for a battle royale game and don't like the wacky and unrealistic feel of Fortnite then this is hands down the most superior game. The graphics and surroundings are great for what it is (a mainly battle based game). Keep in mind that if your computer isn't the best then you might not want to gamble the money on it I would just go to Fortnite until you can get a better computer.Great game overall pleased good work PUBG Corporation.

review: There's nothing really special about PUBG. Like so many other last man standing shoot and loots this ones main selling point is that it is popular.Other than that it is still riddled with performance issues incoherent gunplay and a UI that might as well be the spawn of the lord Belial himself. The main menu feels unresponsive and sometimes it is obvious that it just doesn't work as intended so much so that the developer has included a button to manually restart it with ease.Hopefully standalone titles like this one will die off soon.I would recommend playing any other shooter with a Last Man Standing mode or try PlayerUnknown's Battle Royal mod for ARMA 3 over buying this.

review: This game.When I first saw footage of it when it was in Early Alpha it interested me.Months later I saw it again with much better graphics and gameplay (remember this is compaired to Alpha footage.)PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds is one of those love hate games. You spend over 100 hours in it doing the same thing Spawn. Die. Repeat. with the ocasional Chicken Dinner.However this is one of my favorite games from the previous year that I have picked up and still spend a good amount of time in. Yes there are flaws in this game some that can ruin it but overall it is an amazing game.I highly suggest you play with friends in Duo's or Squad's as it makes the game so much better for what it is a Battle To The Death.

review: This game sucks. Honestly. But let me explain the engine is great physics works guns environment graphics everything is just so great. A actually love this game UNTIL the blue zone. This just fu**s up everything. I understand that it's "IN" to have it intense but what's the real point of having a game that uses many advanced stuff like inventory micro management so many guns and equipment that would offer a great deal of tactical options and then you put a random principle of a spot which you can't distinguish until it's too late and a circle getting smaller and smaller around it putting just too much presure on a player cause you don't make into the circle on time you die you make it and there's already a player who just had more LUCK waiting for you to snipe you from his hiding spot. If you rush there you don't have equipment to stand the ones coming later if you look for equipment you can't pay attention to surroundings and get killed. I like both styles rush fps such as counter strike (spent like thousands of hours with it) as well as tactical fps (like Arma especially the zombie modes D ) but mixing both together and adding the element of enormous time pressure may suit someone but definitely not me. I can't enjoy the possibilites this game offers at all simply because I still have to run somewhere in order not to die and that takes all fun from the game ..... I understand the principle the makers of the game had in mind but please set reasonable time limits to allow the players to enjoy the game. Or make alternative servers with longer time limits i.e. 20 minutes instead of 5 for the player zone to shrink just this simple thing would make the game more enjoyable )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 近年来 北京市互联网迅速发展 据中国互联网信息中心 CNNIC 2005年1月公布的第十五次互联网报告统计显示 我国上网计算机数量已达到4160万 上网总人数达到9400万 其中北京地区上网人数为402万 CN域名数全国432077个 北京地区有87371个 占总数的20.3% WWW站点总数为668900个 北京地区有125297个 占总数的18.7% 然而 北京地区已备案的网站只有不到两千家 所以根据我国 计算机信息网络国际联网安全保护管理办法 的第二章 安全保护责任 中的第十一条规定 用户在接入单位办理入网手续时 应当填写用户备案表 备案表由公安部监制 第十二条规定 互联单位 接入单位 使用计算机信息网络国际联网的法人和其他组织 包括跨省 自治区 直辖市联网的单位和所属的分支机构 应当自网络正式联通之日起三十日内 到所在地的省 自治区 直辖市人民政府公安机关指定的受理机关办理备案手续 前款所列单位应当负责将接入本网络的接入单位和用户情况报当地公安机关备案 并及时报告本网络中接入单位和用户的变更情况 我处定于即日起集中开展中小网站备案工作

review: This game is truely amazing both for the work they have done and the features in place. I love this game 100000000 times more than king of the kill as king of the kill is arcadey you can jump around headshoting people with shotguns jump out of a car at 100mph and the aiming is all off. PUBGs offers a more realistic battleroyale. Better life like features. No stupid looking skins or camos. More guns vehicles and an ability to add attachments to ur weapons. This game is addicting as hell. And i know alot of people are giving out about the optimistaion but the work they have done in the last 2 months is huge. Every beta week the developers worked hard to make the gave better every day . I mean i have a mediocre pc a fx 8320 and 1060 it was very hard to run at the start but now its ok do i mind no because the devlopers are onstantly updating us everyweek they know what people want and they are doing that . People said they could not run the game and they are constantly optimising for example a huge update for minimum spec pcs is coming out after just one month of it being released. As for servers and other mechanics the developers tell us what is wrong and what is going to change. They dont just say oh some techinical difficulty they let us know what is actually happening. Last of all the developers have said there is going to be full mod support in the future meaning dayZ mod possibly or TDM and other gamemodes . The gun mechanics is also truely amazing the level of detail is sick . Hopefully people you will buy this game i mean the developers are working so hard on this game and it is sooo good. Check out my profile btw if you wanna team up or just check out screenshots or message me . ALSO I LOVE SOME RUSKI HARDBASS
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is great actually but still needs some fixings. Anything else is working perfectly I think
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I don't write these very often so when I do it means something really got my attention. This is one of the best games ive seen come out in a long while. I looked at it a couple times in the store and really didn't feel interested at all in it but once playing I keep playing like an addict. Keep in mind if looking to purchase though the game is still in early access so there are some bugs which ill put in the cons section of this. So anyway here are the things that really make me like this game and things i cant wait to be fixed. prosTactical feeling game especially in a group strategy is key from the very start and being able to adapt a must.Quick matches for a game that could easily have somthing drawn out for hours usually only lasts 30 mins or so even though the matches feel like youve been in the match all day.Challenging I have yet to win a match but have lasted down to the top 5 a couple times and the start of the game is just as fast and hard to survive early as it is later on.Replayable You are on the same map every game but each match is different in its own way where a lot of shooters need different levels to keep the game interesting this one dont need it especially with a 8x8 km island thats been well createdGame has lots of room to grow in gear and modes. consnetcode the game is new and in early access to i know performance optimizations havn't been completed yet so theres some issues with lag at times(perhaps not the best server company idk)bugs with equipment at times.picking up loot at times picking up fresh items feels clunky and you don't pick up the item u want to there is a solution by hitting tab and right clicking what u want but this also brings up your character menu and blocks your visual.balancing while it is fairly balanced there are a few exceptions where an item seems a little off of what it should be. overallvery worth it imo especially with thinking of the potential this game has at full release and after.

review: Incredible fun game to play!It is a very competitive yet enjoyable game. I am not that great at "PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUND" but I still love it. It is great how they let you choose if you want to play first person or third person that means that a player in third person will not have a significant advantage over a player in first person. It is incredible that this game is still in early access. But there are some bugs but thats what to expect with a game still in early access. The amount of feedback that Bluehole ( the owners of the "PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUND" ) receive and listen to is great. The test servers are a great feature in my opinion. Personaly I used to play "Counter strike Global Offensive". The transition to"PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUND" was an easy one. Valve ( the owner of " Counter strike Global Offensive" ) did a horrible job of listening to the community and this led to a lot of the player base to move on and it also made the community very toxic.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUND is a great Game! Worth every penny!

review: More fun than CS GO or Rainbow Six Siege. Different type of game and lots of people playing. Game has a lot of strategy but luck also comes into play as well. The more I play the more fun it gets. Really nice that you can leave or rage quit whenever without penalty and it does not hurt the other players maybe just your squad. Which is really nice because no one has to tolerate toxic players.Queue times are really fast. Nobody can type its voice only communication which takes out a lot of salt.Just wish there were more maps or game modes. Still a great game worth buying just as it is though.UPDATE I loved this game so much and wished it would stay good forever. But now its impossible to play without cheaters in every match. Which just ruins the game so badly. Most of them come from china and queue NA servers. Bluehole refuses to do anything about them because it would lower their profits from so many cheaters rebuying. Which is a massive slap in the face to all of us who didn't cheat. Which will eventually kill the game like many before it. I used to play a few hours a day now I have played maybe 1 game in the last two weeks. Also the new map is terrible.Its really truly sad. The game had so much potential but greedy devs ruined it. Just as they failed to add new game modes that are both relevant and fun. Instead wasting servers on first person sad.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: "Playerunknown's Battlegrounds" or you could shorten it to "PUBG". Nevertheless this game is far from a masterpiece but still holds quite a place in pc gaming as this game is basically a highly budgeted and worked on mod of previous battle royale game modes from popular titles such as ARMA H1Z1 and DayZ.Gameplay wise this game lacks a variety of goals sure the main objective of each and every multiplayer match you partake in is to achieve first place out of 90 to 100 players. This may seem easy to some but it once a game or two of solo is played you start to realize that this will take some practice practice which is only obtainable in an online session. Yes the widely praised phenomenon known as "PUBG" does not have an 'offline mode' now this is not what makes the game BAD rather the lack of a training area where you can try each and every weapon and item out in the game before you go out to shed some blood. Now there is a type of training area in one of the preparation phases for one of the two maps (as of writing this) but as soon as you manage to get to one of the weapon benches you may only end up with one firearm to test out before you get shoved into a plane. This shows that a large skill gap between players is present in the game as not everyone has the time to try out every gun themselves before a match starts while the other dedicated player are able to wipe the floor with newcomers who may expect a tutorial which they will never get other than the pop ups telling you which button does what.The lack of an offline mode is a real punch in the gut for me when I play this game although there are areas of it that shine and if worked on may be able to compensate for the supposed inability to add singleplayer testing grounds. Where this game lacks for in features it makes up for in character customization there are an abundance of t shirts pants and hats for your character to wear.I feel I have written for too long so I will say this PUBG is an intense fight to the death shooter that requires patience skill and a lot of frustration management. I will give this game an 8/10 for the reasons I have listed above. Yospy

review: Are there hackers? Maybe. But I've yet to see anything blatant. Have I suspected people of hacking? Yea. There was a guy who ran up on me in a barn skipped all the loot and went right to where I was hiding and killed me. And I had been hiding there for a good 5 minutes so he did not see me run in as this was around third circle squad match (My squad all died at the start).But this review is just to say. Yes there are probably hackers but its not "litterally every person that kills you is a hacker" situation.Anyways. I have no issues with the game there's a little lag at the start of the match but I've yet to crash my FPS is 180 Ultra (Get out of 4K resolution idiots then your FPS wont suck). I find squad mode the most fun but I wish there wasnt so many forigner on our servers. Cant do anything when all three of your squadmates are Chinese but some Chinese try to speak english and help you so its ok sometimes. If you like to scavange buildings run open fields fearing a bullet to the back and blue walls of electricity I reccomend this game. Dont let all the "hacker" doomsaying drive you away.

review: The game performs ok ish and I never found any gamebreaking bugs but the game is still boring. The review is negative because the game is just not that good. Honestly I have no clue why it is so popular. The controls are clunky the camera swings around like a drunken sailor whenever you attempt to do anything and the encouraged behavior is still camping like a for 20 minutes before getting dinked from a hundred meters by somebody you never saw because of random events.I'll theorize. Imagine the finest bottle of scotch. When given to a scotch expert they will be extremely happy about it but give that same bottle of scotch to the everyday person and they will resent it even though the expert deemed it worthy of dying for. Most people would prefer to drink a glass of coke because it is designed for everybody. I think there are no good or bad games yes there are but games aren't inherently good or bad they are good or bad relative to their audience. PUBG is an excelent coke meaning it's generic and fun ish for everybody but nothing exeptional or new per say. Overall I feel like pubg is not a bad game it's just bland. A glass of coke designed to suit everybody without accidentally being too good to make somebody fall in love with it.The game is hugely random for what feels like for the sake of being random. Loot is random meaning you sometimes just randomly lose because you got ed with bad gear. Happens quite often actually. Red zones don't do anything 95% of the time but once every twenty games they instantly again randomly decide to kill you. Why are they a thing if not to randomly make worse players win and feel good about themselves because they don't know the only person on the server with a decent winrate randomly got blown to bits. The zone placement is random meaning if you don't land in the middle of the map you will likely have to get a vehicle and make a lot of noice alerting any potential snipers on the map and probably getting your head relocated around your car ceiling. The game at the same time tries to be skill based and highly random which will make every victory feel like your accomplishment and every defeat just a random occurance even though you clearly made mistakes. One could say the randomness protects the ego and the perceived skill inflates it.Vehicles are essential for when the zone has ed you. They are incredibly loud can be heard miles away and are relatively easy to shoot at once you get the hang of it. Sometimes you don't even have to get shot in one because they decide to kill you just cause they can. Vehicles regularly just because they can flip causing them to be fatal. Collisions with other vehicles are extremely bad.There are many guns in this game but they are all extremely similar. Sure the fire rates recoils and damages are different but the difference is extremely minor. For example except for the akm all assault riffles do the exact same damage with slight differences in accuracy stability and fire rate. The damage difference between the akm and other ARs is so small it doesn't have any signifficant break points. It only makes your opponents' armor drain slightly faster and forces them to use maybe one more medical thingamajig. All snipers can oneshot you to the head even through the lvl 1 helmet most bolt action rifles ccan do it even though the level 2 helmet. All bodyshots need 3+ hits except for sniper and shotguns. All firing speeds for automatics are near equal to firing speeds of other automatics and the same applies for shotguns/snipers.Some will say it's more fun with friends but so is everything else. Sure pubg has hillarious moments when you teamkill somebody by driving over them but those are only funny once and don't really need the specific game to be funny. Accidental teamkills in other games feel just as funny for the first time. The revive mechanic in place in duo and squads is kind of meh because getting somebody up is usually a mistake and will result in your demise except for when you down somebody and their whole squad is behind that corner to get them back up.I can't recommend this game to anyone not because it is bland but because fortnite does what pubg does better with a nice artstyle and more innovative mechanics. Fortnite is also free has better visibility and actively prevents non expert players from sniping you across the map.The dev is also an so there is that.

review: Great game but let's be real for a moment.Shooting due to the engine's limitations (I believe it must be the engine at least) isn't as smooth as one would find on BattleField or COD.Graphics could be worse but aren't amazing either.So far they have fixed a lot of the loading problems buildings seem to load much quicker and more smoothly than before. But that's not saying that everything is fine...everything is not fine. Now I would recommend this game albeit all that...but the one thing...*Deep breathe* the one damn thing that pisses me off the most in shooters.Is elements of the game that reduce a competition of skill down to sheer damn luck.Yes I'm talking about the blue circle wall of death.You spawn in a good area? Got decent loot?Wall is on the other damn side of the map...Sure fine I'll drive there.And tell everybody throughout a mile around me continiously where I am at. Everyone who probably has just as decent equipment as me if not better. And I have no clue as to where THEY are.So they kill me why? Because they got a better spawn.Now let's say you got lucky and were one of these 'Wall Campers' (Be real guys we'd all do it if we got lucky enough to...)Now you have to pray to the almighty wall gods that it won't you at the last second and appear on the other side of the map again. Giving any players/teams the opportunity to wall camp YOU.Please fix the wall it is a massive detriment to the gameplay in general. At least reduce the damage per tick and keep it a constant thoughout the game. There is NO need to kill players outside the wall every 2 seconds! Just give them the initiative to GTF inside!

review: I know many like this game but in my opinion this game is pure trash. Controls are horrid the physics/engine is one of the worst I have ever played imagine playing a shooter in Hitman. The game is a crap shoot the first 5 minutes are pure luck not skill. Your sucess depends on what house you walk into and what weapons you find not your skill. I have played about 60 rounds and the only guns I find are shotguns and Uzi's the best way to win this game is to literally DO NOTHING. Land on a roof in teh middle of the map go prone and take a walk outside and enjoy fresh air. I have never played a game that ed up a concept so badly. The map is too big so you spend 85% of your time just running it shrinks too fast the lack of decent weapons is pretty much a loot box crap shoot the hit box is one of the worst there is controls are horribly sloppy there is 0 progression system so you can't really do a singel thing to increase your luck no traps vehicles randomly work or not the movement is more annoying that your drunk mother. So if you are a shotgun sniper or you don't mind spending $30 on a game that's pretty much a running simulator this is your game!DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Get The Culling (Which PUBG completely ripped off and did a worse job of) instead where you get to use actual skills and tactics. This game is just chickens running with thier heads cut off and it's just not fun unless you get insanely lucky and find something other than a bull shot gun. TL DR This game is about 5% skill 95% luck of what you find wehre you land. Map is way oversized and shriks at a rapid pace so your time is spent running around staying in the zone and looking for guns. Horribly optimized pathetically buggy and just an overall effort on the concept. My best rounds which produce the most in game currency literally come from doing absolutely nothing. I just finished 3rd in a round where I just went prone in a field and left and I was killed by the map shrinking not a player. That's how dumb this game is. Could have been a great game but it's an unfinished pile of steaming dog doo doo.
