review: This game had and still has a lot of potential to be something better than it is.These are some of the reasons i keep playing despite the negative reviewFluid and strong gun play and movement mechanics ( althought a little buggy)Intense gameplay really brings me back to the Dayz mod for Arma 2 and it's rare that any game has made me feel that.Excellent weapon variety although SMG's shotguns and pistols are completley useless passed 3 minutes.Continued support. The devs are going to keep adding more maps and variety into PUBG ( hopefully)Despite these prosThere are a lot of cons.For a finished game it's incredibly buggy and poorly optimized STILL.There is a plauge of cheaters. It's uncommon to find a godlike auto aiming through the mountains insta killer but it happensMost cheaters are more insidious than that.They use wall hacks auto aim sound boosters instant healing the list goes on. these are harder to detect but its in about every single game.The spectator option is still broken along with the death cam so if you wanted to find out if the person who killed you was cheating you have to question if it wasn't just PUBG's buggy inconsistancy.I want to reccomend this game its truly fun when it can be butToo many hackers absolute crap loot boxes.PING LOCK SERVERS OR AT LEAST REGION LOCK!Other developers have figured this out why can Bluehole????

review: Honestly i never played a battle royale type of game like PUBG or h1 but now i have and now i understand why its so pumped up about. I never fail to have a good time while playing solo duos or in squads really loving how it goes i just wish that we had more time for firefights and not to be worrying about the circle coming in on us to be able to have a good firefight espically in duos and squads as the players get downed ans can be picked back up. Love the idea of creates for customisation ect also the game has no steam badge which should be implemented of course after the game gets fixed in the areas of concern this includes server stability and they also need to change the server texture stash as sometimes i get to the ground they wernt fully loaded leaving me stranded until they loaded up of course at its stage this game is great and theyre is so much hype around the game which i hope doesnt fade for a long time! Keep up the good work devs love the game and hope to see many updates and fixes in the future 8.5/10EDIT After the game being out you would think they would have fixed there ing servers and its ridiclous constantly getting errors after matches or when im trying to play the game with connection issues this game is really terrible for that and for running into many other issues and the dev's say it can be competitive and for tournuments? review: This is a fantastic game. The constant movement casued by the circle makes this infinitly better than almost every other game out there and I love not having to craft anything. However this game does have problems. The servers are s*** the devs used to ban people for being near streamers but overall it is still a great experience.If you have a good PC that is. My rig has an i5 22GB RAM and GTX 970 and this game barely runs on medium and doesn't get much better on lower settings. I very rarely get 60 FPS it tends to float around 40 50 and sometimes drops down to 30. However for me the gameplay experience outweighs the bad performance which has been getting progressively better as the devs keep working on the game. Thumbs up from me.

review: It was such a fun game at the start but lately not so much. You spend 25 minutes looting only to get killed by someone running faster than your car invisible completely silent shots or someone who can hit 3 consecutive headshots. Instead of new guns and cosmetics we need an anti cheat. Anti cheat or perma ban traced to an IP because right now they just make a new account and back to hacking. Used to be my go to game and the one game I considered an early access success story but now some days I don't even want to play it because it's not worth the frustration. As of now I wouldn't recommend this game. However with an anti cheat and good banning system yes I would.Update bluehole implemented changes to the anti cheat and also will be including a kill cam after you die. The number of hackers I run into has dropped and i can recommend this game to whoever has an interest in it. its not perfect by any means but it may just be the first early access game to be finished.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Really great game and recommend. I am in the US and a casual gamer that does not have a temper tantrum when I don't get a kill but it unfortunate about the cheaters. I have only run across one so far and was able to report the death cam video so hopefully the player will have consequences. I find it interesting that people cheat at games. How satisfying can it possibly be to cheat to win vs. actually getting good at the game? Maybe I am an old fart (44 year old US Navy Boatwains Mate) but I would think it would be more satisfying and rewarding to get good at something fairly. Now back to the game review. For me as a casual gamer it gives the satisfaction of a very intense experience thta is a lot of fun and I look forward to the continue developments that come out. Great job and see everyone online. I'll be next to the toilet with the motorcyle on holding a shotgun

EDIT 15/11/2017 All seriously developers have taken feedback and they seem to try right now. The review above is canceled. Thumbs up from me!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 99 hours in... i think it's fair to write a review.It's a love hate relationship with PUBG at the moment. There are times that I feel that the RNG gods cursed me with desync and lag.And then there's time where my own greed got the better of me.And there's also funny moments of oh sh*t i flew off the cliff where you can't help but laugh at yourself.Despite the lack of optimization the game runs decent enough for you to enjoy the psychotic side of your nature by trying to kill and ultimately be the last person standing in the battle royale.Pros BR style with safe+danger zones created to force players to engage.Enough variety of loot in terms of weapons/attachments.HUGE play area if you land on one end of the map expect to be running/driving into the safe zone as soon as possible.the RNG keeps you from getting bored. Cons Requires more optimizationServer performance may require work. I get better performance on AS servers compared to SEA.Lack consistency in loot spawns last update kinda broke a few things.TL DR If you're on the fence on getting this game get it while it's hot now and enjoy it.Till then am still looking forward to my chicken dinner...REVIEW UPDATE 5th August 2017 after many updates the game is getting better in terms of optimization. Although some may argue about the crates being sold it's all going to the charity event that they are hosting.and with close to 200 hours in game it still provides that adrenaline rush and the shakes especially when you're in the top 5.REVIEW UPDATE 15th Nov 2017 close to 400 hours in the game this is how it stands.recent additions more weaponsFPP only servers (why they need to add that in is beyond me the game is fine without them)Vaulting ( no more button mashing crouch jump coming soon )the main focus at this point is to cut down on the amount of hacks available to the game and optimize the network latency during game play. personally my shift has been from getting the chicken dinners to going all out aggro firefights for the kills. much more rewarding in that sense.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros Great concept good community with a large competitive player base ranging in abilities from professional players to to first timers. Lots of community driven material available to learn from through streamers and channels on social media.Game offers a really interesting mix of FPS and a tactical element which is missing in many FPS's today.Different from other FPS's that I have played There is a good level of balancing between close quarter high Damage Per Second pvp and long ranged tactical sniping. Neither being too overpowered. There are many many weapons to choose from each having advantages and disadvantages and some being very specialised weapons for a specific niche. Knowing when and how to use each of these weapons can add a HUGE advantage to your side.Being over run by several rivals? position yourself well and gain the surprise advantage and chop them to pieces with an SMG or any high burst weapon. Have lots of ground to cover before you reach your target? Attach a good scope to a rifle and your good to go. And If you have a suppressor or a flash hider even better! Not only will they not know what hit them but if you do it well enough they wont even know which direction their being hit from!Varying weather conditions add an awesome mix to game play mid day sunset heavy rain thick fog. Each offeres a range of advantages and disadvantages and require a slightly different approach in gameplay players all have their own preferences depending on their play style.Cons At the most frustrating of times it can only be described as bad coding.Can on occasions cause even high end machines to struggle with textures not rendering or freezing part way through a render. Movement bugs in terrain that can not only glitch or get your in game character stuck permanently but can end up freezing/crashing the game and rendering the computer useless to everything but a forced shutdown.There are a a whole manner of glitches when using vehicles of any sort (currently being looked into by dev's)Sound balancing is non existant and there is little to no settings to control sound/volume levels. It can go from pin drop silence and suddenly having your ear drums perforated with a single shot being fired explosives such as gernades or an air rade is out of the question. Need to mention aeroplanes or parachutes where a player cannot even hear team mates even when speaking to them through skype or teamspeak for example.Dont even get me started on exploitive software and hacks. Its rampant Its pretty common at the moment to come across someone using a ESP of some sort better yet Aim Bots.Has been ongoing for months and months and so far there doesnt seem to be a permenant fix or an acknowledgement of its existence even!. They are easily available and can be purchased for as a little as $50 and the players who have been using them are still using them 6months later. IP bans might keep the problem away for the short term (this stance is currently not adopted by the dev's) a longer term fix needs to be implemented.To conclude.Its important to note that the game is still in development its not complete by any means its a long way from where the game first started with some major hurdles being overcome and it still has a long way to go. Players must know and understand what this means before they sign up to buy and consider dedicating too much time any game thats in a beta phase.In saying that PUBG does offer a lot to both hard core gamers and the casual gamer This does not need to be repeated it can be seen by the player base and how they feel about the game it is a hit atm and after some work and some polishing up it will be even better!Although I do enjoy this game from a technical point of view I have decided to give it a down vote.I hope i've been balanced in this approach I would still reccomend it to anyone who might be thinking of giving it a try give this game a chance and im sure you will come to love it.Thanks for reading.Shinra.Suggestions to Dev's Needs a practice mode or a continuous re spawn mode where players can practice without the headache of going back to lobby and restarting a new game over and over again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've played for only a week and I only have 40 hours. But since I got the game I never had any problem like other players. The servers always responded to me it would find a match very quickly and something people always comment a lot about is about bugs. I gotta say it is not perfect and no game is perfect. A game without bugs is not a game even if there's some bugs that can be big and maybe unplayable at times. But to be honest the only bugs I saw were with the bike when you wanna pick it up and seems like it goes underneath the ground but then after a few seconds comes back to normal.Those problems that most people comment is very relative because sometimes it is not the fault of the game. At first I had a internet connection that would make me appear half way done of the plane or maybe appear already in the island where the last jump was. But after going to my company and asking for a little fix and get more Megabits of Internet I could play normally and the issue went away.I also saw that there's a test server and many people play there to see the new stuff like new weapons maps enviorement and I saw videos there of people complaining about bugs problems etc. If it is a test server I think it is obvious you will find bugs as it is a test. A way the creators give the player of the game to test their new stuff for the game and see what do they think about it.I honestly do recommend this game and problems with bugs hackers server etc. It's relative. Also it doesn't depend if your pc is so good and expensive I have a computer with I5 3rd Generation AMD Raedon HD7770 series 8GB RAM (kinda old pc for what the game is) and my game works perfectly fine I know at a low graphic settings but I still enjoy it and have a lot of fun. Issues won't happen to every single one who buys this game. I had the same fear to buy this game back then after the 1.0 realese because of what everyone said of how it was but after buying it I regret not buying it before.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Great game to play in a team. There is some in game voice channel however people currently just use it to spam weird crap.I'm sure more content will be added soon but for now it's worth your money as it is.

review: PUBG is a game where players require the smallest amount of skill such as selecting items in your inventory and placing your crosshair on an enemy player who has no idea where you are if you are more than 100m away with a silencer. The real factor of who wins the games in this is luck. You might loot some clothes while nearby someone is fully geared. The zone can also tip in one's favour and the other's demise if for example the zone is behind a rock for someone while the other person has to run out in the open to stay in the zone. OK game but don't waste money

review: The basics are deceptively simple but there s a level of mastery that can be attained in PUBG and I can t write that off. The more I play the more I appreciate the depth of the game. It s exhilarating to pick off an enemy running across a field and it s terrifying to be that person running across the field. There are a million different scenarios similar to this that unfold in every match of PUBG. For a game that s still in Alpha it s almost a pleasant surprise that server stability is one of the biggest issues facing the game. Desync is a bigger killer than any gun. Servers and netcode can be upgraded and improved thankfully. It s a pity that players have to butt heads with uncooperate internet tubes but Bluehole Studios have made an immersive and energizing game that improves upon nearly every aspect of the budding survival arena genre.

review: Advisory I understand this game is early access I know that it has lots of potential and some things the developers are already aware of that doesn't change my opinion or review of this product and despite the fact that I did enjoy it I'm still not recommending it until the obvious things are resolved.My ReviewThe game has an obscene amount of bugs whether it be ridiculous amounts of illogical lag or dual scopage on a single weapon there are some things that just can't be overlooked especially when their gamebreaking. My first issue with the game is the god awful rendering. I don't know what kind of drugs the developers have been doing but the fact that so many players have issues where the buildings dont render in properly (Some cases like my own involve having high end systems that even on low settings still get this rendering issue) leaving you to run around or stand there until they do so you can grab a weapon and NOT get killed within the first few minutes of landing on the ground. This has happened frequently for awhile and yet still no fixes other than some 3rd party "mods" which can still get you banned for using them and lets not forget the occassional crash and disconnect because the game is terribly optomised.Despite this though the game is ridiculously fun (when it actually works) especially with friends. Having played it for awhile I can't recommend this game to anyone for the price their selling it at. They need to fix these game breaking bugs or reduce the price because no way in hell are players who suffer at the hands of these bugs going to put up with them and drop the money for the game. This game has a lot of potential but it's not one I wish I had bought.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hello Surviour It looks like you are reporting a cheater/hacker in the game. We apologize for the frustration from the experience and our team is working on blocking out those users and cheats and improving our systems to detect those. Unfortunately it isn't something that can be quickly done but we assure you that we are focused on removing any users who are creating an unfair gaming environment. The best option to report those users is with the in game report system as that will report these issues directly to our team. We ask that you continue to use that system in the game for quicker reporting for any future reports.We will however forward the mentioned issue here to our team to investigate and they will handle the case accordingly with our terms and services.We will continue to work towards creating a fair gaming environment for all our players and hope that you can continue to enjoy playing our game.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS NOT JUST A GAME THIS IS BATTLE ROYALE

review: You buy this game you download it you launch it. Looks fun plays fine. so why the bad Rev? Well lets start out by saying if you do a simple .INI change in your gaems files. You basically have wall hacks/ESP. Have the devs fixxed this? no. They put in micro transations though. Does the game run well? no not really. I have a great desktop and max out at around 80 fps. Why does that matter you may ask? I have a 144hz monitor that my computer runs ALL other games fine at 144+fps. but not this POS game. Oh i forgot to mention. When you get into a game. Im not kidding I have done the math. atleast 30% of the games will have hackers or poeple playing on the wrong server to get a higher ping. IN this game the entcode is so aweful that the higher the ping the more advantage you have. make since right? This game has great concept but like all other Early access games. the Developers don't care and are just looking for more money. Instead of fixxing the game on PC they are going to launch it on xbox.....why not finish your game on PC and port it over to xbox tweak a fgew things change HUD UI ext. but instead lets just push our game to a console and watch it unveil. I don't get how they say its gunna run on xboix 60 fps when 70% of computers can't even get a constant 60fps. DOn't buy this game. If you do I'm sorry youll put as much hours into as me and realise how it really is.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can understand why people find this game buggy and irritating i have died at least 10 times to either a bug hacker or silent buggy. But in all my years of playing videogames PUBG is one of my favorite games of all time. You might have some difficulties with the controls or rules in the beginning and you are going to die a significante amount of times before you get any good at the game. But when you reach the 50 150 hour mark you begin to understand how the game works. Sure you are going to drop in school and die to someone else because they either were lucky enough to find a weapon or simply just better than you. But with every defeat you automaticly get better and better at the game. My best tip i can give to a new player is "dont give up" because you are going to lose maybe 50 times in a row before you are greeted with a chicken dinner. Sounds like s*it i know but dying is a part of the game and because of the 1 life you are given the victory in the end is the sweetest most awesome thing ever. When you die in overwatch CSGO league of legends etc you can for the most part always come back from the fight because death is just as much worth as cupnoodles. But in PUBG its just game f*cking over and i think that is the best thing about the game because it improves your skills continuously. Dying over and over again is a pain in the but you slowly begin to understand where to drod which weapons to pick and much more in no time trust me. Servers can be harsh but for the most time a single "refresh" solves everything. And unlike other videogames and companies Bluehole acctualy changes the game and makes it better and better with each update. And for those out there mad about the 1 life gag then try again ok? you are going to win eventualy and that victory feeling will only get more and more awesome with each win you get. The game have some faults here and there but im sure they are going to be fixed in thefuture and cmon the game is not that unplayable i think people get mad cuz they keep dying and have to restart. Te game mechanincs itself are not that aweful belive me.mouses will be thrown keyboard buttons will fly across your room your pulse will reach over 9000 each time you make it to the top 10 but trust me victory has never been so sweet. I would definitely recommend this game to any new player or experienced fps player. Shorter and more specific review its a good game git gut losers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Take Day Z remove everything but the combat and the looting refine it and put in an arena survival/DeathMatch theme. And you got the essentials of PlayerUnknowns battleground.I'd recommend this game to anyone that +Liked DayZ especially its PvP combat and Weapon Mechanics +Enjoy Competitive Survival games +Want a relatively fast paced game (factoring in that 100 people are playing per match) +Can enjoy the little victoriesHowever I would not recommend this to those that Can't cope with failure/dying especially in rapid succession. Don't like or are poor at utilizing dirty tactics (Ambushing Sniping Ganging up on etc) Have a low too medium performance PC (my PC struggles to run this game and I got 12 gigs of ram and a 3.60Ghz Quad core)

review: This game is a lot of fun.It's probably one of the most entertaining and addicting games I've played all year. As with any early access game there are going to be issues. The issues I've encountered frequently in PUBG (Mostly lag sync and server crashing issues) don't occur enough to make the overall experience less enjoyable. As of this review I've played a pretty good amount of PUBG and I've maybe experienced 2 or 3 hackers in all the games I've ever played. It's frustrating to lose to a hacker but that doesn't happen nearly as frequently to me or my friend group as it appears to occur to others. Are there issues with the game? Absolutely. This game needs a LOT of work done to resolve the network issues and sync lag. However the game is a ton of fun to play and all the issues I've experienced really don't take away from the general enjoyable experience (at least in my opinion). I think it's worth playing.

review: So Players Unknown I personally never write reviews its something I don't touch base on very often even on early access games but this game is the exception setting aside the cons (servers optimization) which should be expected considering the game hasnt been out for a month yet its amazing. I've played king of the kill for hours but always felt like something was missing or wasn't that well thought most of the guns are useless but playing this game feels so rewarding i've spent hours playing duo's and solos and it has yet to get old getting loot seems rewarding rather than a task. Guns in this game are balanced and each feels fair even pistols have a good amount of heft hitboxes as far as my encounters have been spot on and just the overall combat in this game feel amazing i would say though that the jumping needs some work seems sluggish/unresponsive but besides that movement is spot on. Graphically speaking if you have a beefy enough computer (1070 and up) running this game in ultra is beautiful the detail put into buildings is amazing I love the fact that theres some destructability (nice touch for throwing in nades' and what not through doors) and the layout of the map is spaced well and you don't have to go into cities for everything item placement is spot on and spawn rates are fair. Concluding this is one of my favorite purchases on steam and some of the most fun i've had in a while weekly updates are amazing and the quality as it stands is superb considering how young the title is I can only see the game getting even better as time goes and I cant wait to see whats to come overall 9/10 from meEdit This game is still awesome and the devs have worked so hard on this game i cant wait for the new map and for 1.0 to release )

review: PROS Unique mostly well implemented concept. Broad maps with unpredictable twists and turns. Hair raising adreneline even when you aren't in compact.CONS The hitreg isn't perfect The game can be a little laggy even with modifications to your computer. This is problematic given how quickly you die even while wearing the best armor you can scavenge. Rendering issues. Often parts of the world won't render even after you land and you have to spend several crucial seconds waiting for the details to come through before you can actually start looting seconds your enemies might spend finding ammo to fill you with bullets.TLDRBuggy and sometimes a bit unfair but a fun adreneline pumping ride. Buy at your own discretion.

review: This game is a great game especially if you have a group of friends to play with. As someone who played in beta I can appreciate the updated looks in 1.0. Although the new map could have been better my friends and I don't enjoy it as much. Also rubberbanding and server issues are still a problem. Overall the game is rewarding and fun due to being able to come back and win your first chicken dinner. But for some reason 1 isn't enoung. I like being able to choose to play in first person or 3rd person. Both are challenging but its more personal prefrence. You may think the game is RNG and luck but really if you are a good player you can get to the top 10 or 5 in any given game because you are able to adapt to any situation thrown at you. This is why I will not say the game is repetitive. The amount of differnet encounters keeps you on your toes. On the negative side the game lacks customization. When you first start the game you are able to customize your characters apperance. Opening crates using in game currency is cool but you only get the same few items because everything decent is so rare. Customizing looks in this game sucks. Although when you get in game you can find the same 3 levels of a helmet vest and backpack. There should be different looks that a player can have in the game or different optimizaions that each vest or backpack can give. There also shouldn't be this idea in my head that I want M416 and Kar98k everytime I start a game. Its my goal. Why? The guns aren't balanced. There are guns way better then others and not many differernt options found within the game. The reason I keep coming back is the burning desire to win and get kills not because the game is balanced. The gameplay could be a lot smoother but it isn't bad and there are still too many bugs for a 1.0 game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Okay so let me just start by saying that this game is fantastic and the level of quality is amazing for something that is still in alpha. Now let's move onto the actual meat of this. The Good PUBG does a lot really well. Gameplay is fast and intense and literally gets your heart pumping. It's equal parts DayZ and Counterstrike with a reminiscence of STALKER. This game doesn't seem to require a legendary PC to run. In fact mine's just on the high end of average (i5 CPU GTX 970 GPU) and I've had absolutely no graphical issues. On top of this the connection seems good. I've had no lag issues outside of the staging area which doesn't affect gameplay at all. Once I'm in the overworld I'm good to play. I know a lot of people had issues with this recently but I think it's been patched out. You get put in matches fast. I have never once had to wait for a match. Battlegrounds is insanely easy to pick up. If you've ever played a shooter you can play this. I've only got about 7 hours on record and I've made it to the top 10 25% of the time. And I would only rate myself a mediocre to fair FPS player. There is a lot of character customisation for a FPS if you're into that sort of thing. You can earn credits in game which can be spent on rewards packages which in turn unlock more customisation. You can also buy and sell such things through the Steam Marketplace. There does not seem to be a lot of hacking going on which is nice for a huge game like this. The game sounds perfect. Guns sound like guns footsteps sound like footsteps and this is a game where both of those sounds are absurdly important. The Bad Of course as with almost all games there are some issues to point out. For starters for a game that claims to be a tactical shooter the rounds are a little too fast. This is caused by the next point. To control the gameflow the playable area of the map shrinks forcing players to engage with one another more quickly. This itself is not a problem how quickly it shrinks the area is however. Instead of giving players a chance to scavenge gear weapons and vehicles you are pretty much forced to run towards the center of the target zone. It definitely keeps the game moving but removes some of the tactical ness. The UI is just plain awful. It works don't get me wrong but it takes a lot of clicking to figure things out. And being nitpicky it's fairly ugly too though that is not a dealbreaker at all. Finally and this is a big one for a multiplayer only game there is no reporting system that I could find. Now as I mentioned in the "Good" section I don't feel there is much hacking going on. But I had one death that was almost assuredly not kosher and I found no way to report the offending player. Down the road this could bring some trouble. The Ugly PUBG is a game very much in development so there are things that are bound to change. There are a few things that I think are worth noting as needing work but not being disruptive to gameplay. The controls are a bit wonky and take some getting used to. Unlike the UI however once you've worked them out they work fine. Plus remapping's a thing so that helps. I would love to see a functioning replay ability so I can go back and watch the match especially to see how my opponents take me down. This game needs a FPS only mode. Currently the game can be played in both TPS and FPS. Most players go with TPS to give themselves a slight tactical advantage For those of us who enjoy a degree of immersion it would be nice to see a FPS only list of servers. The rewards system is...meh. I'm on the fence about it because on one hand credits and rewards do not impact gameplay whatsoever so there is no pay to win mode here. On the other hand however if you're not into the cosmetic aspect of the game it would be nice to be able to use these credits for something else. In Summation Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is fantastic and fully playable even in its alpha state. There are some wrinkles to iron out but the devs are listening to the players and are actively updating the game. This is the prime time to get into a fun new FPS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm sick of influential streamers bloggers and whatevers that are getting this game negative reviews. The point is that this is a fun game. https //youtu.be/am4TPyXefgMI'm not that great but I still enjoy it so much. I like the way it separates FPP and TPP into respective servers heck I like the fact that the player base is so huge I can get a game with any settings. It's a challenge for your computer. With a GTX1060 and i5 7400 + Shadowplay I get 50 60fps on Ultra with Shadows on High 1080p. On my much older rig which still performs okay with many recent titles (R7 270X FX6300) I get 35 45fps on medium lowering the settings bumps up the frame rate but that's a good idea of what to expect.This is one of the first games that actually got me to go on the internet and start looking up tips and methods on how to play better and have a more enjoyable experience. I feel like the time you put into the game is a reflection of the experience you're going to have regardless of gameplay style. 24 hours in and I'm pretty terrible but still better than I was before that falling just short of chicken dinners lately. A lot of negativity towards this game is due to many stupid things ranging from it not performing well to individuals using racial slurs in game. While the former is expected the latter is due to an online experience with 99 completely different people. I imagine if I was in a room with 99 other people that one of them is probably going to be racist it's pretty easy to switch voice channels if you're in a toxic situation. I imagine some negativity is due to things like glitches server problems you know? things you might expect for a game that currently has about 2 million people playing 100 on each server and several toasters probably making things more difficult.If you want to look at this game in a political or technical way then yeah there is a lot of "mixed" reception towards it. But if you have a decent computer a sense of humour and sharp tongue it's a "mostly positive" experience. If you're good at ARMA or any form of shooter it's going to be a "very positive" experience.5/10 if you're a bit sensitive and your computer sucks7/10 if your computer just sucks8/10 if your computer is good but you suck at games9/10 if your computer is good and you're good at games
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love playing this game even with all its bugs its the best rush in any video game I have played. Pure strategy competition and a little bit of random luck. This game wasted away my summer fall and I was looking forward to it passing the time during the winter. However the cheating has become so bad in this game since 1.0 Launch that I cannot recommend this game until it is under control. 3 out of 5 games I am reporting someone for hacking with aimbots recoiless mods and being able to see me through walls. Wasting 20 30 minutes getting to the top 10 and being killed with hacks is so frustrating. Single duo and squad games all suffer from this problem. 3 or 4 on 1 at the end of a match and you're team is dead because of some D bag with a fully auto recoiless M416 from 100 yards out. WOOT!Not to mention I can barely meet any new players to invite to play our discord server because almost every random person you pair up with on the North America servers is from Asia and do not speak english or do not work as a team.The addition of the "replay function" is awesome but it just helps me to verify that there are in fact so many cheating players that its not even worth my time to play anymore. This game is a 8/10 with no cheating and unlimited fun with friends. I miss those days but now everytime I log in to play I am filled with the feeling that I've wasted my time and raised my blood pressure.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG Is a good concept and can be fun. But to go 1.0 when it is clearly still an Early Access title speaks volumes.Sadly the main reason I cannot recommend it at this point is aside from it still feeling and looking like an early access game made from asset flips it is as you can no doubt see from other reviews and discussions filled with Chinese hackers and if they're not hacking they're taking advantage of lag.If I join local servers I'd like to play against locals not people with a 300+ ping. Players that you shoot several times who then turn around and 1 shot you or through walls because where you see them despite the blood flying from their bodies they're not where you think they are and they're not taking hits like you think.Sadly PUBG is not the only game that suffers from this networking phenomonen but many old school shooters like Quake and Unreal Tournament you could minimise it with rate capping. It really needs to make a comeback.Devs are looking into it (of course no promises made) and of course no idea when it will be implemented.No issue killing local players and I have no issues with being legitmately killed.But it stops being fun when you constantly feel cheated. Be it from hacks or lag abuse and these players lagging it can be hard to tell.Kill Cam doesn't help as you do not get an exact replay of events as they occured and it can give the impression someone is cheating who may not be and the opposite is also true. Although someone firing an AR on full auto and landing every shot seems to be a give away.Thanks to loot crates and being able to sell the contents (something that should never be in a paid game imho) you find many servers filled with AFKers. Who aren't there to play but to make themselves money. Needs to be anti AFK systems and penalties in place. Again something other games have managed to do in the past.I'd say PUBG could be a good game but it lacks maps (Only 2 currently) game modes custom servers unless you're a twitch celebrity and much much more that we used to get in such games way back in 1997.But it's got a long way to go for a 'RETAIL' product. (Heck it has menu options that are greyed out. Yeah 1.0 right there.If they deal with the flood of Chinese players infesting every server if they properly deal with the hackers. (Something no game currently does sadly free money from resells (MAC bans maybe? IP and Account bans have never worked. Seriously what's the point of Battle Eye EAC and similar? They seem to do jack sh!t)If they can add more content ASAP and quality content at that and get better optimization happening then I could recommend it.If it was a F2P game still in Early Access I'd recommend it.But as it currently stands. I'd have to say hang onto your money and see how it goes. For $30USD and a 1.0 release (just in time for Xmas of course....) and with in game Ads and loot. I do not feel this is what a paid for retail game should be.I already own it so I'll keep playing and see how it progresses. But it's wash rinse and repeat gameplay only fun in short bursts. Play it for any length of time in one go and you either end up bored or frustrated even more so when you win but do not recieve your points. Needs some capture the flag Team Deathmatch more than just the last man standing which is more of a game mode itself than an actual game.tl dr for $30usd you get a hackfest that feels more like a mod for Arma 3 than a new standalone game. (and oddly enough it was an Amra mod I believe. Seeing a pattern with Arma mods becoming standalone games here)This game has made millions and it would be nice to see those million actually being spent on development than buying more pre made assets and glaring problems seemingly being ignored.Game needs more time in the oven.Potential is there but it's not there yet. If you enjoy frustration more than fun. buy it.Friend bought the game for me if it had been my own money I'd feel ripped off and cheated honestly at this stage.

Basically the asian server joins north american and the result leaves a server of 15+ asain hackers in one game. It's hard to find an English speaking teamate in any server let alone the North American. I normally wouldnt have an issue but its been 3 months. They seem to have forgotten about pc and only are focusing on the console release.

review: Before you call me a racist I am a Chinese American and I am tired of the Chinese Infestation in the American Servers.I don't want to have to speak chinese to communicate with my team.I do not want to play a game where the region means nothing aside from ping consistency.I do not want to have to search through 10 squads to find a SINGLE PERSON that speaks English.I do not want to "Go out of my way to make friends" when all I want to do is play one quick match before I go do more important things with my life.If you don't want to enforce your region rules set language rules and make it reportable to play on the English server and speak Chinese the whole time and vice verese.I want to be able to communicate with my team I don't need to hear Sha Bi 50 times in one game because I don't fit in on my own server. I don't want this gameI don't even want my money back. I just want the game to be regulated.If you bought this game with the thought process of "Being able to communicate with your team and have fun this game is not for you. If you're a fan of League of Legends and you're used to your team being asshats and enjoy it when no one wants to communicate be my guest.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Arguably the best and most straightforward Battle Royale game on the market (Fortnite is a bit too zany for me) PUBG is a game that is littered with strange (but not absurd) physics Asian hackers bad RNG and clunky mechanics. Despite those things the basic gameplay and tension created in moments of combat manages to keep this game afloat. Personally I find it really fun. It's irritating and garbage at times but that's part of its personality. I rate this game Cory/Zero it's a pretty decent anime trying to find its place among lower quality garbage shows like DayZ. At least it's out of Early Access.Oh and

review: I've played over 220 hours and my character still looks like it did when I was about 10 hours in (besides the clothes I caved in on and purchased because I couldn't take it anymore). I know this isn't a fashion game but MAN DOES IT SYCK when you cash in 2 weeks worth of points only to play the "loot crate lottery" and get the same shirt and hat 3 times in a row. It shouldn't be like this... I have some great memories with this game and will continue to have more with my friends but at some point you have to start voicing you opnion. The fact that after playing over 200 hours I had to spend REAL MONEY to get a coat is a joke. Yes there are hackers (par for the course these days) yes there are glitches and server issues (technically we are still in the "early access stage") but when the devs are concentrating on monetizing the game before you can even get a t shirt you like after playing 200 hours... something just doesn't feel right. It organically feels like I'm being cheated. 1 level no control of how I want my character to look and broken development promises. Great game still it's fun but... it's just my own opnion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ok where do I start. PUBG is an amazing game that has captivated my love for a FPS game. Even if it takes quite a while sometimes to discover other players the payoff is great! The game is still in Early Access so it is plagued with random bugs but I still really love it. I have only put 200 hours into the game so take my opinion with a grain of salt. However as the months passed the walls of the houses became covered in advertisements for random things and twitch streamers which I think is a stupid move for a game that costs 30$. The amount of hackers also seems to have incresed. I have not seen that many but everyone I talk to seems to have some sort of experence with impossible deaths. I would still recommend this game but Just know that things could continue to go down from here if the devs do not get their stuff together and fix some of the more serious issues before releasing more content and advertising all over the map.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Constant people using aim bot and other various hacks. I have a lot of hours on this game but for now it will stay uninstalled until demands are met. I'd save the $30.00 and buy another game...

review: Great potential but let down by greedy developers. The netcode for this game runs on average at 17Hz. In 2017 that is pathetic. Servers are over capacity so are constantly laggy with Asian and Russian players flooding the EU and NA servers (as instructed by Bluehole) and ruining the experience for everyone else. There aren't enough Asian servers and there are NO Russian servers. The way the lag compensation has been done you are at a very high disadvantage if you have a good connection and fast ping. Punishing those with decent internet and rewarding those who are rubber banding everywhere Then there's the hackers and whilst it is sort of expected for a game of this magnitude and punk buster are doing their best to get on top of it a bad experience is a bad experience.The game is an absolute mess right now. Mostly because of the disgusting net code.E SPORTS READY. It is its own meme. how.

review: So obviously everybody loves this game and it's quite popular to say the least. Yes there are issues but what game doesn't have. Let me see if I can balance the argument here. So in my opinion the reason this is such a popular game is because the stakes are so high. You die you're done. This makes this game very tense nerve wrecking and exciting. Equally so if feels just as exciting and even more thrilling when you kill someone knowing you have ruined their game. Synical but true. ProsHigh stakesDecent variety of weapons and armorModerately complex terrain with forests hills water and roads. Good amount od different areas. Zone systemConsInconsistencyLag issuesBugs Taking damage when landing from a parachute Sudden Vehicle disembarkment when crashing Getting shot through coverNot enough loot It's a bit ridiculous. Not everyone wants to land in high populated areas where all the good loot is you guys need to spread the loot out better. I sometimes find all there is in an entire complex are pistols. Nothing pisses me off more. I have noticed good guns in some low pop areas but the latter happens too often. Also I'm tired of seeing 4 bags but no gunsNot enough vehiclesZone moves too quickly towards the end and gives too much damage. The end of games is a rush and spoils the game for me. If ou like getting angry but at the same time like playing with high stakes get the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a really fun game although when it comes to its memory/disk functionality it really lacks causing it to be unplayable. Ton's of players have troubles running the game because it takes way to much disk space to load the game even though they may have an 'elite' hard drive. To be able to run this game you need a SSD or you are just stuck with long loading screens and by the time you get in you are probably already dead. So if you have a normal HDD I do not recommend this game unless you want to instantly die everytime you get into a game.

review: Overhyped.Yes I had fun for the first 100 150 hours but after you've played it for quite a long time you'll eventually grow tired of it because you've already done it all. I've bought this game back in June and it hasn't change much since then. It still has this horrible renderring problems wherein the houses look like marshmallows from Pyro's world terrible performance issues and an unoptimized game. The only reason I keep on playing this game is because my friends still play it and I do have fun when playing with them but if you're a solo player then the fun will eventually burn out before you reach the 100 hour mark..For now I don't recommend getting this game on it's current state (below average servers/ optimization/ rampant hackers). Yes it's fun with friends because you get to do all kinds of things with them lol. But if you're just a solo player who doesn't have anyone else to play with then enjoy repeating the same cycle of things every game. Drop Loot Get killed Exit to Lobby.

review: Alright so I have put off this review as long as I can. I have played PUBG since april. It has come a long long long long long long way(seriously cannot emphasize how far it has come how fast for early access game). It is an amazingly addicting game that will have you saying one more game until you look at the clock and realize its 4am. It still has room to improve no doubt but the playerunknowns team is incredibly helpful and keep everyone up to date with what is happening. There was an infestation of hackers for a few weeks but that has since passed and I have not seen one since the updates to the cheat system. They're has been many many many annoying bugs you will see that from the reviews but almost all have been ironed out and the game is finally coming extremely close to launch. Only 1 more week of testing the final PC 1.0 test server with the new map this week and then the official release will soon be after that. The reason I write this review is to recommend to buy it before the price jumps(if its going to).Comments about optimizations I have a new system with a 1600x and 1060 6gb I run at a lot of the settings on ultra and a few on high while playing on 1080p 60hz screen(60hz gross I know). I average 70 fps and now rarely drop below 50fps. I will drop below 50fps when the servers are overpopulated that but at non peak times the game runs very well.I also have a old system with literally the exact bareminimum requirement listed below. fx 6300 and 660 2gb 8gb ram. If your system does not match the performance of that(five year old system) dont try to run the game and then complain that the game doesnt run. I do not care about how "terrible" the graphics are. This is a massive game and with 100 people + all the RNG + all vehicles and objects in motion being simulated in real time whether you see them or not is a lot for any processor and GPU. I have seen to many people trying to run this game on older non gaming laptops it just ain't gonna happen and if this is you stop complaining.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is one of the most fun games I've played in a long time. Solo is fun but playing Duo (with one other friend) and Squads (with two or more friends) is the best. Had issues at the start with a "Network Lag Detected" error where it kicked me from games and would take a few minutes to rejoin However once I fixed this issue the game has been a blast. Yeah you'll die a lot. You probably won't get a chicken dinner on your first run but for some reason I still enjoy spawning looting killing and dying over and over again. For an early access game this is fantastic! Now let's just hope the developers actually push it out of early access unlike most games.

review: This game is plain amazing. I love to just come on and do a squad game with friends. Although there is only one same map every single match feels unique in its own way. Maybe you've ended up in an end game circle with hills and all you have is a shotgun maybe you ended up in military base where there could be a person on any turn and all you have is a sniper. You never know what happens since it is all random. The game has an immense replay value and is even better with friends. Don't hesitate just buy it.

review: i would say that this game is better than people have described it to me making me realise that you should never judge a book by its cover and you can only react to what you have seen. If you havent played this game then you are in no position to judge however people who have played it can give their thoughts and opinions of the game. ive only just brought it and played 31 mins of it but just by playing a weee bit i could tell that this game has a lot of potential and that if they arent just money hungry like cough cough.....d a y b r e a k then this game will be a banger. Personally for me the aiming and shooting mechanics are really good and me being a cod fan TEENAGER not a child lol..... that in some way it kind of feels like cod in a way like 20%. yh 20% is low but i would prefer 20 than nothing. All i going to say that this game is good enough even in its early access stages but there is stilll a lot of work to be done but i have no doubt that the creator/helper of H1Z1 could fix the slight issues and bugs and the optimastions Honestly if d a y b r e a k keep ip with this b u l l s h i t then they gonna get hit hard just where the sun dont sun. Anways overall this game is a great/fun game to play and dont have to worry about the chinese..well i gues id know and you dont have to worry about the 1 shot 1 kill shotgun.

review: Edit 12/14/17 Well. The hackers are back. Last ten games in a row. The game needs consistent bans not a ban wave every few months. The game is once again unplayable and I guess I'll pick it back up if theres news of a new ban wave.Edit 11/26/17 I've had one hacker in the last ten games I've played. This is still annoying when it happens but at a rate this low I can wholeheartedly reccomend the game. If you don't have it yet get it.EDIT 11/18/17 For the last few days there has been a notable decrease in the number of hackers in my games. Not sure of this is a fluke but if it stays like this through the week I'll be changing my reccomendation to a positive. This is a very good game. Some of the most fun I've had on the PC in a while. That being said when other players consistantly have Xray hacks aimbots it makes the game impossible to have fun with. When you die the second that you crest a hill from a guy sitting in the middle of a valley spinning and shooting you know that there are problems. If this were an occasional occurance it would be fine but the six games that I played prior to this review ALL had people cheating. The game is a ton of fun but in its current state its unplayable. The devs have come out saying that they were cracking down but if anything its gotten worse over the last week.

review: This game is a great idea but the developers were definitely not prepared to have such a large playerbase with such high expectations. Despite the crazy amount of copies they've sold I still haven't felt a great response in the way my game runs. I find it abysmal that the game runs at &lt 10hz at the beginning of rounds. Once I tried out fortnite I had trouble coming back to this game. Both games run on the same engine and have the same playercount. But one of these games feels like butter and the other one is a clunky unresponsive mess. I realize that pubg is in early access but from what i've played on the test servers it doesnt seem to have changed for the 1.0 release. Despite what i've said I have hope for the future of this game.

review: Absolutely love this game to bits. 200 hours into it shows that.When I can play the damn thing.Every night around 11PM AEST/AEDT till around 1 30 2 30am everything goes to hell. Servers go down and I can't join with my friends for the entire time.A tweet goes out saying server issues but then nothing is done just a few hours later saying "all fixed" and then they go down again. Constant cycle.2/5 to be frank. It'd be 4/5 if I could join constantly tbh but these new issues are really hampering my experience. To be frank I'd say not to buy this until they actually upgrade their servers. UPDATE AS OF 25/10 Okay now it's a 4/5. The servers are back up to top notch and I've had 0 issues in a long time. I can now properly reccomend this game.

review: The game is buggy as hell runs poorly on any machine that doesn't have a high end card and has clunky controls. It's in early access and has a strong dev team that keeps the community updated. It's one of the most adrenaline pumping feelings in any game I've played when I get into the top 10 but that's all it really has going for it. I feel I have more fun with it when I play with friends. I don't feel like the UI is informitive enough and there isn't enough focus on stats. It's deffinately worth the money though just on the experience alone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Absolutely infurating and fun at the same time. So far I have ran into a series of small issues and a couple major issues that constantly brings this game down. Any change in my network speeds and this game is hell bent on locking your player up and completely disabling them from movement while other players get to leisurely mark a perfect headshot and you get to see and read that in the final moments. Or even more infuriating is watching the blue zone pass you by and you get to stand still slowly dying. Another possiblility is you get screwed over because the randomized red zones that hail bombs on you although mostly funny to drive through will randomly splat you in its hellish fury all over the inside of buildings due to the fact that the buildings aren't entirely safe. Which is fine except when that hell storm pumbles where you're at for over 3min consequtively and you get to hear the sounds of shattering glass and the sounds of dying souls combined with the complete destruction of your ear drums since it seems this freaks out just about anyone's PC. However besides those issues you will find yourself constantly in the lobby anyways from the thrill of that one incredibly lucky game that got you a win. I'll have to admit I want to tear handfulls of hair out in frustration because of either network lags at the most inconvenient times or simply that aiming in this game is the most difficult I have ever dealt with but its incredibly fun at the end of the day. Other issues from daily playing will happen and you'll find that for how much you pay and the technical difficulties alone you may want to consider something else. Personally had I known this many technical issues existed I would have never used as much space on my PC or paid even half the amount that I did. Sorry at this point I only play it to kill time and be able to have fun with my brother.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It had its time but now... Since Player Unknown's was released into Early Access I have been a big supporter of the idea behind the game. I have enjoyed it thus far and had many laughs with friends. The seemingly unstoppable juggernaught of FPS shooting has met its match Hacking. It has it's positives. Development with new Animations with vaulting that was released before Christmas of 2017 was a great improvement to the overall feel of the game. The variety of tools at the players disposable in which to dispatch your fellow arena chums was always fantastic and the legendary Pan being an iconic symbol. However from what would be many evenings spent playing with friends and the odd solo queue it has become a game I loath. The amount of hackers seemingly instant headshotting through a level 3 helmet recoil absent and snapping onto targets instantly from a distance of over 500 meters away and getting headshotted each time just makes the game purely unjoyable. If better anti cheat software was able to be used to make the game fair for all players then I may consider returning and changing this review to a positive. However in its current state I would not recommend this game.

review: This game is pretty addictive even with only two maps. It is a lot of fun to play with a group of friends. If you take the game semi serious there is a good amount of tatics involved if you wish to make it to the end alive. Sometimes luck plays a role. The game has come a long way and only gotten better. Cheating at one time was seriously out of hand and almost made me walk away from playing for sometime. Banning cheaters and trying to crack down on these issues has made the game enjoyable again. I personally run the game on a lower end gaming computer. I have a descent processor AMD Ryzen 1500x paired with a RX 560. I am able to run the game just fine with all settings at medium view distance at high. I probably could tweak it a little more but the game is very playable with these settings. As I mentioned earlier I play the game with my personal friends. We use a outside chat program. Turning off the in game communications is a must for me as the over the top immature players are at a uber high. I've found my self a few times using the open channel after a match starts taunting my prey in a professional manner for some giggles. An example would be "I know you are in that shack might as well come out and get it over with" I've also found that a lot of people think others cheat in this game when really they don't. They end up having a poor internet connection causing them to lag. This does give them a advantage. However the game isnt broke. It's the developers not region locking the game to prevent this. Over all I find PUBG a enjoyable game that you can quickly jump into when time is short to get a little action. Carefull as you can indulge yourself so much that before you know it your entire day was wasted away playing this game. I would give this game at it's current level of completness a solid 7.5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The gameplay itself is solid and I have a blast playing it. If you were dead set on a battle royale game this is the one to buy. The reason I cannot recommend this is soley because of the crate system. Currently you make a character ONE character then as you play you earn points based on your performance. You spend those points on crates which have a chance for clothing or accessories for you character. After release they plan to make you pay real money for those crates. That would be somewhat acceptable if this was FTP but it isn't. So I cannot recommend it.For the gameplay it is fun intense and just a blast to play. I know with other games (H1Z1 specifically) the shooting/gunplay was off (H1Z1 had the worst gunplay of any game I've played.). The gunplay in this is solid. I am confident I will hit my target when I am shooting. The loot doesn't seem to be great on the fringes of the island but that's not that big a problem. The game has working vehicles it needs more variety and more on the map but they exist.

review: Went from giving this game a negative review in June to a postive review in August back to negative in the last few weeks.I had a nearly 2200 squad rank in season 2 putting me around top 1000 NA and played the game a lot. After some fixes server side and an upgrade to a 4gig video card on my side i liked the game even more moving forward..but this was the past.Now from what i've seen the game is becoming more and more Asian orientened (53% of players in the past 2 weeks logged in from China or Korea as of 11/1/17 and only 21.5%'ish of players logged in using the English language setting i believe on the same date) and more hacker friendly. I've watched livestreams with people using hacks and even telling the streamer how to get the hack they're currently using. Combined this makes the game very unfriendly to anyone really.. especially players like me who queue for squads by myself and higher ranked players who are more concerned about dying unfairly and losing stats.Overall i'd say they need to ping lock the servers and focus on getting rid of hackers. By ping locking I mean locking out any IP if it has ping is over 100 lets say.. so a chinese player wouldnt be able to log into a NA server or vice versa. And the hacks speak for themselves.. any amount of tolerance removes the fairness for the other 99% who don't hack and makes it not fun.

review: IMPORTANT I DID NOT WRITE THIS BUT I AGREE WITH ALL POINTS AS MUCH AS I LOVE THIS GAMES IDEA (ORIGINAL WRITTEN BY SpliffPUBG is what you get when amateur developers have a good idea for what could be a great game with a small budget to start with. Now that they've made many millions (close to a billion on PC sales alone) all they see is money. They no longer care about player experience. Why spend money to make the game better when most of the people that would buy the game have already bought it?Mistakes / poor decisions First mistake was the game engine that they built the game on. It wasn't designed for 100 players so they had to reduce the server tickrate to ridiculously low rates. There are better engines that can handle 100 players but I guess they went with the cheaper solution. Client side hit detection. This is why you can still get shot after you get into cover. Players with high ping have a big advantage over players with low ping. No region lock or ping lock. They talked about implementing this months ago but now you're racist or "xenophobic" toward Chinese people if you want this feature. Setting a max ping or locking players to their region would reduce the poor experience of having client side hit detection. Lootboxes. Everything about them. Some items like the school girl outfit sell for over $1k on the marketplace. Huge incentive for cheaters since you get points for kills and wins to buy these loot boxes with. They also just came out with locked lootboxes so you play to get your points to get the rewards and then you have to pay $3 to open the box or sell the box for around 25 cents (current price on the marketplace). Not really banning cheaters. Most cheaters sell all the items they get from their lootboxes Bluehole gets a cut of every sale. Then they ban the cheater but allow them to just buy the game again to keep playing/cheating/selling and the cycle continues. Bluehole makes money every step of the way so why would they change this? They make way more money from a cheater than they do from a regular player. STEREO sound... what year is this?? Some "minor" issues with game design that could be easily fixed like making bullets come from your gun instead of your chest slowing the circles down a bit etc. But compared to the above points these are pretty minor.What would make this game better? Engine that can handle 100 players with a decent tickrate. Server side hit detection (only works well with a good server tickrate). Actually ban cheaters (IP MAC address etc.). I know there are ways around it but it's not as easy as just buying another copy of the game. Sell rare items like the schoolgirl uniform for example. Lots of people like being able to sell/trade things on the marketplace so keep that if you must but if Bluehole sold items themselves (even just the rare items) it would control the prices and make cheating less lucrative. If they sold the schoolgirl outfit for like $50 they would make millions. Win win for everyone.If they had their own store for selling cosmetic items they would have a steady income stream from people that own the game and they wouldn't care as much about the steady income from banning cheaters and having them buy the game again. It would also give them incentive to improve the game to keep people playing and buying stuff. Bluehole can take these Desperado crates and shove them up their I will never buy a key to open one and I won't sell them on the marketplace so that they can make more money. Using points I earned to get a crate that I have to pay to open is not a reward greedy Region / Ping lock. There are servers in every major region why do people need to play on a server that's on the other side of the world? If the game had server side hit detection having a higher ping would be a disadvantage so it wouldn't be as big of an issue. Surround sound. Good positional audio is important in any FPS.If they made these changes I would recommend this game... but we're more likely to see a better studio make a better game before any of this happens.Why is it so popular then? It's exciting really gets the adrenaline pumping. You start with nothing and there's no respawn so everything you do matters and every decision you make can win or lose the round for you where to drop what to loot how long to spend looting where to go when to go there when to fight when to flee etc. Randomness of loot and circles makes those decisions and each round a little different. Option to go solo duo or squads each mode changing the way you play the game.All of this makes for a fun and addicting game.. until you die to a cheater or someone with high ping killing you after you get into cover (or they came around the corner and saw you before you could see them) or not being able to hit the guy outside your building because your bullets are coming out of your chest and hitting the window sill etc.The most frustrating thing about all that is that Bluehole is not doing enough to fix it. The only punishment for cheaters is having to buy another copy of the game how greedy can you get? They don't want to region/ping lock because they don't want to offend the Chinese and they make a lot of money from them especially since a large majority of the cheaters are from China. That's not racism that's fact.There are several Chinese players in every round on NA servers many of them are cheaters some of them are just there to get away from the asian servers that are full of cheaters but they still have an advantage due to their high ping. 0.05% of them are there to play with their friends in NA and that's the main reason Bluehole said they don't want to region/ping lock. In squads and duo's where communication is very important it really sucks to get teamed up with someone that can only speak enough english to say "China numba wun".Greed and incompetence ruined what could have been an awesome game. This just seems to be a very short sighted money grab when it could easily be a long term revenue stream.

review: Lets not forget this is still in Alpha but I do agree with most here that PUBG creators need to be a lot more proactive in curbing the hacking. Battle Eye does what it can but the coding needs to be refined to quickly detect hacking and remove/ban. I suck at this game though it doesn't stop me going back for more but single headshots from impossible distances will keep me away until the December release and hopefully fixed of bugs and hackers. But look at the facts. 2.2million players $30 a pop I think PUBG creators have made their money so time to give the real players what they paid for. I WILL recommend this game BUT be prepared for unexplained deaths from unseen/unheard enemy and quite a few game bugs. 10/10 but 3/10 until the hacking is sorted.

Between people from half the world away killing you with lag and the massive influx of hackers this game has become borderline uplayable. Lag gating and preventative measures against hackers are things I would really like to see in the near future before I give up on the game completely. Great release but it seems Bluehole hasn't been able to keep up with what they started.

review: If you do not have a solid group of friends to play with DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. This is basically a runnning simulator and the only thing that will keep you entertained on the 15 30 minute stretches of not seeing people is your friends. I made the mistake of playing this alone and I swear to god I spent the entire time running or finding vehicles to getinside the circle. I have no idea why this game is so popular other than streamers and friends playing together. The single player experience is a nightmare. Also 85% of people on this game are now chinese on NA servers. 3/4 your pub teammates will be chinese non english speakers.

review: PUBG has improved a lot over the last couple of months. Had i done a review for example in september i couldn't recommend this game because of all its bugs low pfs rubberbanding and increadibly bad servers. But in its current state it is a blast. Since a couple of days they have (fixed?) rubberbanding it isn't happening anymore for me atleast. I am running at a steady 120 fps D some gamebreaking bugs are finally fixed 1.5 million players bannedAs of right now the game feels like a normal game. Yes you will get killed constantly by campers and bushes but i guess you just have to accept that style of gameplay.

review: Was super nervous to buy due to the reviews but I've really never come acorss issues that actually bother all too much.Sure sometimes I have to force quit the game cause the loading screen freezes or everybody speaks Manderin somehow on a North American server but the game is super addicting.Full disclousure I have a pretty high end PC so I never ecounter performance issues that some people have but that's just becuase the game isn't fully optimized yet.At the end of the day the game is super addicting and I haven't regretted purchasing it and plan to play many more hours in squad mode and meeting some of the coolest down to earth gamers I have met in any game. Strongly encourage it if you know your PC can handle it and be sure to have a mic for communication if you plan on Squad Mode goes a long a way.

review: You idiots have no clue what you're talking about when it comes to the Chinese issue. We aren't saying to ban the entire country from the game you people are dancing around the main point Region lock China. They have their servers for a reason just like the rest of the world does. Chinese players do nothing but disrupt and ruin a team based game with a language barrier not to mention the ridiculous latency issues they cause. When I go into a game I want to play with English speakers who are on my server so I can effectively communicate even if that can't happen they're still on the NA servers so my connection won't be When I join up with a full ing squad of Chinese players EVERY ING TIME I JOIN SQUADS there's a problem. I can't speak Chinese and when I get hits on someone it cuts to me being in a DBNO state (turns out I didn't hit anyone!).You people are allowing this infestation to continue ruining the game for others because all you give a about is money. What good is letting the Chinese have a chance to play if all they did was pirate the game any way?

review: I am changing my review. Before I would definitely recommend this game. But now not so much. There are too many cheaters in this game now. I experience one every 3rd game. And I am not over exagerating. I have come to ask myself how come there are so many. And I think it is becuae this game only costs around $15 in some countries. Now the crate with the lowest value can be solf for around $0.36. You can get 6 creates a week. so that is $2.16. Which means the game earns itself after 7 weeks. Now the quickest way be able to afford these crates is to win so you can accumulate battlepoints faster. I know $2.16/week is nothing for some of us. But it is just about scaling.This is also why we see so many non cheaters asians on NA and EU servers. Because the Asian ones are probably flooded with cheaters. And the cheaters migrate to EU and NA when the competition on AS become to high.What is the fix? We have to devalue the crates some how. I recommend not capping the amount of crates you get per week. The cheaters will then flood the market with a lot of crates that no one wants. Devalueing it. Making it less profitable to actually earn crates. And eventually the cost of electricity is going to exceed the proffit made from crates.So no. I do not recommend this game. Too many cheaters. EDIT I don't know whetehr the issue with the cheaters ahs been fixed but it seems like now that the prices on items are lower that they have some waht become less active to the point that there almost none in FPP. In TPP though I still find at least 1 every 3 games.

Game is a cash cow and nothing short of. #REGIONLOCKCHINA #BANTHEIRHARDWARE #MACADDRESSBAN
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As someone who has played a fair few hours of this game i feel as though i can give a fair review. obviously i love the game the gameplay is fun especially in the later stages and it always keeps me coming back for more. that being said there are some downsides which i will list New map can be quite boring although i have had some fun games on it. i would definitely say that the original map is far better. the lootboxes are always dreadful i have opened hundreds of them and only got 1 or 2 good items you should be rewarded more for playing the game and perhaps should get a special crate when you win or come top 10 the price is too high for what you are getting i would say 15 would be more of a fair price considering the small amount of content the loot in game seems so much more difficult to find before 1.0 the looting was good and it felt perfect but after 1.0 the looting is awful me and my friends are always complaining about it.Now the positives The gameplay is fun and tactical i love the combat driving has been greatly improved since 1.0 can be played very seriously or more casually with friends either way it is very fun for me it doesnt get boring although there are only 2 maps and a small handful of modes every game is different.I would recommend this game although there are some downsides overall i like it. if it is on sale then i would say definitely pick it up.

review: The game idea is good and at times enjoyable but the reality is there are more people cheating than playing fairly. Unlike many game play videos you see gun fights last seconds with other players snapping head shots in automatic with no recoil and at vast distances without you even being able to view where they were postioned or at other times players seemingly shoot you through walls or run up to your exact postion you were hiding to find you and kill you with little effort. The game is 50% looking for Items 40% Running due the zone shrinking 5% checking your map and 5% (if you are lucky ) in combat. The squad play is totally over run in every region by Non english speaking people making team communication hard too impossible i have only been teamed with two english speakers in about 30 squad matches in the oceania region. Still there are a few bugs but as other say the second biggest problem is this game needs a region lock/ping lock and the ability to see your accurate ping speed which the developers are only to obviously hiding due to crazy lag issues and high pingers infiltrating every region. An overall score of 3/10 is suitable for this game as the more i write about this game the more i find wrong with it. The developers are avoiding some of the major flaws in an obvious attempt to grab as much cash as possible. I looked forward to this game but it does not deserve its hype unless you maybe live in asia or sciprt and cheat. Its intial splendor is soon eroded with infuriating problems.
