review: EA REVIEW Reasons to Play PUBG The Game can be amazing at times.Playing the game with your friends. Change of pace playing FPS ( if you are tired with BF 1 and CoD formula ) .You can make the money you spent on it by selling crates or items. (I already did and made a profit on it D ) The Community is growing everday. They Update PUBG regularly. Reasons Not to play PUBG Potato PC ( Sorry the game is unplayable when you play less than 30fps) If you prefer FPS games Deathmatch modes the game is not for you. The game has a lot of Game breaking giltches and bugs. ( you will encounter somekind of glitch and bugs )My first match the game CRASH on me. I would still recommend the buying the game especially when you're in the Philippines the game is cheaper it cost PHP 760 ( around $15). The game is fun I hope they can get out of Early Access Next year Unlike some other Early Access games that still in it. UPDATE 1.0 release Dev. dilevered what they promise GTX 1050 could run pubg easy 1080p unlike the EA performance it gave my Zotac AMP!Edition GTX 1060 a hard time hitting 60fps in a populated area and big city Big kudos to the team Dev. bring out PUBG in EA less than a year but the game has a game breaking bugs exploding bikes when you try to stand it up ( that happen to me once) servers are full of holes (I used PUBG Server ping to check my ping) im from PH and my ping in SG is 200+ Korea 160+ Tokyo 130+ and the rest 250+ listen up Blue hole you have a large player base on PH playing on SEA with 200+ ping is not a good server to play in you can put some network status so we could see a lot more details on our status and the HACKERS i know you guys are exhausting all resources to BAN the players using hacks they ruined the game for us but saying all of that I would still recommend PUBG to anyone likes to play FPS even other genre game (Look at my list for Reasons to Play PUBG ) but address the main issue of the game. Thanks blue hole

review: Short version Chinese hackers ruining the game. PassLong versionI have spent a lot of time enjoying this with friends. The challenge adrenaline spikes hillarious moments and suspense have made this a popular game. Yes it does have bug related issues but it is an early access game so I can forgive the occasional glitch. However the NA servers (and all of the other servers) are filled with Chinese hackers. I encountered one in atleast 3 matches today during solos. One of them was even in the leaderboards. It is something that has many others pleading with Blue to solve the issue. They have recently commented that "Alongside other measures we will be implementing we are now also looking into implementing ping lock to help with server lag and other stability issues." Untill then I can't spend another 30 minute round looting and killing untill I reach the top 10 only to encouter a chinese hacker who proceeds to head shot everybody with game breaking 3rd party programs.

Network Lag all the time people getting disconnected in the middle of firefights etc. Watch shroud play the new map again test servers on an early access game i know but this hasnt always been the case. I play maybe every other night probably 4 5 matches each time and run into hackers on at least half of those matches. I dont even accept the "the community is just growing so fast its taking them time to catch up to hackers because CS GO seems like they have a pretty decent system at catching hackers (not 100% on that since i dont play it). Only reason i can think of them pushing this to console (even runs terrible on the XBONE) is for a cash grab. They can say they aimed for it to run on the One X all they want but most people dont even own that console yet PLUS they still made it available to the XBONE anyways knowing it would run like crap. All my friends still play this crap which is the only reason i still get on but once they get into another game ill be done with this garbage until someoone eventually comes out with something MUCH better that isnt on a constant downward slope. /rantTL DR Hackers every other match and constant disconnect issues netwokr lag you name it is all going on with this game right now and it should NOT be purchaased right now

review: I've not played the game for very long but I thoroughly enjoyed it and had oodles of fun. It's a great survival deathmatch game that everyone was looking for in other games(like The Culling to name an example) that I'm sure the vast majority of players can agree that unlike others it excels in aspects that other games of the same genre fall short in. It's in fact not in full release and I look forward to it but like all good games there are aspects of it also don't like. Most of my problems with the games are minor and I can look passed but some make me livid. Let's get into it.EDIT Alright love this game great fun with other people however after playing a ton of hours into the game there's too much that makes this game not worth playing.1. Hackers Since around October 6th 2017 there's been an increase in rampant hackers. Some may argue that I'm just bad in fact I am bad at the game. HOWEVER! If you're watching the player on your team after death score headshots while HIP FIRING from 200m 300m 90% sure you'd call him a hacker too.2. Hitboxes They're crap. You should never be able to shoot someone after they're already in cover a game that's newer than a ton of old school shooters hasn't bothered nor even has the ability to fix delayed hitboxes. I even headshot a guy after he was already behind a rock 10 outta 10.3. The Devs themselves Alright low blow. But seriously the game has around 2 000 000 players which should obviously mean they've made millions of dollars. Okay where am I going with this? They have the money and resources to make the game better. But instead Brendan Greene is funding a crap movie which probably will amount to being a nothing more than a B drama when they can do what NigaHiga did.Pros Large Map Like it says it's a huge map. Guns There's quite the variety many with similar stats and advantages with their own disadvantages that are enjoyable to explore. Realistic Death Not meaning gore or anything just that how quickly one can die is incredibly realistic none of that "Shot in the chest 30 times and still kicking" shenanigans. One fatal mistake is punishing enough to get you killed. Gun Play Want your shooting to be realistic? They've got bullet drop they've got breathing and they've got peaking. Player Base There's lots of people no long queues to find a game. Cosmetics Are most things rare? Sure but who cares I can dress up in the most badass survival outfit or wear the most god aweful easy to see outfit. I'm hoping to see more. Crate System I like how the crates go up in price to ensure a stable economy in the game's clothes even if some are ridiculously priced *coughs* $1 300 player unknown set. *coughs*Cons Downed in a car Can anyone explain how being downed in a car flings me from it? I can understand the back of the buggy or motorcycle but in the car? That's just absurd. Healing Alright it's kind of a car thing still. Why can't I heal while my ally drives? It's a small thing but pretty unrealistic I suppose it's to avoid people from healing while being shot at but considering that my hands are free(unless shooting) there's no physical reason I shouldn't be able to besides "balancing" issues. Severe Bullet Drop Everyone I know agrees with me on this. I've fired the vast majority of the weapons this game features in real life and I've no idea why at the zeroing of 100m for most AR's have severe bullet drop. It's like I'm shooting an air gun and not a military grade rifle. Don't even get me started on the sniper rifles. Recoil Still a gun pet peeve. Everytime I fire an automatic weapon its recoil is so severe I feel like I'm trying to fire a 50 BMG automatic machine gun again. I know Tap fire is the only way people SHOULD shoot in real life and this game but a UMP shouldn't feel like a heavy machine gun at full auto. The Bushes If you've played the game you already know what I'm about to say. The damn bushes from afar look like a person holding a rifle with another gun on his back either standing or crouching. I swear the developers did this on purpose and I find it funny but extremely annoying at the same time. Slippery Slopes Friction is a lie. I've been walking down stairs and I'll find myself somehow on the railing and falling to my death. Rocks that aren't even steep will slide me off and damage me. Jumping It's terrible I've gotten use to the jumping but not being able to simply jump through certain windows if you're too close is extremely annoying. Most people don't even bother jumping through obstacles because screwing up can be life or death. Match Making Squads Technically not their fault. It's a minor issue but still one nonetheless. I absolutely hate being matched up with someone that doesn't speak english. Especially if they're from a different country. I want people that speak english so I can communicate and get things done not listen to someone ramble on in a foreign langauge. It's worse when everyone speaks a different langauge why are you even in the NA server?! Communication You know when you have a full team of awesome players that have a mic and friendly communicate but have that one guy that has "mic on all the time" and has his family arguing in the background or has a fan blowing on his face 24/7? I want to mute that guy if there is an option I've not found it. Shotgun range/scatter I feel like I'm shooting a shotgun with a 6 inch barrel and a 2 inch diameter bore. Is this for balancing or has no one ever fired a standard 12 gauge in their life? Holding your breath You can hold your breath under water for 30 seconds given the pressure you're under and amount of swimming you will be doing not too far fetched. BUT while holding your breath while aiming you get about a 5 second window. Seeing that shooting is much less strenuous I'm smelling something rather... fishy. Crouched Cover Fire Okay last gun one why is it that in FIRST PERSON while behind cover and can clearly see my barrel and sights over the wall but still shoot the damn wall? Surely I can crouch SLIGHTLY higher to shoot over a damn wall but I still manage to shoot the wall. Melee Unless you use the frying pan for covering your butt melee has no real purpose in the game except getting lucky in the first 3 seconds of landing next to some unlucky Joe.That's all I had I still love the game and highly recommend it. I had a lot of cons but again most are minor things that are just personal pet peeves. The game itself makes up for it in its gameplay and the amount of overwhelming Pros that set itself apart from games of the same genre.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game was good in its first realese (thats when I got it) it was new but it dint change much since heres whyPOSITIVE POINTS its kind of realistic with bullet drop and how you have to aim carefully The car physics are good Its fps in strategy and it takes more IQ to play than Cod The game is challenging and funBAD SIDES(Many) Recoil is almost non existant in soem guns like the Scar Ump M4 groza Tommy gun Vector. The only guns with some sort of recoild are the snipers and the akm the have no recoil in third person mode. If you kill a streamer in game you get banned because "STREAM SNIPING" Shotguns can get long range kills with one shot but cant get a one shot kill in close range (Like the double barrel) Pan can block any shot evn 500. magnum how? PUBG LOGICS The armor can soak LOUD of bullets The extreme level of campers Lot of mic spam at the start Lack of maps Thats most of it there are a lot more logics that make no senseIts still very knew alothough I mentioned a lot of bad points I love this game thumbs up for sure. Its SO MUCH fun with your friends and winning makes it every rewarding the ggame is gonna get more updates and its gonna be a lot beter

review: Overall the game is fun and all but there are so many issues with it. I'll start with the constant crash I get every match. The loaing screen for the island where you are spawned before the match starts takes forever. Sometimes I hear the plane and I am still stuck in the loading screen. There was a time my PC restarted by itself and there was another time where I got the BSOD (blue screen of death) which sums up how much the devs care about their "great game". I haven't had a worse experience with a game (performance based I mean) in a long time. But PUBG just tops it for the game with the worst performance. And I am totally sure it is not because of my hardware 'cause I have a pretty good RIG so I doubt it is a problem from my hardware. Is the game good? Yes but not performance based. You need a pretty solid PC to run this game. If the fix the crashing type issues I can recommend it.

review: PUBG Review With the full game being released for around a month now I wanted to give a detailed review of the game and what still needs to change.Gameplay 6/10 Although a significantly polished version to the early access the gameplay still suffers from lag and stuttering issues. The main stutter the bad stutter making the game unplayable has been cleared however when on the starting area and when on the plane it suffers serverly from frame drops to around half what you would normally get. It also seems to have a problem staying at a constant fps from a long period of time I was stood still in a game to test this and still had frame drops of about 4 15 fps although some may not see this difference when you play 60fps it becomes frustrating. Despite this playing is still fun and very competitive whether playing solo or with friends. The progression of the circle isn't too random or unfair to players and the weapons are balanced in both drop rates based on it's effect on a game and against other weapons(eg. a pistol doesn't destroy someone with a scar). One thing that was rather odd was the random ammo in houses I understand why this drop exists but when you find a house non looted full of ammo only it can become rather annoying. Overall good but still needs some improvement.Graphics 9/10 This games graphics can only be described through 1 word Beautiful. It's graphics are a perfect balance of performance and asthetics although the aforementioned frame drops have meant some settings have been lowered. As I find with most games the shadows effect fps quite heavly although as I don't see a huge advantage of them in this game this can be lowered with no severe issues being had in the ways of gameplay. Weirdly the effects made a big difference for me in the case of fps but when changing it no difference could be seen. The textures again weirdly didn't seem to have an effect on my fps like alot of other games do with them on very low and every thing else bar effects and shadows being on ultra I got 80 and with textures on ultra 60 70 was what I layed at. Weird but very nice to people with lower end cards. Great work on the graphics.Mechanics 10/10 This is the main part of the game which I truly felt was polished fully bar graphics and had the most work on. Now don't get me wrong driving is broken in certain vehicles and terrain but I felt as if this made the game more enjoyable and actually made me play more messing around with the vehicles trying some stunts or running people over while trying not to flip the car on a pebble the game became more entertaining with this. The drops are balanced and not overly populated in random areas they also drop better weapons less frequently a huge plus in the way of a competitive game. The circles progression is not aggressive to a point where it becomes impossible to actually stop for a moment to clear out an area while running from the oncoming circle a very well desgined feature. The parachuting is as expected working enough(the only problem I had was a visual glitch or 2) and amazingly the opening of doors is ordinary(a little anticlimatic I know). Add ons 7/10 Now this one will be brief. The cases are not bad but at the same time not great. Any microtransactions no matter what they do are good. You shouldn't have to pay to do anything in a game it should be able to earned however in PUBG's defence you can earn the crates and open them or sell them for an item you want howevr the gamescons when they were avaliable for purchase or the Desparado crate need keys which can not be earned which is a slap in the face if you earn them. However with the price of items being rather high on any item or than the basic tops or pants profit is significantly easier than CSGO although I still advise NO money is spent on crates or keys(I sound like a hypocrite if you look in my inventory so to clear that up all items I have were given to me uncased or bought using money from sold goods in PUBG).Overall 8/10

review: Overall it is a fantastically well put together game that is fun for most people that play it and (Just like me) people who are used to the faster paced multiplayer games like Call Of Duty and Rainbow 6 Seige because it provides a different game mechanic and a very familiar feeling to Hunger Games movie that me and my friends longed for ever since we had been to see the Movie at the cinema. With that said the developers still have a few issues to fix before the game is 100 percent there. Like the glitches and slight bug even though it is 100 times better than what it was... its still the diffrent between picking up a shotgun and shooting the guy next to you at the start of the gane or being the guy who gets shot because the game keeps you suspended above the ground for a few seconds as it hasnt registered you have actually lannded or you get 100 meters in the vicinity of a leaf attached to a branch and you get stuck there for a good 10 seconds while the game decides weather its going to release you from the ALL SO POWERFUL LEAF. But... if you're looking for something diffrent in a run and gun shooter game thats bit faster than battlefeild (most of the time) but has the same level of tactical thinking that rainbow 6 seige has then this is a MUST for you! PLUS its only going to get better!

review: Its controls are a mix of arma 3 and squad but with action you might find in battlefield matches that last of an hour consisting of up to 96 players. The games uses a shrinking 'area of play' random bombings and care packages to force players to coming into contact with each other creating tense nail biting moments where a nearby shot could make you yourself.There are a few cons. The servers i have played on have mostly been laggy. The graphics are deffinetly lacking (i was running it on high settings with 75 fps). And a couple more all of which i contribute to it being an early access.'*on knees* please god deliver this game from early access.Edit Makes it to 4/93 without killing anyone P

review: So I bought this game with high hopes because of its immense success on Steam. I think you know where I'm going with this.My main turnoffs were Repeatedly getting killed by people I couldn't see. Yes you basically keep getting shot by people you can't see if you're caught out in the open.Unloading an entire ing clip into someone without them dying. This may be more of a personal issue. I just don't like the game mechanics I have no idea how you're supposed to get a kill but in my 3h of gameplay I failed to do so (Get good? Maybe but that would further prove how bad this game is to new players).It's very similar to H1Z1 which incidentally I hated. If you enjoyed H1Z1 this would probably be a good upgrade I enjoyed PUBG more than the aforementioned title.

review: I've put in about 40 hours of this game and I can definitely say I'd recommend it. It has addicting gameplay chasing the ever elusive winner winner chicken dinner and a really entertaining RNG system * RNG Jesus tho*. PUBG is fine going solo or joining random squads. I get some pretty good memories out of the random people I meet. It's a lot of fun to join your discord or irl buddies to play and stream it's really entertaining to watch how drunk you are later on trying to win. I just wish they would add a couple more guns and a couple more game variants. Maybe a zombie survival mode? The main problem for me is the servers the fact that it isn't regionlocked nor ping locked and just how you get connected. I have a 150mbps down 12mbps up hardwire connection and still catch some pretty crazy amounts of lag. Plus it's annoying to get connected with people you cant even talk to it makes squad cohesion go down the drain while trying to go past language barriers. Plus hackers. It's a great game with a couple annoying side bits but hey it looks gorgeous on a 1080ti and its really addicting to play. I'd give it a 8/10. Tl drPros Fun Gameplay Good graphics Great gunplay Addicting to play with friends or by yourself Get drunk and laugh your off Honestly a solid gameCons Servers No region lock no basic anti hacker security Glitchy at times even with a strong connection Buggy everynow and then

Get's repetitive fast2. Obnoxious "professional memer" community. Mute microphone sounds asap.3. Very bland visually nothing really stands out.4. Microtransactions added after the dev said their wouldn't be5. Has your typical early access problems.6. VERY POOR performance. Set everything to low or the game won't be playable for you.7. Def a walking simulator8. Developer is ok with 3rd party shaders and "visual mods" which give an advantage towards people who have them.

review: Very addictive gameplay. I was skeptical about the map shrinking because i really dont care for timed objectives. You know I want to take my time and enjoy games. Although each match doesnt feel the same. I get a sense of awareness and urgency when the map closes in. I like it. Each game mode if its singles doubles or squad each mode is different and you have to adapt to them. The developers are constantly updating. Im all about customization and theres a lot of that. Wish there was more items to customize with but i understand its in early access. Highly reccomend.

review: How can anyone possibly endorse a battle royale based game that is riddled with parisitic cheaters. I've played a fair few hours in the game and never has the problem been worse. I thought I had perfected the art of the spray but there appears to be a large amount of individuals who can full spray you with an AR from over 200m. That's just one of many problems. The game is horrendously optimised and runs like a potato. Network lag issues are still considerable. I've been at the end of game only to have my whole squad lose connection to the server with no possibility of rejoining the game. They have failed to release any serious content since the games initial release into early access and yet they still think the game is ready for full release. I don't know what these devs are smoking but clearly there self inflated egos haven't taken a hit. Do not buy this game not now anyway. Perhaps after full release the game will receive the scrutiny it deserves and the dev's might actually do something about these issues but for now it appears they couldn't care less.

review: Product received for free. If ever there were any doubt that PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds is one of the biggest hits of the year some new numbers last night confirmed it. The breakout shooter reached number 4 in Steam s ranking of most concurrent players ever its figure of 382 561 beating out Grand Theft Auto V and coming in behind Fallout 4. At one point Battlegrounds was also the most watched game on Twitch too a lot of people are playing and watching this game.Not bad for a game that hasn t even officially been released yet. And Battlegrounds didn t go about this the easy way. It saddled itself with an unwieldy name forcing most players to refer to it as the even less penetrable PUBG (rhymes with sub G). It also came out in Steam s Early Access program for games that are still in development with all the instability that implies. To call the game visually unappealing would be kind despite the fairly hefty system requirements and even players on powerful hardware are likely to run into major bugs.How on earth did it get so popular then? Well all you need to do is hook up your LED ridden mechanical keyboard and multi button gaming mouse to find out. I almost never play online shooters let alone online shooters as ugly and seemingly hardcore as PUBG and I m not really into watching livestreams either. But it only takes one round to understand why this game is so special.

I'm nominating this for the write in award as "The 'You Had Such Potential' Award".FInal Verdict Don't buy the game until it actually releases even then don't buy it unless the devs seem to have overcome the Early Access curse (lookin' at you ARK).

review: This game never should have come out of early access. The only reason it came out of early access was so that they could sell you loot boxes without any negative feedback. Oh by the way you don't get to pick which loot box you want. Three of them require keys at $2.50 per key. The fourth is free but you will never really get that one anymore. The game is written on terrible coding and no matter how much they patch and polish the game it will never respond the way you want it to. Shots do not register you can't pick up items Third party VOIP services to vpice chat which meant to prevent that is meant prevent cheaters causes people to not be able to use in game voice chat if they have a certain router Most games are spent looking for weapons now because of the spawn system. You may find something other than a pistol or shotgun if you are lucky and you live long enough. Certainly not a BATTLEGROUND! Now lets talk about all the cheaters that play the game. Almost the entire community wants them to block a country like most other publishers do. However they won't do it because the country in question keeps buying versions of the game and feeding into the greed. Long live 2018 for a AAA Battle Royal game.

review: Great game. Toxic community but isn't that really to be expected in a game like this?If you enjoyed DayZ but hated the bugginess of the game then you will enjoy this game.Don't expect a run and gun here this game is pure campfest. That being said it still moves quickly the mechanics of the game be sure of that. An average game will last you 25ish minutes if you're doing well. It's rare that you'll go more than 40 minutes even if you win.It has it's fair share of problems to be sure but the highs outweigh the lows.That being said they do occasionally run into issues for a day or two which is to be expected of a game that isn't released yet. We're a giant beta test group and they're learning from what happens and listening to the community. More than can be said of a lot of games.Easily worth 30 bucks.

review: I love this game. I play it every night with my friends and thoroughly enjoy it. However with the current influx of players from china playing anything but solo or premade squad is impoossible. The North American server is riddled with chinese players that cannot speak English which makes communication impossible. On top of that their ping is unplayable at best and disconnecting at worst. This leads to situations where you can get hit by someone that you have already downed which is absolutely frustrating. Not to mention the poor netcode that fluctuates more that an SJW's gender spectrum. However these are easily fixable problems that I'm sure with be fixed relatively quickly. I reccommend picking the game up then. I however need to get back to shooting bushes that I think are people.

review: Best $30 I've spent on Steam in a long time.The graphics are OK nothing cutting edge there. They remind me of something halfway between Just Cause 2 and S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl with some of the game mechanics from a Rainbow Six game. Basically the plot of the game is a Hunger Games esque large scale combat arena. You start with the clothes on your back are airdropped in at random (you choose when to jump and control where you go kinda) and find whatever you can to kill protect yourself... and ultimately you've got a 99% chance of dying every round. (literally... that is the statistic. 100 players 1 winner 99% chance of dying). SO... make it count D. Oh and those who complain about hackers... I've played 20 30 rounds so far and only ONE of my deaths MIGHT have been a hacker (possible aimbot with a map hack)... AND I reported them. The other 29 were 100% good tactics on their part/making a mistake on mine. I love the "death cam" for this very reason. I am able to watch how I was killed and watch for anything fishy about the circumstance. And here's the thing At any given time there is between 1 000 000 to 3 000 00 players in game at any given time... odds are if you run into a hacker you won't be playing with them the next round. I've made the top 10 in a round multiple times now it's all about tactics not running blindly in and shooting at people. Go into the game knowing that you will more likely be killed than kill it is all about survival and tactics and if you are killed unfairly... just report the hacker and start another round. Focus on how YOU play and just accept that sometimes you can't stop the bullet that you didn't see coming.

The shooting mechanics are also great and have many smaller mechanics hidden within (Bullet drop armor systems cover destructable objects ect.) Not to mention that the game looks pretty good on its own.

review: I recommended this game around 100 hours and wrote a positive review. At the time it was EA done correctly. Updates were happening with frequency and many of the problems were minor.Now the game has been stagnant in updates (about one per month at best). The more that has been "tweaked" has resulted in the game crashing &amp performing poorly.I know little to nothing about game/PC performance but I can tell this game has trouble running with each addition to the game.Lastly the cheaters have nearly made the game unbearable. It's about 50/50 anymore getting into a Top 10 and coming face to face with Flash or Bullseye.I love this game the more I play it because I feel like I'm just getting better and better and compete. It's sad that my investment of nearly 250 hours at this point basically means nothing.Here's to hoping this game is still playable by the time they add vaulting &amp a new map they've been promising for awhile.PLEASE DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE CHEATERS!!!!! This game would continue to be the most played game on PC.The only reason I have not changed the review to Not Recommended is because I play this weekly (usually with friends) and always have a great time.Having eaten a few chicken dinners affords me the casual attitude in which I now play the game for the moments &amp kills not for the chicky chicky din dins.Fortunately this aggro casual playstyle also makes the game more fun and easier to swallow when you do get botted by XQTYC3745008712.

review: At the beginning I was amazed by this game. The concept of a BR game was new to me and i really liked all the different ways in how you can play this game and how differently it evolves until the end depending on where and how the circle narrows. But after a while i realized that there is something strange with this game. If you start this game you might wonder why you are bad and each kill will make you enjoy this game as much as each death will drag you down. But after a while you might feel that the gameplay lags and it's not you whos bad but instead something is wrong with the game. Conclusion there is an input lag of 18ms between a mouseclick and the firing of your gun. This means that it's not only completely different from every shooter but also very different from shooting a normal gun. With a gun in the moment you aim down sight you pull the trigger as far as possible to be able to shoot immediately without the need of tracing the enemy after you fired (don't forget that the recoil will also not allow you to trace anymore). In PUBG it's different. Instead of making single shots or burst to hit/eliminate a target you almost always spray and pray. But luckily for some spray patterns are quite vertical and can not only be trained but also easily solved by macros. together with the input lag and the need to trace every enemy to kill it's made for hackers. Aimbots and no recoil hacks are not only popular because this game is so popular. They are popular because the gameplay is kind of designed for it. I guess Playerunknown might be someone who couldn't play real shooters why he designed a game that is camper and noob friendly and mainly random to give even him a chance to win. If you want to be really good in this game you need to learn spray patterns learn the evironment and loot as much as possible to run around fully armored most of the time. and don't forget to shake. peaking has no input lag (instead of firing a gun as i already told) why you can shake your characters head quite fast. So what you basically do to win a round is loot for a gun die from someone who got a better gun or kill the first opponent hide a bit listen to the totally unrealistic pseudo binaural and asynchronous step sounds loot more until you find a long range weapon run around with a constantly shaking character in order to avoid people from shooting your head because of their input lag camp a lot and kill all the people that forget to shake their heads all the time find somewhere a surpressor and make every supersonic gun a subsonic gun without any change in bullet drop or ballistics kill the remaining enemies from behind when they don't see you. so after about 100 hours of playing i had enough. Now I play Rainbow Six and the realism of audio and the non existing input lag are such a relief. Finally I use my skills again instead of relying on some useless muscle memories ( mainly shaking and fast looting). Ahh and finally far less cheaters.

review: "How Did it Go?" A Short StoryMy friend had to leave our squad match early and had asked us to kill him and take his stuff.Later he asked me "How did it go?"And it was with immense pain that I told him "It didn't. The truth was that together we had decided that once we ve gotten rid of you the dead weight we'd get rid of the rest.Indeed killing you traumatized us.Intentionally actions meant for good our heroes have finally lived long enough to see themselves become the villains of our story.Sully set a waypoint and without a word our other random friend faithfully drove up to the highest point of the hill.We all got out and waited for further instructions when Sully said to me "I don't think we need him"Astonished I replied "You think we can do this without him?"And he said "Yeah I think we can."And thus Sully began aiming his SMG at the poor fellow's forehead.Sensing only jest our teammate dodged playfully around the parked car.Little did he know that I standing behind him had received instructions in advance to eliminate him from behind.Before our teammate could grasp what was unfolding before his eyes I unloaded my shotgun into the base of his skull once and then once more.As he crumpled to the ground lifeless we could hear a disembodied voice that we could only believe to be his spirit exclaim from a distant realm "what the fu ...."Then all was still.Realizing we have reached a point of no return we decided to drive down the hill with considerable speed in our Jeep and like a Christmas miracle we descended unscathed.But lo in my murderous act I accidentally blew out the front left tire of our Jeep and it hobbled slowly to the top of another hill the final location where all who remained would be forced to gather.Once there Sully and I planned to snipe and catch these fools these fools who would be so foolish as to be unaware of our presence. However all this time I noticed sully was....deteriorating.Hotel Wi Fi was not treating him well you see.His movements would stutter every now and then and he told me in exasperation of the things he saw but the things that were not so.Soon reality as he knew it began to distort further.For instance he believed himself to be inside the car when indeed he was out of it. He thought our vehicle was still in motion when in reality it had all but come to a halt.He believed himself to be hidden behind a rock away from view when the truth was that he was in the grass below.It saddened me that the one person who I could call my friend was losing himself in this way.Then as we waited for the circle to enclose on us Sully turned to me and said "I have an idea. I think you should shoot me and take my things and take on entire squads" and I said "that sounds like a good idea but then he said "OR we could fight. You will stand behind the rock and I behind this tree and we shall fight to the death through a DUEL!"He said this through the crackling and cutting off of his words as his hotel Wi Fi plummeted him deeper into insanity.Forced to agree to the latter option we began our firefight.Handicapped by his Wi Fi or lack thereof I was easily able to bring Sully to his knees the circle was enclosing rapidly upon us."Pick me up!" he cried scrambling frantically all over the ground.In full command of his life I looked down on the crippled sod and said vehemently "Why should I? How do I know you won't kill me after I do?"And he looked up at me tears in his eyes. He replied "You don't but people are coming."With great reluctance I patched him up and cried out to him "It didn't have to be this way man. It didn't have to be this way!" while proceeding to crouch in a bush.And as Sully got on his feet dusting the dirt from his trousers he laughed "You keep saying that. You keep saying it didn t have to be this way. You're right."Sully pointed the barrel of his gun at me in a manner that was all too casual. It was at this point that i realized the chilling extent of his mental deterioration.The boy was mad.Before I was even able to say a word he unloaded his weapon upon my person and I fell to the ground limp and bereft of life.In the heavens now my ghost filled with woe looked down upon Sully.Without even saying a word Sully materialized a grenade from his backpack and pulled the pin. For a moment time stood still.An explosion of debris filled the sky.Sully's body slumped to the floor and once the dust had cleared all was silent save for the distant pitter patter of bullets flying through the clean Russian air.After Sully took the lives of his comrades he decided to take his own.What drove him to do this?What could have been done to prevent this?What could anyone have said?Was he not shown love as a child?Some say Sully embodies the scum of the earth a relentless killer murdering everyone in his wake without reason.Others say Sully wanted something better for himself and his teammates. He wanted to bring them into a world that was different where 100 or so people didn't have to fight each other to the death day in and day out.Scholars of this event what is now known as the "Epileptic Mouse Massacre" or the "Sully Slayings" say that it was due to Sully's lackluster internet connection and newfound evidence suggests that Sully had to attend a meeting of some sort causing him to take rash actions to for lack of a better term "end it all."With many questions and theories with no resolute answer to this day we are still left to speculate.This is one man's unfortunate account of the Epileptic Mouse Massacre.This is my story.**roll credits**

review: The game mechanic is so well thought out. The end is always inevitable but the victory condition is a mix of luck vigilance and preparation. You never know how it's going to turn out. So far I have won only once in 100 hours of gameplay and it took me 67 hours to get that chicken dinner. It's good that there's no player to player chat in the solo game. It would only be a really unwanted distraction. Erangel map seems to be strongly influenced by all things Chernobyl. Can't wait to see the next map. I'm glad I tried a multiplayer game after a long period of solo adventure games. It wasn't as bad as I had imagined from the not so great image of many multiplayer games.

review: Best Battle Royale game out right now. Very fun with intense moments alongside rage inducing ones. Pros Easy to jump into a game Good amount of different guns armor and meele weapons The game is somewhere inbetween Arma and Battlefield with the game feeling realistic enough but not clunky Regular weekly patches with 1 monthly patch (Good Dev support so far) Gameplay is fun and intense The game is really pretty (If you can run the higher settings)Cons Performance issues (low fps) Desync (Hit delay) Server performance First person Field of view is terrible BugsOverall if you like BR games and can run the game well then its worth it. 8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds does what many games like it struggle to do make large scale competitive multiplayer survival gaming exciting and accessible. The premise is straightforward. Up to 100 players parachute out of an airplane onto a huge island where they must immediately arm themselves with any weapons they can scavenge from its abandoned towns factories and military bases. Over the course of each match the size of the battlefield rapidly shrinks as does its pool of survivors as players begin taking each other out. This imposes an increasingly player dense playground for shoot outs. By the end of each game the last player standing or the last team standing wins. Few of the ideas in Battlegrounds are new. A handful of survival games and mods have explored similar concepts The Culling Hungercraft H1Z1 King of the Kill and of course the Arma 2 mod DayZ Battle Royale developed by PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds creator Brendan Greene aka PlayerUnknown. PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds could certainly be more polished but as it stands there s no wonder this intense online survival shooter has taken off so quickly. In a genre dominated by buggy rigid sims or explosive shoot em ups the thrill of simply outliving 99 other players on one life alone is hard to pass up. I would rate the game 9 out of 10

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Intro / TL DRPLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a Battle royale shooter. It features third or first person mode. The player can play the game in solo duo or squad mode (squad means up to four players). At the start of each match a plane (flying in a random direction) forces the players to parachute onto an island. The island has a few smaller towns and a lot of wildlands. At the start of each match the players have no equipment at all and must scavenge for weapons items of healing and armor. All the while competing with the rivalling players. There is another element as well. The accessible part of the gameworld is a randomly placedlarge circle. Within this large cicle is another circle. The outer circle will shrink towards the inner smaller circle leaving anyone outside of the circle taking damage. Once the shrinking circle reaches the static inner circle a new inner circle will be drawn and another timer will start. Displaying how much time each player has to reach the inner circleBeing outside of the outer circle results in players taking damage over time. A little at first and then more and more. This game is for you if you like third or first person shooters that require patience strategy positioning good eyes and ears and a bit of luck. These are the things you will need to be able to overlook The game is in early access right now. It is a bit buggy. Specifically in teams and getting a match started. This is sometimes due to the amount of players simply bogging the servers down The game can be frustrating if you land in a faraway place find no car and end up having several kilometers of walking to do. Since the loot is random you might end up having very poor gear. You get fed up with getting headshot by a Kar98 after a while. (trust me on this) There are some cheaters. Now I don't think this has been a major problem but I've been informed that it has become a bit more common of late. You cannot heal or use items that takes time whilst moving. This includes a moving car. Even if you're not driving. The bike with a sidecar is a total death trap. Be very careful. A few tips for enjoying the game. Try to be smart about where you land. Stay away from obvious drops. Keep track of how far you've got to go to the next circle. Try to not move by way of the plane drop path or good loot spots if you want to avoid combat If the equipment you have is good then don't take chances to loot further. Think about your position relative where people dropped where people will have looted and where there is a good place to hide. This is not Quake. A good shotgun shot to the face will down anybody. In the very beginning ANY weapon is a good weapon. Avoid running on ridges. This is especially true during the foggy maps where a person on a ridge stands out like Hulk Hogan at an all girl's school Use a good pair of headphones. this is really important. If you cannot tell from where you are taking fire you quite simply will die. A lot. What did I like about it? + PUBG has no micro transactions. + The voice chat can be deactivated + The sound system is good. You learn to tell distance and direction a shot originates from with some practice. + There is no public chat. So each game will not have a chat full of 13year olds or russians saying things about your mother. There's just you (maybe some friends) and enemies. The only way to commmunicate is bullets (with voice chat off). + Each round is different. Even the different game modes play differently. It takes a larger area to loot and equip four players. It is also a lot more difficult to move four players without anyone noticing you. + The weapons have a different feel to them. I very much like this game and wholeheartedly recommends it. Despite it being in Early Access.

review: I really enjoyed this game in beta playing a fair few hours on it. Buggy sure but it was beta. And there weren't even that many. And it would be completely fine if they continued improving on the game squashing the bugs and making the game run smooth like it needs to.Instead they've gone down the route of just throwing as much content into the game as possible with no regards to increasing the stability of the game. For a game that is meant to be at it's full release it is god awfully full of bugs and network issues. Honestly feels like playing a Ubisoft game at release.Rubber bandingEU servers unable to handle loadEntire lobbies being dropped out of planes all in one areaHackers4 issues that needed to be fixed before they even considered being "Fully Released"Due to these issues I have to give it a negative. Which is a shame because it has potential and the developers up until this point had been amazing.

review: TLDR unoptimized runs like crap freezes randomly stay away As of writing this review the game is running like crap hit detection is funky full of bugs and lag not to mention random freezes either in game or on loading screen which can be amazing when you play with friends and the game decides that you are not going to play in this round as by the time you load back in some one will be there with a weapon waiting for you.... These random freezes would be okay if it would happen rarely but every other match someone from the squad freezes out and it is not the hardware we range from amd 270x up to 1070 and we all have this problem.Fixis are coming as stem pull in from time to time a big update but not much change a few visual updates but the game runs the same... no major bug fixes whatsoever.Cool idea might be a cool game (probably in a year or two if it survives that long running like this) but at the moment poor execution. If you have a powerful machine might be fun when it's not freezing/crashing otherwise wait until they push out more fixes that actually fix

You can go a long way with a silencer.I have a quad core phenom II 865 (built 2009) with gtx 960 and ssd drives. The game lags on occasional matches but it usually clears up. The lag is noticed more in high traffic drop areas like school.Could do with a scrimmage mode or warm up play type with FFA. Just something where you don't have to queue wait then die quickly only to wait again.

review: PUBG (PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS) is a bit of a odd game. The game itself is very tactical I would recommend it if there wasn't such a community backlash currently. Since around the 1.0 update the community has been throwing rocks at Bluehole due to the enourmous amount of hackers and the amount coming from one region China. Recently there has been an uproar of people tweeting on PUBG's Twitter posts saying things like "Region Lock China" and the infamous "#REGIONLOCKCHINA" spammed all over the Twitter page. The reason I can't recommend this game to you as Bluehole and PLAYERUNKNOWN might as well be flipping us off. The game is fun and all but when I am on the plane I don't like hearing some weird "CHINA CHICKA WAW!!" it's annoying. I wouldn't be bothered if I wasn't in the North American servers. If Bluehole could at least face the fact that a huge amount of hackers are from China than that would make lots of people happy. But they can't because that is where most the players are. All I have to say is that "Region Lock China" has effected the game a ton. Reviews have went down dramatically since and if not recognized sales will go with the good reviews away. Bluehole needs to get their together and face the music until then all I can say is that you should not purchase PUBG Garfield
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I hate it I love it what can I say? Some aspects of the game I absolutely LOVE e.g the thrill you get after wiping out a squador duo on your own the thrill of when you get a chicken dinner the fun you can have by playing with your friends but every game has to have its cons... PUBG can really get frustrating sometimes because yes I know its now in "official release"but it still feels like its in BETA for the amount of glitches that are still happening like when I was playing with my friend a duo we both got four kills each and when there were two other people left (we had the upper hand by better positioning and better weapons) my keyboard and mouse stopped working in game. Now that on its own was the worst timing ever then I had to re launch the game and when I did that I couldnt continue on the match that my friend still was in so Id recommend this game if you like gambling in a way with the bugs and glitches but also of winning and feeling like you can conquer the world.

It used to be a pretty decent game but as many of the reviews will tell you everytime you die you have to wonder "was that a legit headshot or are they running a hack?". It has become blatantly more obviously lately as the hackers aren't afraid to openly display that they're runnig hacks. Feel free to buy the game check out the leaderboards then request a refund. Wouldn't waste $30 on this wouldn't play it for free in its current state.Update 12/30. About 2 out of every 3 games are still going to be ended due to a cheater. Game still isn't worth it. (this is based on third person perspective though)

review: As someone who played before and after the 1.0 launch PUBG has definitely improved. Graphics are great and it's still a fun game despite its flaws. Speaking of flaws I've noticed that even still the parachute physics are quite bad and movement is really clunky. Sometimes when parachuting in the models aren't fully loaded for my surroundings and neither are the textures resulting in the surroundings being blotchy sharp bloblike objects for around 30 seconds. This game still needs optimization. However I think it's on the right track and I'd recommend buying it now simply because the goods outweigh the bads and it can only get better from here.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is the only game on my steam library I actually paid full price for. Was it worth? I think my money was spent correctly. The gameplay of the game is intense and can get your heart racing if you actually get into the game. Some problems that I have on the game is the driving aspect of the game should be fixed. Ex. if you hit a rock with your car your car goes flying straight up in the sky and you will take fall damage and this can lead to your sad death. Overall this game was worth the purchase and the game is being improve slowly. People may see theat the game is in early access and the game will go nowhere but I see great potential in the game and hopefully we will see a full release by the end of the year.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 10 hour playtime and the game crashed like 6+ times already. Or just closes itself without any error. Or just BUGs in the game and lags that i can not do anthing like moving then it lags and the house is gone then its there again etc. Really really buggy game so far its fun yeah. Its early access yeah for a reason I guess because this game is so buggy and unstable if this would be a final version it would be a joke. The game is fun in duo+ but valium in solo. Most of the time you run around and do not see any enemy at all then out of a sudden you get killed from far away and you don't even know from where exactly... same happens to everyone you do the same of course. But is it fun? No.. The close combat encounters tho are fun and very cool. In house fights and all that is great. But too often you just run around and get shot out of nowhere without even seeing your opponent. That is just dumb and not fun at all.Overall its an good game but doesn't deserve the massive hype around it not in the slightest. But it is an ok game worth it for 20 or 30 bucks depending on where you buy it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Released far too early. Laggy rubber banding and RNG have made this game a complete mess. Lagging around whilst struggling to find even the most basic of items only to get gunned down by a hacker. Or someone that just had better luck than you. Or you get lucky and get a few decent items and weapons early then spend the rest of the game running to stay in the safe zone. The time for the circles needs to be increased. Good gunfights are ruined by the 2 3 minute nonsense we currently have. And either the netcode or servers are still way underpar for this game to be competetive. Most likely the netcode. You've got no excuses now Bluehole Your game is no longer in early access remember. So start spending some of the millions this game has made you. On better hardware and better developers that can fix this laggy mess. When you first land in a squad game you will rubber band back for a good 30secs 1min. Only to then find a item then spend another 10 20 secs smashing F to pick the item up. It really is a joke.So bluehole please fix this mess you've just released or do the right thing and admit that this game is still early access. Also get some cheat detection.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First of all I want to say that this game is great gameplay theme weapon behavior and lot of more stuff.BUTDevelopers are focusing into most important things like emotes and achievements instead of small bugs like lags (everytime everywhere) and parachute issues when landing or make game more playable. (HUGE SARCASM)You will recieve tons of "Servers are to busy" messages before you start a game.Game crashes a lot! Every update more crashes.But hey we have emotes now! (I never seen someone using them somewhere else than lobby)So for now i really dont recommended this game because you die about 400% more because of lags (e.g. you are behind wall but game things you are exposed and get kill).And the inventory system? It's huge joke. I (sometimes) pickup weapon and it takes almost 20 seconds when I can use it. Or I drop item and now it's on the floor AND in my inventory for some time.btw I will probably still play PUBG D

review: DISCLAIMER This game is EARLY ACCESS. Learn what that ing means before you buy Also the "controversy" "stream sniping" and "microtransaction" news is laughable and does not affect the game or player.REVIEW Every single game is a rush. Whether you are rocking Solo and pushing the circle to top 5 or running and gunning with a full Squad to a Duo match when you and your buddy are trying to scrape to survive against the odds. Events unfold extremely fast and games can last "long". But again it's all about playstyle. Are you the person who likes to jump into the heat and try to get as many kills as possible as quickly as you can? Or are you the stealthy dude who sneaks around and plots for that long game?Try it out.

review: Do you recommend this game? I am inbetween to be honest.This review may not matter since this game is hitting it's stride in popularity etc etc etc but I say you should save your money or get it on SALE?!? Don't pay full price for this game!While immensely flawed from the begining PUBG brought a new and intense gaming experience like nothing we had ever really seen before. This game was a step up from H1Z1 for me to be honest. It was a fun game thrilling and adrenaline pumping and WINNING CHICKEN DINNERS BAYBAY.However This game needs a lot of work done. CONS 1.) HACKER Sadly in the last few weeks the game has become infested with hackers heavily!2.) Glitches people glitching around car getting stuck and exploding for no reason or the car hitting random invisiable objects and dying AFTER getting into cover somehow?!3.) Servers still lagging terribly!4.) Spawn items They're getting a tad terrible. There are a lot of places where theres ammo and no gun or vice versa. Yes no one else has landed where I landed. Please for the love of GOD get rid of the CROSS BOW!5.) DEVS They're great on some things. However they are missing the point on fixing the game first then move onto expanding the game next. They're all over the place with this game instead of fixing the current issues at hand!Last one I promise....6.) The WALL OF DOOM Please make it where you can't see out of the circle or in the circle! (Lets say like H1Z1 the GREEN GAS WALL OF DEATH) When people get screwed by the circle and honestly don't have a good chance to hunt for good loot and a vechicle. With any luck you find a vehicle you can continue to loot and proceed from there. However my point of the circle henderance would be great to add for BOTH PLAYERS DISADVANTAGES (THE BLUE WALL OF DEATH) afterall it is BLUE so why not roll with it!PROS I enjoy this game more when I play with my squads. So many things you can do to fail horribly. Laughing your butt off while driving and messing up driving over your friend or killing a WHOLE SQUAD with the UAZ. Also when you're so in depth in looting thinking you're shooting enemies while you're actually shooting teammate. There's time when seeing a downed friend run res him/her just to shoot him down again for shitz and giggles. Streaming this game and just having an overall fun time making fun of your teammates or laughing at your own FAILS on the streams are the most EPIC moments you can CLIP!I hope this helps someone out there on my PRO &amp CONS about this game!It's honestly to your discretion on what you want to do with your money!Cheers Lovely Vanyai

review: Decent First Person Shooter / Third Person Shooter.Current problem with the game and why i can't recommend the game There are rubberbanding Issues which results in you not being able to pick up items you are standing op top of even if you spam the pick up item key which can be crucial and often times outright deadly. There are no region lock (this is a problem because the majority of the playerbase is chinese (41% of the player base) and do to an uther lack of competence from the creator of the game Brendon Green they are forced to pay a monthy fee to get access to a VPN service so they can play the game and to try and avoide that the chinese players are joining american and european servers which results in people with an horrible ping will be joining servers they wore never supose to be playing at in the first place (some times you can even be downed by player you have already downed yourself...) There is a huge cheating problem in the game. (99% of all cheaters are chinese (this number is taken from the banned list im not making it up 99% of all cheaters are from china so this creates a huge problem for none chinese players when chinese players play on none chinese servers. People have been banned for the crime of shooting Twitch Streamers (doesn't matter if you have a twitch account watching the stream or not just the act of shooting a streamer have gotten people perma banned from the game. People have been banned for driving around the game honking the horns in the cars. People have been banned for shoting people that join Squads as randoms who shot their team mates... ye that's right shoting a teamkiller in selfdefence against other teamkillers have gotten people Permabanned from the game. The Anti cheating "service" is more incompetent than Brendon Green. The Driving Physics of the game is the worst i have played it years. The Creator of the game Brandon Green said that the game would never have Micro Tranctions or loot boxes (he later added them anyway. he also states in a interview that any player complaining about the "cheater problem or wanting region locking to stop people running around on servers they never should have been on Xenophobic and racists bigots. Last update on the number of PUBG bans 1 500 000 Dec 28 2017 (not all accounts banned that was banned was banned for cheating) February 16 PUBG has sold over 30 million copies according to Steam Spy.So a total of 5% of all copies sold have been banned...

TBH for a "quick match" game to just get on and split skulls... there's alot involved with the level of attention to detail that one needs to succeed... the lag only makes it depressing. I run a PC that is better than the system req's and cant figure it out. If youre looking for a new game to roll... save your money until the garbage is taken out of this one. review: This game is my first battle royale game. I got this game from the gaming community which now has about 2 million people playing this game daily. Despite the game plagued with bugs and crappy optimization I had tons of fun playing this game because winning isn't the fun thing here meeting enemies and killing them with physics that doesn't make any sense is the fun and funniest part of this game. And also bluehole deserves a thumbs up for listening to the community and working hard to release the 1.0 despite the bugs in the current version. Its an early release game anyways which I can expect to be riddled with bugs.

review: Today i was picking an airdrop with a friend when suddenly some random guy comes in crash his car into the other side of the box and magically "run me over" through the drop.So i want to make a big review to make myself look profesional and a dev can read this and fix this crap of a game.Here it goes a copy of Congo's independence speech "Men and women of the Congo Victorious independence fighters I salute you in the name of the Congolese Government.I ask all of you my friends who tirelessly fought in our ranks to mark this June 30 1960 as an illustrious date that will be ever engraved in your hearts a date whose meaning you will proudly explain to your children so that they in turn might relate to their grandchildren and great grandchildren the glorious history of our struggle for freedom.Although this independence of the Congo is being proclaimed today by agreement with Belgium an amicable country with which we are on equal terms no Congolese will ever forget that independence was won in struggle a persevering and inspired struggle carried on from day to day a struggle in which we were undaunted by privation or suffering and stinted neither strength nor blood.It was filled with tears fire and blood. We are deeply proud of our struggle because it was just and noble and indispensable in putting an end to the humiliating bondage forced upon us.That was our lot for the eighty years of colonial rule and our wounds are too fresh and much too painful to be forgotten.We have experienced forced labour in exchange for pay that did not allow us to satisfy our hunger to clothe ourselves to have decent lodgings or to bring up our children as dearly loved ones.Morning noon and night we were subjected to jeers insults and blows because we were "Negroes". Who will ever forget that the black was addressed as "tu" not because he was a friend but because the polite "vous" was reserved for the white man?We have seen our lands seized in the name of ostensibly just laws which gave recognition only to the right of might.We have not forgotten that the law was never the same for the white and the black that it was lenient to the ones and cruel and inhuman to the others.We have experienced the atrocious sufferings being persecuted for political convictions and religious beliefs and exiled from our native land our lot was worse than death itself.We have not forgotten that in the cities the mansions were for the whites and the tumbledown huts for the blacks that a black was not admitted to the cinemas restaurants and shops set aside for "Europeans" that a black travelled in the holds under the feet of the whites in their luxury cabins.Who will ever forget the shootings which killed so many of our brothers or the cells into which were mercilessly thrown those who no longer wished to submit to the regime of injustice oppression and exploitation used by the colonialists as a tool of their domination?All that my brothers brought us untold suffering.But we who were elected by the votes of your representatives representatives of the people to guide our native land we who have suffered in body and soul from the colonial oppression we tell you that henceforth all that is finished with.The Republic of the Congo has been proclaimed and our beloved country's future is now in the hands of its own people.Brothers let us commence together a new struggle a sublime struggle that will lead our country to peace prosperity and greatness.Together we shall establish social justice and ensure for every man a fair remuneration for his labour.We shall show the world what the black man can do when working in liberty and we shall make the Congo the pride of Africa.We shall see to it that the lands of our native country truly benefit its children.We shall revise all the old laws and make them into new ones that will be just and noble.We shall stop the persecution of free thought. We shall see to it that all citizens enjoy to the fullest extent the basic freedoms provided for by the Declaration of Human Rights.We shall eradicate all discrimination whatever its origin and we shall ensure for everyone a station in life befitting his human dignity and worthy of his labour and his loyalty to the country.We shall institute in the country a peace resting not on guns and bayonets but on concord and goodwill.And in all this my dear compatriots we can rely not only on our own enormous forces and immense wealth but also on the assistance of the numerous foreign states whose co operation we shall accept when it is not aimed at imposing upon us an alien policy but is given in a spirit of friendship.Even Belgium which has finally learned the lesson of history and need no longer try to oppose our independence is prepared to give us its aid and friendship for that end an agreement has just been signed between our two equal and independent countries. I am sure that this co operation will benefit both countries. For our part we shall while remaining vigilant try to observe the engagements we have freely made.Thus both in the internal and the external spheres the new Congo being created by my government will be rich free and prosperous. But to attain our goal without delay I ask all of you legislators and citizens of the Congo to give us all the help you can.I ask you all to sink your tribal quarrels they weaken us and may cause us to be despised abroad.I ask you all not to shrink from any sacrifice for the sake of ensuring the success of our grand undertaking.Finally I ask you unconditionally to respect the life and property of fellow citizens and foreigners who have settled in our country if the conduct of these foreigners leaves much to be desired our Justice will promptly expel them from the territory of the republic if on the contrary their conduct is good they must be left in peace for they too are working for our country's prosperity.The Congo's independence is a decisive step towards the liberation of the whole African continent.Our government a government of national and popular unity will serve its country.I call on all Congolese citizens men women and children to set themselves resolutely to the task of creating a national economy and ensuring our economic independence.Eternal glory to the fighters for national liberation!Long live independence and African unity!Long live the independent and sovereign Congo!"

review: UPDATE Now that the game is 1.0 there is no reason for half thses issues that this game has. When it runs right it is a blast. For the other 80% of the time this game is a cespool of chinese hackers and lag exploiters. I play only on NA servers and the only thing I hear over the gobal chat is Chinese. Blue Hole needs to find some way to ping lock and actually get rid of hackers. Until then this game is mostly unbareable. I have given it more than one chance and it keeps letting me down.I would say overall this game is a blast. Bluehole is constantly updating the game and relaying information reguarding updates and server issues through their social media accounts. However there is an issue at the moment reguarding people using exploits in the code to cheat their way to victory. These accounts are becoming a rairty however it is still really frustrating when it happens. I would say overall the game is just dumb fun and at first most of the games will be quick as you get the hang of where to land to find loot and get a feel for the combat. I have had very few games give me the rush at the end of a match like when I see I am part of the final 10. TLDR A very fun game worth the buy be prepared for BS deaths and to see the menu screen very often
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While I enjoy the game from time to time I do not like the fact you can not pick your map I also do not like the gun drop rate you are so unlikely to get what you can actually use on the desert map it is not even funny. Another thing the developers claim they have fixed the cheating issue they have not. There are just as many as there where months ago the only way to fix the cheating issue is to IP ban them not just ban the account and they do not. PUBG if you want to fix your game actually fix it don't dawdle around the issue actually work on it. If you want my opinion the game was released before it should have been the necessary revisions were not made before the game hit live.

review: Good Fun gun fights when you don't experience below (Odds are 1 of 10 fights) Good hit reg when you don't experience below Decent time on games if you survive to end (doesn't drag out anymore)Bad Chinese hackers De sync advantage from foreign region players NA Server with TPP mode is full of non region players (Chinese turn on your ingame mic and listen) Cameras suck while riding passenger. Constant little annoying bugs/poor design Bars on windows are annoying as Staircase guard rails are annoying as Aiming over/under structure is annoying as Vehicles are unforgiving / not fun to drive in First Person Don't stand near the three seater motorcycle while flipping it back upright Rubberbanding still present on 1.0 + Update1 Laggy start if landing anywhere near 10+ people Often getting stuck jumping/vaulting Team indicators on screen still suck after changing them Structure not drawing on map cause people to seem invincible (Ultra view setting) Impossible to use 1/4 of the outside edge of Miramar due to circle speed The parachuting sucks since I've been playing (August) Gun balance problems Improved 4x scope and made 8x scope sniper in my opinion Inventory system is while trying to swap weapons near capacity (don't even try to loot a crate if you are decked out) Clothing items are in the game. Constantly picking up these items while trying to grab loot The Red Zone is and so are the sound levelsI just uninstalled thanks to being stuck and unable to get out resulting in my Duo partner attempting to use frag grenades to dislodge me from the spot. We used 4 at different angles but were unable to free my character. I got my money's worth but its a shame I can't get more. you Blueballs

review: At it's current state game is ing cancer. I regularly have errors where the game randomly freezes so i have to leave lobby and rejoin where i join back already dead. The game is plagued with hackers and random hit reg bugs. Game is also inconstant with guns ocasionally destroying someone at close range and then doing no damage the next. That being said the game has potential and can be fun but drives you crazy with all the t and induced rage causing you to hate the game. Definetly dont waste $40 on the game like i did. Pick it up on sale. Definitely a hungry money grab from the developers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Having read all the negative reviews I was a bit anxious to buy this game. However after 50 games I'm happy to say that the game is awesome. Many people complain about cheaters but I personally haven't run into any and I always watch the deathcam when I die. The big downside for me is the horrible performance and the badly written netcode. If the devs get their act together and manage to fix that there won't be really anything to complain about. So if the negative reviews are putting you of from buying this game there isn't that much for you to be worried about. Get the game and jump into the battle!

review: I guess I love to hate this game. This is probably the best battle royale game on the market. It can be fun and challenging. However lately I feel cheated almost every round. I am sure there are plenty of legit players out there who are crack shots but I keep getting head shot in fast moving vehicles or while running across rough terrain. When I do manage to skirt past the aimbot enthusiasts I seem to die outside the zone running from the e field in the top 10. Not sure what the point of the gas being so strong and fast in the end game but it seems to ruin the tactical environment. What was the point of finding the perfect loot when there is nothing to fight the gas? If you do get into a fight trying to move to the zone there is no point since the winner will be killed by the blue wall of shame. Seems to go from 1%HP/s to 5%HP/s in one round and tonight half of the remaining top 7 8 players were killed outside the zone. I think a great system would be to group players by class. If they have 10 kills per game they should be grouped with other players who regularly have 10 kills per game and leave us amateurs to play with like people. Probably just pit cheaters against cheaters but at least it get them out of the legit players hair. I love this game but at the current state I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So here is an honest answer from me about this game. I started playing this game from the launch of early access and have watched this game and it's community grow. During early access I do have to admit that the game did have a lot of issues. It was buggy lagged a lot had problems with server stability and fps dropping unexpectidly. The thing about all of this is that the game is still in development and it's to be expected to have this level of issues. With that being said I still believe this game is great. I also really like that the developers and PUBG team talk openly with everyone about what they are working on and changes they are doing. I do run an above average rig so this game runs smoothly for me more or less. I believe that all of the problems people complain about in this game is a result of an expectation they have on how the game should run/be. I think that if they take in consideration that this is a new team working on a huge project that they would be able to be more accepting to the fact this game has hurdles to get over. I have been very pleased with how they handle the issues and problems that arise and listen to the community and ask for feed back. We all just need to remember that this game isn't being developed by companies like EA or whatever. Give them time to grow and perfect their ability to create a game we all love and enjoy.I am a big fan of this game that is in it for the long run!PUBG keep up the good work and don't worry about all the negativity that you get from people. All great things had a starting point at one point in time. This is your starting point.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Vehicles are less than responsive or overly responsive. Vaulting needs work.

review: Although still in its alpha build in my opinion PUBG is one of the best and most immersive battle royale games of all time. The ability to choose which region to play in such as Asia Oceania and North America and what gamemode to play which consists of single duo and team gamemode are what makes PUBG flexible and diverse and thus players are not only able to play with their friends but also other players from different regions. However most importantly it is the gameplay that defines the game. In my opinion duo and team game modes are absolutely fun and thrilling and it is advisable for players to play with their own friends rather than strangers to receive the best experience. This is because effective communication (through mumble or discord which are my preferable communication platforms ) and good teamwork are needed to win. In addition the need to keep track of other players' locations and have high situational awareness to avoid getting ambushed and gather better loot makes the gameplay extremely thrilling and will surely keep players at the edge of their seats. Single gamemode may lack the teamwork and communication but this makes the gameplay even more challenging and thrilling. In conclusion there is great potential in PUBG and I truly look forward to its beta build's release which may consists of more gamemodes new in game equipments and features and even tournaments after the creators manage to fix the minor existing problems and bugs and polish the game up.
