review: In my opinion the best BR out there BUT The optimasation is ABSOLUTE SH*T I mean like ABSOLUTE SH*T (I'm running on an i7 6700k with a gtx970 and i'm still dropping down to 24fps at certain periods of the game). The worst bug I'm getting is a simple network bug where my tickrate drops down to 0.1 or something similar and it is not even possible to sprint as the game just pushes you back as if you were slow walking almost impossible to even pick up a weapon in that state. You can bug in staircases walls cars pretty much everything (rare but still happens and essentially leaves u for dead cause there is no way to escape it) The genuine tickrate on all servers is very very poor. You tend to get shot after you are behind a wall just because that extra half second the server didn't ping back your player got hit although on your screen you were behind already. Lower spec PCs will have a hard time even loading textures at the start which completely ruins all early game for a lot of people.+The adrenaline out of this game is pure gold (when this piece of junk works)+First BR that is extremely competitive+The reward for winning is quite comparable to the Dark Souls franchise for those of you who played it you know how good that feels DAll in all if the case was that I wouldn't anticipate another update from the current beta I'd say screw this piece of garbage its not worth your money but since a legit version is actually coming out soon go for it might aswell get some training in before the real game is released.

review: If I'm being honest I love this game. However it is a victim of many early access games it is poorly optimized and has a lot of glitches and bugs that need to be addressed. The Devs seem to know this and have promised to fix them in time. Aside from that the game is incredibly fun and intense. From the moment that you drop to the moment you are trying to find the last enemy hiding in the grass this game is entertaining. I would recommend this game.

review: I can't honestly recommend this game... even with a high end PC and their recent "optimization patch" this game still runs like garbage. It has been built on a very poor foundation of code and can not be fixed without a complete overhaul. It's full of chinese hackers and you can't even parachute into the game without frames dropping to 30fps. The looting system is slow and buggy and drop rates are near nothing. Do not waste your time or money only to be repeatedly shot in the head by an aimbot.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As someone who has played since the Early Access phase pretty much exclusively... I cannot reccomend this game anymore. I put up with the bugs since release the net code the de sync being awful.. but even after 800 hours of play time and close to a year of development after release this game is still in an unplayable state. If the devs actually nurtured and cared for this game it would be GOTY worthy. I don't regret picking the title up I've had some seriously amazing moments with my friends playing this game but as of late the experience has grown stale. Hacking has been a SERIOUS issue for this game you'll see players speed hacking shooting through walls being bulletproof being invisible or just simply firing into the air and getting headshots on players across the map. So as you loot for 20 minutes to get your prefered loadout 7/10 times you'll get killed by a cheater or someone with an awful ping. I can't say this enough DONT BUY THIS TITLE.Even Sony won't buy it because of the state of it.Save your money boys TriHard 7 out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 30 minutes for 2 kills. Go play a proper FPS and enjoy it for the whole time you play it. No RNG loot drops No laggy Chinese hackers No garbage gun handling.

review: Its fair to say that ive played this game a lot... since alpha actually. Since then ive been irritated by the poor optimization of the game but it has gotten better as the game has progressed and i am pleased to say i am happy with the games current state but this bring us to why i hate this game. Up until recently the NA server has been a NA server good fun people screaming at each other press z follow me. But now... its an off brand AS server flooded with hackers. Since when did i need to know mandarin to play on a NA server? Not to mention the fact that every single hacker that I encounter in this game IS asian. PUBG please for the love of god make this game great again and #RegionLockChina

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It really is a dissapointment at the state of the game. This used to be ( and still is ) probably one of my favorite games and has been a total blast to play with friends. Unfortunately it seems impossible to have fun knowing youve probably got a hacker in your game and all of your trying is absolutely useless. And just knowing the fact that hackers are gonna win every game takes the whole fun out of "having a good time even if you dont come out on top" it seems rare to make it past the top 5 now. If i could take a look at my W/L over time im sure itd show a massive drop right around when the game dropped in 1.0. The sad thing is just that hackers arent a once in maybe 10 games occurence id say every game you get into has a 7/10 chance of having autoaiming hackers in the server. Its not even hiddne at all. most of the time its some person with a Kar98 or Automatic AR sniping from an impossible distance with no recoil in third person recticle mode. Nothing is more frustrating than having an M249 in the final 10 with 8 kills just to get shot in the head and have a frag land right next to you and instanly explode then watching the kill cam to see "LiuXiabo123" sitting outside of the blue zone with no damage and autoaim. I would love to be able to actually play the game more but it seems pointless as even if im in the final few theres probably an asian hacker ready to screw me with an instant headshot. Please do something to fix this. I would NOT buy this game for a couple more months until the hackers are gone. At this point it is simply unplayable.

Sounds are far better and less painful lag is still a miinor issue though way more resolved rubberbanding is completely gone now and Bluehole iw working on the hacker situation. All this game needs now is better optimization and more game modes and maps.

review: Alright so if you can tolerate lots of people screaming in chinese over voice chat and teamkilling you and anyone else who speaks english on a NORTH AMERICAN server then this might be the game for you. There is an overwhelming number of players who take advantage of having a really REALLY high ping so that they can appear to teleport either around corners or through doors.There are random sections of the map where you can walk and suddenly see through buildings and even shoot through multiple buildings and walls because the only thing that you can see from these places are other players no buildings no grass no terrain nothing but enemy players. You can shoot someone in the face 30 times with a SCAR only to find out that you did no damage and then they turn around and kill you with a headshot by punching you.Even with all of these things I still can't stop playing this game.11/10Please help me now my sanity wanes.

review: This is the only game play that actually gets worse as time does on. Stopped playing around new years come back a couple months later and somehow they actually manage to make the server issues worse? What rtards are in charge of this.Constant rubber banding at the start and continues on and off throughout the match. Think you're in cover? Guess again you just jumped 5 metres to the left. Trying to get the jump on some guy? How about we ing put you right in front of him.Parachutte system at the start is absolutely pathetic. You are lucky if you manage to lanbd without taking damage. More than likely your guy will just glitch out and you'll hang there doing nothing for about 5 mins until the game lets you cut your chord. Finally if you have a good internet connection just forget it. You'll end up constantly getting ed by people running dial up who manage to kill you when you are behind cover.

review: I will admit the main fundementals of this game are REALLY fun. It has some flaws but it could have been the greatest game of 2017 EASILY. Keywords could have since the developement of this game for the past four months has been probably been the worst Developemnt and PR disaster I have ever seen in a game even beating games like Battlefront 2 and any post Black Flag Assains Creed game ever. I highly recomend you never buy this game. BlueHole decided to appeal to websites like Polygon and have labeled the calls of their Western audience to region lock China due to lag advantage and hacking as Xenophobic. Even with Battle Eye Pubg still guarenties you a hacker in every single ing game. They have had all the time in the world to fix these problems but they can't do it for some reason. I don't personally find Fortnite as fun as a good Pubg game but the devs are at least consistant. Some devs are willing to fix their games on the holidays away from their familys but BluHole cant even realise that 99 pervcent of their hackers are from the country they are victimizing. I would give the gameplay a D and the Developement an F. 0 stars and 0/10. Just play h1z1 or fortnite.

review: This game is good... really fun exciting and gives a stress filled yet funexperience however... this game is lost. It will never resurge as the game it once was simply for the fact that instead of improving and adding to the gameplay the developers are deciding that its smart to add microtransactions and skins. And not skins that are worth 3 dollars skins that are worth 300 dollars. Its a foolish way to die and personally I like this over fortnite however the appeal is near gone with the game and the developers can only blame themselves not the competition. For this game's sake drop the keys and do what you did before because at this rate i give this game less than a year. 4/9/2018I just realized a GIGANTIC issue with this game by playing a few games. Its SO SLOW. Every single movement is slow and it seems like on whatever planet PUBG is on it has crazy gravity because even getting out of the car takes ten years. So if people arent already cocked and ready to shoot at youre more than likely gonna get screwed over anyway.

review: This game is really fun to play. You loot guns vests shoot out your enemies drive cars. But until you struggle with a bug. Your chances to face a bug in every single game is too damn high because there are millions of bugs glitches. To enter a house you will open the door and get in the house. Unfortunately not in PUBG. Once you pass the door you ll find yourself facing one of the outside walls of that house. You saw an enemy and trying to shoot him? F&lt 3&lt 3&lt 3 YOU! You cant because there will be lags glitches et. and you will find yourself dead. I'm hearing you screaming is this all?? Of course no! I forgot the most important part CHEATERS! To sum up if you are looking forward to buying this game do not buy it until they fix the game and make it playable.

review: This game what can I say.. It's only got better it started with lots of potential but with it's bugs. It was choppy and it had it's issues yet still dropped like a bomb accoss the world. Now it's probably even bigger than I had ever imagined and I've not looked back! I love this game! The endless jumps with my mates where we have all died gone back to the lobby and been like "are we going again?" Then there's the ones where we have dug in and managed to get that chicken dinner after a dogged battle. Long may it live the hype is still real my friends. I am really excited to see what else the game will bring in the months ahead.

review: No.This game is seriously terrible and i havent had any fun with it for the amount of hours i have owned it.Firstly this game barely works with absolute awful mechanices that barely work for example i was laying on the floor scoped and i couldnt unscope which led to my death.Secondly theres no hit detection meaning you die instantly as you cant see where your attacker is. This mechanic is awful. If the prey doesnt see the predator then they are dead.Thirdly the RNG is horrible i wont expand.Lastly which is the biggest point theres no way to learn via the game. if you play you will be punished everytime with no way to learn when i started i just wanted to know the basic mechanics and i couldnt as there is nothing to teach even a terrible tutorial would help but instead im thrown straight into a battleground ).In conclusion i hate this game it plays poorly doesnt make sence no retaliation can happen no way to learn the game.I honestly regret wasting my money on this broken piece of garbageI guess twitch streamers are the trash man then...Also who tf puts there online alias in their game yes a narcissistic prick that only cares abour money OH WAIT!!!

review: Game is by far the best Battle Royale style game ive played nothing is quite like it.there are MANY issues with CTD Freezing Crashing and lag spikes in the game also a fair few memory leaks.i believe they should do a check when you load up a game right now that if your charecter is still alive you can reconnect to the game in progress. instead of wasting your time being top 15 20 hiding in a house with awesome gear and losing to a crash is really quite unfair.the gameplay is very rewarding the loot system is interesting keeps you searching more houses for things and not just getting a couple items and then just going for kills there is always something you could use to make surviving easier.i would recommend this game to people who have good PC's and dont tend to rage if their game crashes or because of lag.

review: I bought this during the steam summer sale 2017 (this game wasn't on sale). This was definitely worth the full price. This game is the first game in a long time that has bought me this much joy to video games again. Its tense playing solo but with another friend or group its very enjoyable. This game has so much potential with at least two new maps before the game is out of Early Access and the zombies game mode. Once custom games (private matches) become available to the open public it will be great to play with a few friends in that open world battling out between your group.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been playing this game since EA came out. Was very accepting that this is an early access game and it sure does come with the bugs to prove it. All this aside the game is plagued with issues that are getting ignored the servers and netcode are absolute garbage EU servers are laggy af and the desync is at times unplayable. The way the game is at the minute and at the rate its getting "fixed" it is not going to be in a state for release by quarter 4 of 2017 which is what target they are expecting to meet.Also creator Brendan Green has stated that he would not add micro transactions during early access. Guess what happened? Yep micro transactions during early access. Keys will be $2.50 to open one crate with an RNG chance of getting ONE piece of the new outfits. Now yes this is vanity and doesn't impact gameplay but this is extremely shoddy business practice which I will not support. What else will they lie about in the future? How long until paid DLC? What else can we expect from the people who made TERA though? The creator and Bluehole have gotten too big for their boots and are greedy. Promises are being made promises are completely broken. Brendan Green has also stated that there will be no crates that can be opened with in game currency once the game hits full release. Also the devs are on a power trip with the ban hammer. Some is justifyable of course but people are getting banned for team killing who are goaded into team killing because they were getting shot by their own team who is trolling to purposely get them banned. So much abuse and Bluehole just ban without any sufficient evidence. However all those streamers using no recoil scripts/macros are not getting banned. Speaking of catering to streamers here's a tip Don't kill a streamer because you will be banned for stream sniping regardless of them having zero evidence. Well done Brendan Green well done Bluehole you created a fantastic game with a heap of potential and took a massive diarrhoea crap all over it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: How do I start well I guess I should start by saying I love this game.When I first started playing it I thought it would be another geriatric arena death match type game and to an extent it is. But It has something different about it that makes it so much fun maybe it's the players yelling racial slurs and running up to me telling be to get on the ground. Unfortunately I don't think most of them can hear me over there heads exploding if only they could hear the words I use wich are also UN PC.Over all I would highly recommend this game if you have a friend to play with.

review: Why is there so many downvotes? Just got this game and is really fun. It is very challenging and i've only seen hackers on the Asia servers. My only problem with the game is the loot boxes which you pay in game currency to get. This wouldn't be so bad if you could just use in game currency to buy them no. On top of using the earned in game currency you must also pay 2.50 which is really crappy. There is no other way to make your character look cool other than paying real money? That is just bad game design. But the game itself is really entertaining I stayed up til 2 in the morning playing the game. It is also very satisfying to get the upper hand in battle by sneaking up on someone with a shotgun. Although the armor in the game really doesn't help that much.

review: When this game was released on steam It was something intense and fun. The future content told to us by the Dev's was a shiney set of keys dangled infront of us gamers and we clapped our hands and cheered. How ever as they become more popular.... you could see them going down the ier path of game devs.My 100% biggest issue with this game and its why I no longer play it. Is that they added the gambling boxes on additional clothing content. Hidden behind an obviously rigged system to keep the market high on their Better quality items meanwile you bust your grinding out Points to unlock a box to gain your 50th red Tshirt. I know my opinion doesn't matter this late in the game but I'll tell ya right now. Bluehole can stick it up their hole cause I won't be buying their next release. They went from Hero to Zero in my eyes cause they went down the road of Loot Boxes over providing access to content for all. The Steam Market Place is a disaster and they are only adding to the issue. Now before ya think I'm just complaining on just the loot boxes their dev practices are going down the with each patch as well. Adding features/design changes that are NOT what the community wants.They made a fun game but the path they are taking is something I personally don't want to support.

review: (I KNOW THAT THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME AND THAT THERE IS GOING TO BE A LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THE GAME AS IT DEVELOPS BUT THESE ARE SOME OF THE THINGS THAT I'VE SEEN THAT HAVEN'T BEEN FIXED FOR A LONG WHILE) There are few things that I really want to cover in this review first off the developer's decisions for the game. The developers have added a lot of cools things in the game that are fun and interactive but some of those things have not been full tweaked yet so they can actually work properly for the players such as motorbikes these vehicles have been pretty broken and although they are said to be "fixed" are not completely fixed transitioning onto certain terrain will cause the motorbike to just completely flip over without a hill or a bump which can be devastating and rather frustrating while trying to play the game. Second off there is always a problem with the game after an update once they update their game there is always an unecessary amount of screen tearing and frame drop making the game unplayable and what's the point of buying/playing a game that you can't even run despite having the "System Requirements" for it. Finally they implemented the crate and key interaction in the game which they claimed for it to be necessary before the launch of the game which this may be true that they must test it first they should be more focused on making the game more playable before they worry about adding cosmetics into the game and they should implement it of the test servers first allowing people to have interaction with the crates and keys without having to spend their money on them first before actually trying them out on the real game it just seems rather unecessary for the developers to think that they "need" to do something like this on the actual game rather on their test servers first which is the whole point of the test servers to TEST their additions to the game.May I add I really do like this game and want it to be successful but it's hard not to try to say anything when there are just so many unecessary things being added to the game before it is actually out and released.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is my first dive into the battle royal competative game style. I was always a fan of the simple shooters as in CoD because there was no rush aspect. After countless hours of being ditched by my friends I decided to get the game for myself and see what the fuss was all about. Shocked does not even begin to describe my reaction after jumping out of the plane for the first time. The panic racing around trying to loot for a weapon really got my blood pumping and my hands shaking. While I should probably get that checked out by a doctor it just makes the truth more prominent this was my type of game. I knew from then on I was addicted and I hope you have that same experience if you give this game a shot. Whether you want to go lone wolf or play with some buddies this game is worth it. Unfortunately with other battle royal games coming into the light I can't dissmiss the problems this game currently has. The lack of quality updates really puts a stop to this games progression. I won't sit here and pretend I understand coding or what it takes to fully develop a game but I will sit here and judge it like a player should. Games are made for gamers and when the games are no longer keeping the player in mind failure becomes present. I have tried other battle royals like Fornite and the differences are astounding. Keep this in mind when deciding on purchasing this game. TLDR Pros Fun with friends(also alone)Great gunplay experienceNot a difficult learning curveEasily addictiveCan last for hours of funCONS Lack of proper updatesFPS issuesTakes a beast to run properlyRNG circusPersonally I would not recommend this game to new players because it still doesnt feel like a complete game. I have many hours into this game and I enjoyed it immensely but when change doesn't come we change games. Once the game feels good again I would recommend it 100%.

review: Can't wait to see where this game goes and what they add. You're going to die a lot every round actually. Sometimes at #67 and other times at #7 but that's kind of the point to keep dying and trying. And not matter how frustrating it is to have died this way or that you'll keep playing because there's nothing like quietly looting a small compound and then your team hears a vehicle coming in from the West. You all post up ready for the ambush suspense turned up to 11 as you try to get a visual someone in your squad will see them drive behind and enter a house to the NW 50 meters. The next thirty seconds fly by and a squad mate makes contact from the second floor and just like that the fights on and now you've turned the knob to 14 on the action and you can hardly keep your rifle straight with the adrenaline. The other team pushes and your squad mates are yelling out positions and movements as you wait for the breach. You switch your SCAR to full auto and hope they don't have grenades you see the first hole blown in the door and can barely make out the sound of the flashbang that follows bouncing on the floor over the shotgun blast. Falling back to the kitchen to avoid the flash you hear the door open and the fight is now inside less then 15ft away and this is it this is where you die or you survive. You peak the corner to fire and the most intense fifteen seconds of the game insue as you have an all out firefight in the living room of some two story bungalow between you and the two enemy players trying to push up the stairs. Somehow you make it and you only took a few rounds. You yell out for cover as you cross to the opposing building pumped and out for blood after your stroke of success. A well placed frag through the second story window pushes the last enemy squadmate downstairs where you drop him with a quick burst of fire as he's coming down the stairwell. You've made it you've won and the exhilaration is intoxicating and now it's time to loot. Grabbing a few much needed things off the dead player you go to move back to your squads postion only to hear screams of "CONTACT REAR SE 140 DEGREES TOP OF THE HILL!" and your dropped out in the open by a headshot from a Kar98 from a player you never had a chance to see. And you do it again and again because there's nothing like that moment in the bottom of that bungolow testing yourself against other players and surviving the fight.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: tldr Don't buy this game if you care about your mental health.First of all the idea of this game is great and it has potential it gives you an big adrenaline rush and becomes very addictive but the amount of flaws t and cheaters is just too much to handle. I bought this game in September and since then it has developed very strongly it had some problems but it was still in "early access" and I did not pay much attention to the flaws but now it have been three months since the premiere and the number of bugs does not dissapear but even increases. With every update they fix 1 2 things and break another 5 developers give us a lot of statistics abount the banned cheaters but yet me and my friends are dying every second game because of someone with no recoil or autoaim. Sudden framerate losses T vehicle physics constant problems with servers lags and HUGE AMOUNT OF CHEATERS is too much for a "complete" game that we have to pay full price for. I also feel like 9 out of 10 games I can't find a weapon and yet the enemy in building next door comes out fully equipped and kills me with an m14 or scar but I'm trying not to look for a conspiracy theory here but it really feels like sometimes this game just tries to with you. I think that developers prefer to focus on stupid crates or useless emote system instead of fixing the issues I have mentioned and these are not all the problems this game has. This game is frustrating VERY FRUSTRATING and I do not recommend this to anyone this product is unfinished and the greedy producers don't deserve our hard earned money.

review: If you don't know what this game is well it is a multiplayer survival game where you have to loot buildings to get weapons supplies clothes etc. The goal of the game is to be the last person and/or team standing. Now onto the review the game itself is extremely fun to play with friends and I recommend it to anyone that has a small group of people to play with however the game is still very good when playing solo. If you enjoy H1Z1 King of the Kill then I believe you will definitely enjoy PUBG. The games themselves are based on the same idea and the goals for the games are the same. I personally believe that PUBG is better and is more fun to play though. The game struggles with performance for me and many others. PUBG causes low frames and it has crashed for me a few times since I started playing it. I have also seen a situation where my friend jumped out of the starter plane and no buildings loaded for him and he was just constantly walking into a tree because nothing was rendered in. However problems are expected because this game is still in Early Access. Overall I definitely recommend this game to anyone that enjoys high intensity survival games. I believe that this game was a good buy overall and I've had a lot of fun playing with friends. I can give this game a solid 8.5/10.

More on that topic the game is not optimized right yet. For example some times when i land on the ground the buildings are still "Blob" form and i cant get into the rooms to LOOT LOOT LOOT!I can't wait for 1st person hardcore mode.

review: All these reviews about micro transactions are . I understand where they're coming from but what they don't seem to get is that this case is in the game so that it can fund a PUBG tournament. It is literaly here to promote a professional level for a game that is in EA for 's sake. This game is so incredibly fun to play. With friends you can have so much fun screwing around or even treating it like ARMA. However unlike H1Z1 I actually love to play solo in PUBG. The thrill of winning your first dinner is amazing and its just as fun the more you play. Obviously it has bugs because its in EA (hopefully for like another few months) and yeah it has cosmetics you can buy but you can also get them all for free buy wining and getting kills and getting points to buy crates. I'm glad it has the market it allows the game to have a fun trading economy and supports the devs. This game is soooo worth the $30 and when it's out of EA it'll be as valuable as any AAA (even though it'll stay $30). I hope everyone gets to try it and while it may be hard to run now all that is in the process and everyone of the monthly updates helps that along with pushing new guns fighting systems maps and more. If you don't buy it whatever if you do though enjoy your first Chicken Dinner because it's an awesome feeling.

review: The game is as extremely fun as it is agrivating. The initial zone decrease in size is too extreme. by the time you find some decent gear and start heading towards the target your usually caught in the death zone because it moves 30 to 40 percent faster then you can possibly run. If you ARE LUCKY and land your self in a good area near the target you are set find gear and wait. I notice some players seem invulnerable can hit them point blank in he face and they still kill you first and walk away..total bull..I would love this game if it were the same design without the shrinking zones and have the ability to create a combat guild/company of mercenaries etc. Take control of an area defend it and have a respawn system where you start in the plane and drop as usual except there is no time limit a persistent world maybe even add some pve rouge ai.The pay to open a cosmetic crate is absolutely nutz.

review: It had so much promise. Updates were happening at a great pace content was beeing added and the sky was the limit for Bluehole. Then came the bad parts and they are real bad Guns themselves are good but the gunplay is a complete lottery Hitreg is horrendous desync frequently happens superbullets are more frequent than non superbullets. No ping lock means that 50% of the server is currently running around with 250+ ping which leads to one getting shot through walls behind cover etc. It's impossible to lead a shot correctly as you have no clue if the guy you're aiming at has 50 ping or 400. Language barrier You can't queue for duos or squads alone due to queuing with massive amounts of non english speakers. Bugs lag rubberbanding bugs bugs bugs bugs bugs bugs EVERYWHERE. Cheaters everywhere. Not trying to hide it. Bluehole patches it cheaters still there.Untill they decide to match players with similar ping and start beefing up their serverpark this game is a complete lottery. It will leave you infuriated and empty but you'll keep coming back in hopes that this match will be your match.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game. In reality the creative lead at one point did say they wouldn't do this prior to full release but it's not like he said he'd pinky promise and in all honesty it probably wasn't ever his call anyway. review: So when I first got this game a few months ago it was grate I didn't see any cheater that I knew of and was happy to play it. Yeah that lasted about a week... Now there are so many asians playing on the NA servers that I refuse to play with any randoms. Every time we would go into a lobby with a random player they are asian don't speak any english and scream constantly in their language with either a TV or 10 other asians in the background screaming. That and every cheater that I have come across and I mean every cheater that I have seen in game been killed by or hell just watching the kill feed for the first five minuets and watching them kill 20 people in the beginning of the match are all asians. Now they apperantly added a "new" Anticheat. Yeah it's changed nothing. They banned 1.5 Million people in December according to what Battleeye has said but the game is so full of cheaters that after a certain point in the day it's unplayable. When they can sit inside of a house and just one shot everyone around them while facing the floor or wall it's just stupid. PubgCorp/Bluehole will not do a damn thing about this they may tote some "New Anticheat" every once and a while but that won't do crap. I didn't believe in the whole "Region Lock China" thing until about two weeks ago when every third or fourth game there was an asain (probably chinese) just knowing where everyone was no matter what auto aim locking onto targets having no recoil shooting through buildings/floors/hills and killing people in one shot reguardless of what equipment that person had. Reporting people does nothing you might report them and in about four weeks they might take a look at it with the ammount of reports going out. They won't do a single thing about the whole Asians playing on North Amercian or Oceana or even EU servers because if they did then they would lose money from their Chinese friends. This is just becoming a money grubbing game for the devs and PlayerUnkown himself. As long as the millions of chinses players are giving them money they could care less about what happens. It's just rediculous. They ban them then the banned person buys another copy and goes right back to cheating thus giving money to bluehole/pubgcorp. It will never change.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Got back into gaming through my son and this game last summer. Actually started to get some kills and started to feel like I could play the game. Then the hacking got ridiculous over the last few months. Seriously this is crazy. I don't know what needs to happen to correct this but this game is quickly becoming a serious waste of time. I've been shot through walls shot while driving at high speed shot by an UMP9 while wearing level three armor every situation I died immediately. Do the dev's even care what's happening??? It could be the best game going it really is a lot of fun but with this plague of problems it's just a waste of time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is fun 1st person only is great but when playing the normal 3rd person adn 1st person mode suck a** tbh. Way to often the 3rd person cam glitches out and 3rd person is unplayable. So your stuck in 1st person the whole game and then when the 3rd person peek behind cover is needed you cant use it and you get destroyed by people using the 3rd person peek. Its a preety good game and is pretty optimised unlike what other people say it is i have a i5 6500 with a gtx 1060 3gb and 16 gigs of ram and it runs smoothly 60 fps with some very low settings a few high and ultra settings and motion blur witch makes it not look like a potato but still have the same advantage with people with all settings on very low.

review: Graphics 8.5/10 Looks good on Ultra but it takes probably 6+GB of VRAM and a GOOD GPU to run on Ultra. Performance/Optimization 7/10 Not that bad honestly Ive played games much worse optimized like Neverwinter for example. I can run Medium at 60 FPS with a GTX 1060 3GB and 8GB RAM.Connectivity/Lag 9/10 I hear alot of complaints about this game being buggy and laggy as hell. Havent seen anything like that on PC yet. Xbox version is horrendous though. Ive CTD once in 35 hours of gameplay.Gameplay 9/10 Enjoyable wish custom games were expanded upon. I personally wouldnt play this solo most of the time as it is just so much more fun with friends.TL DR Decent graphics less than average optimization infrequent lag or ctd extremely enjoyable with friends less so solo.

And yes I'm talking about the these chinese Every game I swear to God is ended by one of these mother ers. And it has only gotten worse and worse. And you know what Blue Hole has done? Nothing they ban them then they buy the game again and cheat again. Just make so that they can only play in Asia or in a China only server. Maybe if they didn't worry about loot crates and more about the damn hackers maybe this would not have been a problem. review: **UPDATE AFTER 7 MONTHS**As good as this game is I cannot play it any longer nor would I recommend it to anyone else soley because of the insane amount of cheating going on. The last couple of weeks I played it ( early mid Jan) it seems every other match had people cheating. The worst part is becasue it happens so often it makes me question every death. Did they have ESP or Wallhacks? They seemed to know exactly where I was even though I hadn't moved or had a chance to be spotted by anyone. It has literally created such a bad taste in my mouth that it wasn't worth playing anymore. I moved to Fortnite where in a whole month of playing I haven't run into a single player that I suspected was cheating. Hopefully one day the cheating will be fixed I understand you can never stop it all but harsher punishments and ping lock seems to be the only answer at the moment. PUBG corp take what Fortnite has done with their anti cheat and apply it I know you both use Battleye but something you guys are doing isn't working. This is a review coming from a guy who hasnn't won a chicken dinner in over 30 hours of playtime. This game is great the circle that keeps closing in on you and forcing everyone to the "middle" makes this action packed at some point during the game and It supports all different styles of play. I recommend this to anyone looking for a good time solo or with friends.

review: To start off yes I would reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys FPS's. But there are some things you need to going into it.1st. This game is extremely choppy I have a GTX 1060 with an i7 6900k and on medium it stays at 70 but every 5 seconds it dips down into high teens low 20s. 2nd. It is an early access game but the developers update it about every month.3rd. It is a very skill heavy game it isnt like any other FPS in the fact that you can work your off for 15 minutes collecting the best and most perfect loot and get killed by some dude on a hill with a sniper. You will want to take your monitor and smash it over your knee it's terribly rage inducing. 4th. I would reccomend getting a squad. It really does help. Playing solo lowers your odds of winning by a substantial margin and who doesn't want to win?5th. It is early access no game is perfect and this one certainly isn't.Have fun getting chicken dinners.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Huge overview of the game is below.The best early access game I have ever bought. I enjoy the constant patches and additions of new content even though it is quite a solid game in concept and realization. There is no P2W. Some comestic items are traded among players these do not affect gameplay in any way.Game is 65% luck and 35% skill. Very fun to play in a group of friends whether casually or more seriously always a few laughs to go around with more serious players delighting in the precise murders and the casual ones laughing at funny situations given by the game or by choices made.Players (Typically around 100) are parachuted onto a 8KMx8KM island. A pickup of guns and supplies ensues with more thrill seeking players going to large (and more loot filled) areas and players who enjoy getting their feet under them drop for secluded areas to begin gearing up. In the populous areas the vast majority of the game's killing is begun with those surviving having superior loot and supplies while the secluded have a guaranteed pass into mid/late game. The risk taking players will often have the advantage through use of scopes (4x 8x) being typical while secluded players may not find scopes to the same degree. Then said players will have to stay in a reducing circle. This circles doesn't reduce in the center of itself instead chosing a point inside of itself to become the new center point if the boundary of the new circle does not exceed the boundary of the old circle (there is no currently known formula for this.) With a reducing circle players are ever increasing brought into combat with eachother. While early in the game players may choose to watch others walk by without elminating them it becomes increasingly redundant to waste opportunities to kill other players when those said players will be those whom you come into contact with later. The last few circles in the game plays a large factor in the winner of the game with those who are in the next circle will have a large advantage in maintaining their cover and are able to pickoff those who have to advance from their place of safety. The last surviving in the game is the winner of a chicken dinner.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Sorry but i don't understand all the hype about this game(and yes! i know the game is in an early stage and it will get better optimize ''later on'') if you're into camping and not doing nothing or running for a long time after you got your loot just to get randomly killed from who knows where then this is your game!!! The island is too big and it feels like there's only 10 cars in the game(it's dumb to die outside the blue ring because the next zone is all the way accross the island! with that size of a map and the game mechanics of keeping you on the move it doesn't make sense the low amount of transportation) This game doesn't even feel close to being competitive at all yes you land unarmed like the rest of the players but it's all about luck whom ever gets a good gun first wins btw if the sole purpose of the game is to kill eachother why isn't there a larger amount of weaponry all over the place!!!!! Personally i don't recomend this game but neither i dislike it maybe i'll just wait a year or two to see this game runing as intended. Save yourself the money and buy some other game.

review: You know when in early access I liked this game. It was a fun game to play with friends and mess around with them. But now after the official launch this game has gone to utter trash. Not only is there now microtransactions which make me feel taunted by the crates telling me "yo you're so poor and we here at PUBG Corp want all of your money even though you supported us in Early Access". Not only that but it is bugged to hell. Sometimes I hear myself getting into the plane dropping in the AFK Zone and dying to an AFK griefer all while my game is still loading. Not only that but it is subject to crashing. In tense moments or even just looting sessions my game will crash and I'll have to reopen it where I'm either already dead or the game tells me it is unable to let me back in despite giving me the option to do so. I don't blame it all of PlayerUnknown himself. I blame it on his ego and the yes men over at PUBG Corp agreeing with all of the man's statements knowing full well it puts off the community.Some of my blights transcend bugs and go into the game itself. Shotguns spawn more than blades of grass the fun weapons like the AUG or Groza are locked behind the crate drops which are infested with people and mid game is either running around or getting shot by a sniper that only saw a pixel of your head.Overall if you want to get this game take caution. If you have friends who own the game as well play with them. This game is at its peak when you are with your friends. If not stay far back.

review: PUBG is a fantastic game and it's a ton of fun whether you have people or not to play with. I'd recommend playing squads with a friend if you get the chance because the laughs will definitely ensue. The wide variety of vehicles guns and playstyles really appeal to a majority of players. And nothing is more satisfying than getting a Sniper Rifle with an 8x scope and shooting someone in the head 300 meters away.PROS Lots of variety in vehicles and weaponsActive playerbaseCombat feels relatively smoothHuge updates every month and minor updates bi weekly.Character customization with lootcrates that you can purchase which award you different clothes.CONS Doesn't handle well on lower end computersMemory leak makes it so you have to restart the game every 3 4 rounds you play.Overall the game is in a great stage right now for a early access game with the full release being released scheduled at latest by October. The developers have been super helpful and interactive with the community and they've already teased the release of a new map which is going to be desert theme. PUBG is definitely around to stay and if your computer can handle it I highly advise it.

review: After hesitating really hard on getting this game I finally caved. Not at all disappointed!PROS Great gunsDecent firing mechanicsGreat places to hide semi realistic camo systemHuge array of guns you can findHuge array of places to goLots of people to kill....or be killed by.It's really really haunting to be out in the middle of a field hearing gunshots everywhere but seeing nobody. Eerie as !CONS A tad laggy here and there. I defintitely dont see the lag a lot of people complain about but it's there. My rig is pretty beefy and it does jitter on occasion but it's playable on Ultra for sure.Cars feel really really fake. But that's OK. The driving mechanics are floatier than GTA IIIJumping mechanics are essentially useless. You jump like Luigi and then randomly cant get over walls if you're not running at them dead on.Lag spikes Not network (in my experience so far) but graphically. I have a 1070 FTW edition card kinda weird that such a game would cause graphical stuttering...Graphically related to the above the game is pretty ugly. Lots of fuzzy edges lots of low quality textures weird character movements etc. Which isn't bad just cos the game doesn't look like the most amazing thing since real life doesn't take away from the game at all. What DOES take away from the game is that the graphics are as bad as they are and the game lags. At the quality of the game with a 1070 or even 1060 for that matter you should be able to rock out at 120FPS all day on Ultra. But that's totally alright with me since it's still VERY playable.Personal notes I havent actually seen any "hackers" that people keep refering to. I understand there was a huge issue with that recently but after playing a dozen or so rounds I have yet to see any hackers at all. Im not sure if it's simply that people are salty and as a result SAY it's hackers or if it's that I've just been lucky. Either way I havent had a bad experience yet even if I suck at this game.Network lag spikes have only occured on one match so far and I only barely noticed it. One input command was a tad laggy then I was fine from there. Obviously the creator of this game likely did not expect it to be as popular as it has been so natually it's going to take time to scale out the servers to the degree the demand requires. So I wont mark them there at all.All and all considering this is Early Access (although as I understand it they're already making an Xbox port? Wat!?) and considering it's quality so far Im pretty blown away. I didn't honestly think such a simple formula could be so damn fun. But it is and I think I'll be playing this for a long time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is a real fun time and addicting! Definitely recommend.Edit I now have nearly 400 hours in this game so I thought I would update my review. I still recommend it (any game I can play for this many hours is obviously a game that I enjoy) but it definitely has it's fair share of issues. The game is still very poorly optimized runs inconsistently it's buggy and rampant with cheaters (playing FPP helps greatly in that area at least). I'm not sure these are things that will ever be fixed with a newbie company like Bluehole. That said I still get great enjoyment and satisfaction out of this game on a regular basis. I think it really says something that so many people are willing to put up with the extensive con list it's extremely satisfying when you win a tough battle or win that chicken dinner. So if you somehow haven't purchased this game yet proceed with caution. But it's my personal opinion that it's worth it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game and yet not everyone is happy. Rule #1 (how I get through my day).... Every person you make happy you will upset 5 others. In today's world you will never fully satisfy each person. So instead of my moaning and groaning about microtransactions optimization etc. I'm going to give my opinion on what I think on this game. #1. The damage aspect with shooting a person needs repaired. I don't see much difference between lvl 1 and lvl 3 gear. #2. Driving vehicles. Also dislike how hitting the smallest bump makes you instantly roll. #3. More RAIN )#4. A bug where items that spawn in are unreachable (items spawning under items and you can't pick up.I have more problems with this game but it's mostly what everyone has already said. (well other than the fact that you broke a promise......) ( lol. I know that over time this game (as well as others) will be fixed once the issues are tracked and researched. I would buy this game 10 times over if I had to without a single hesitation. It's adrenline pumping fun in my books. One of the only games that I play where I get shot from a unknown location and it makes me jump. This game will get there one day and even if it pisses off people you'll have a player base that will stick with you throughout the entire process (Rust for example). Keep up the good work.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Very good game netcode is a little rough though. I don't like the concept of micro transactions. Whatever happened to releasing full games for retail? Companies now days are all about the "cash grab" I mean who isn't about the money we all our but once all these companies seen how good releasing alpha games are and keeping them in that current state for years they come up with another scheme by doing micro transactions. Look blue hole you have made millions of dollars by releasing your game in early access we funded you the money for gamescom. How about you do us a favor and hold up to your promise and release micro transactions when the game is in its final state. You can fund the esport event with OUR money that you have profited from. On another subject joined squad match today everyone placed markers where to drop at. I was the only one to drop there. Killed 3 guys got downed teammate revived me said "hey hey look look here" I said look at what. He shot me and killed me. Went to report him on battlegrounds web site only to find out I needed video evidence before they can do anything. How about work on that instead of micro transactions.

review: Pros Skydiving so you can chose where you want to go RNG weapons and gear spawns you can find any spawn anywhere Restritching player area to force the game to move forward Tons of guns most feeling unique and different from each other Great map with a wide aray of bioms and scenery Fast quene time almost never have to wait for a game even streamers with high MMR usually do not have to wait long Game looks and feels good graphicallyCons Game is quite render intensive making lower geared computers or slower internet speed have issues(I personally have 0 issues but some of my friends do) Server are still new this is early access so sometimes they can lag up some days better than others overall they are stable now as I am writing this RNG is a great thing as well as a bad thing sometimes just learn to deal sometimes you and an enemy drop next to one another and you find a pistol and he has a Assault riffle. On the flip side this has happened and I killed the guy with my pistol. This game is awesome it combines a ton of different elements making a fun interesting game. There is a huge RNG element which makes games feel different each time u play(good and bad). It is a shooter(3rd person atm but they are working on releasing 1st person only very soon) so experienced fps players will feel that same rush and have some game sense that will help succeed. anything you buy in game is cosmestic only some are getting upset by this but its cosmetic it literally does not matter if you do not want the items then do not buy them. I give this game 5/5 stars love the game

It has surprised me with it's level of polish and accessibility that this genre (that I'm not a fan of) always lacks. I generally don't trust the developers of these kinds of games but the PUBG team has shown a surprising amount of dedication so far. The optimization patches have clearly done their job as the game runs flawlessly on my PC. If they can maintain support this is shaping to to be an amazing game.

review: Sadly I cannot recommend this game in its current state. Whilst the game itself is good it suffers from some issues including bad performance on high end systems (I'm only getting 45 FPS on low settings with an AMD Ryzen 7 1700 and Nvidia GTX 980) and buggy netcode. Until these issues have been fixed I don't recommend buying it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So....to start with PUBG at its core is a good game. The concept is great and fun and I've had a good amount of fun on it. The combat is tense and breaks away from the normal fps formula you'd find in CoD and other fps games on the market. However the problems I have with the games come from the fact that its still buggy as hell. Yes its early access but in the months I've played this I still run into bugs that haven't been touched (swimming under the map and such) the devs rather focus on making money on microtransactions and getting into the esports scene rather than finish a unfinished product first. The optimization is poor. I run this on a pretty budget build but its not a toaster rig. 8gb ddr3 RAM FX 8300 8 core processor and a 1060 6g nvidia card well exceeds its minimum requirements....yet I still get problems with loading into the map and the infamous texture bug that's only gotten worse as the game has updated. Character customization is a joke when you get your clothing in lootboxes....and whats worse is its one piece of clothing per box at a time. Trust me I have no doubt you'll see the typical microtransaction practice for Bluehole to partake in the glorified digital gambling BS that's dominated the industry. Another problem I have is the fact that the game doesn't really promote team play. You'll get less points for playing in a squad than playing solo. Even if you do worst in solo you'll get more points that way. So yeah in its current state I cannot recommend this game. Pros Fun gameplay and good conceptnailbiting tense gunfightsCons Crap business practicesPoorly optimizedDoesn't reward playing with friendsBugs that haven't been addressed in months
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While the game was very enjoyable at the start the hackers have taken over. Played 6 games back to back only to be killed by hackers. I would reccommend avoiding this game until the issue is fixed. Before this issue I would have rated PUBG very highly. Borderline unplayable
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you have an interest in the battle royale genre or games along the line of DayZ PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is definitely the best iteration of it. It's a relatively simple gameplay loop that's very enjoyable and replayable. You queue in to Solo Duo or Squad matches where your team size is capped at 1 2 and 4 people respectively. 100 people max per match but if there are unfilled teams or people dropping out the number will be slightly less. You can queue by yourself into Duo or Squad if you want to be alone vs teams or if you want to join another team that is short players.The dev team has frequent detailed communication and I've been pretty happy with how they've handled things. Patches and updates are regular and come with appropriately informative patch notes. Large additions to the game have been announced (vaulting/climbing new maps first person only servers) and will add a lot more variety to the game.The only thing I don't like is the zero tolerance team killing rule that punishes players in situations where it isn't justified but in all honesty it's not a huge issue.The current controversy in PUBG is the cosmetic microtransaction model showing up temporarily in EA. Normally I'd have a problem with it but this is a test run that is supposed to only last for the tournament period. Yes they said they weren't going to have paid microtransactions in EA but there also weren't going to be any tournaments during EA so I can wholly understand bringing in paid microtransactions as a test run and to fund the tournament.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have always hated this type of games (Battle Royal) but this game has completely changed my mind.This game is an amazing intense and hilarious experience when playing with friends.Even when playing solo I have had a lot of funny and awesome experiences. I love the generous amount of items you can find all throughout the map. It takes little time to get into the game's physics and workings.Ofcourse there are and will be bugs (especially when spectating teammates). But then again at the time of posting this poorly written and constructed review the game is still in it's Early Access stage. I just hope it doesn't end up like DayZ and H1Z1 (which I doubt).Do not jump out of moving vehicles! Makes sense.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Altough it had some flaws and technical issues at the beginning this game is pure fun (especially with a mate or in a squad). Solo is interesting as well but PUBG offers its full potential in Duo/Squad Mode with friends connected via voice chat. Can be frustrating sometimes if lag or desync is messing with you but overall very good value for an Early Access title. Hope the devs will continue the great support and I'm already looking forward to the vault system and new maps!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you enjoy losing this is the game for you. Seriously. Go play it. And lose. And then lose some more. Take a break. When you're ready to lose once again this game will still be here for you waiting patiently like an abusive alcoholic uncle with a leather belt and a bad temper. I recommend this game for sick demented people who enjoy frustration.Ok. If you want more of a description than that here goes. PUBG is a tedious game of long bits of searching looting and running to an ever decreasingly sized play area. Luck is a huge factor as it will determine where the play area moves to and what kind of loot you find while searching. Once in a while you'll encounter other players. This is where the game becomes fun and frustrating. Fun in the since that it's exciting. Unpredictable. A rush. Frustrating because you'll probably not survive all of the encounters and get yourself a chicken dinner. Later rinse repeat.That's the entire game. I know it's early access but I still think that even with more maps this is all the game will basicly ever be. I rate this game a solid 715 bowls of puke out of 1156 bowls of puke. I personally don't like it all that much but the game runs fine and does what it sets out to do. It doesn't deserve a thumbs down. It doesn't realy deserve a thumbs up either. What it really deserves is a big fat raised middle finger. But since that option isn't available I'll give it a thumbs up. Due to the fact that the game isn't broken it's easy to find a match and it can be exciting at times.But mostly you're just gonna get mad. Don't say I didn't warn you.

review: This game is awesome. If you haven't played a Battle Royal game yet imagine skydiving into a giant island and then playing the Hunger Games with 99 other people as the map slowly gets smaller due to an electric wall that closes in every few minutes. The guns and recoil are a little more realistic than other games in the genre. But the Minimap and Nav tools are way better. You always know exactly where you are and can usually guess if you can get to the safe zone before its too late. There are attachments for guns the med items take time to use but are all instant heals. There are definitely some development issues that need addressing. The FPS is really bad and the graphics are very glitchy. Hopefully this will all be addressed before the game leaves EA. Despite all its faults I LOVE this game.

review: part of me wanted to not think this was worth $30 and that it would be repetitive quickly as there are not really any 'real' rewards other than cosmetics...but I have to say it's pretty fun and addictive. If anything I keep playing just for those rare chances of good loot I actually want to use AND find an oportunity to use and for more chicken dinners (and that one day I might kill StoneMountain64)Pros very fun gameplay huge map even if it's the same one each time (but lots of options with such little time) good variety of loot and nothing ever feels too overpowered for the most part Extremely fun playing squads with friends Matchingmaking queue is like instant for any type of game good graphics and very nice sound quality especially with gunshots near and farCons Still pretty poorly optimized which shows at times (still EA though not holding it against them at the moment) I feel it will eventually lose it's touch with only 1 map and gamemode (however I know there's customs as well as rumors I've heard of a new map soon)Worth $30 even in EA and I've seen some super crappy early access titles things I've 120% regretted buying and usualy they were half this cost.

review: Do you love being frustrated? Does the idea of dying within the first minute of gameplay and then watching idly as your teamates finish out the match for the next half hour sound like an exciting time? Do you hate being able to practice weapon skills except for during actual game play assuming of course that you happen across the weapon you want to use? Does the thought of being killed from someone you never saw from a direction you can't pinpoint draw you in like a moth to a flame? Do you relish the thought of making elephanting noises with every movement even as you crawl at a microscopic pace? Have you ever wished for more obscured vision while driving a vehicle? Do you hate the thought of weapon accuracy and controllable recoil? This might be the game for you.

review: I Abosolutly love this game. Its very fun even if you are getting sniped from across the map its fun to figure out where they are. Getting kills in this game is very satifying. Its fun building up to that win and to know you played better then 100 people. The only problem (which is a very big one unfortunetly) is the optimasation. It is really bad Which being honest is expected in an early acess game. my pc is pretty bad but even then i should not have to play at 720p in order to get 30fps. to play well you have to be able to see your enemy in the giant grass and 720p is not great for that. However a good thing in this game is IMO FPS doesent really hinder you that much. It would obviusly be better to play 60Fps But its not impossible to play at 30FPS Or even 15 (although at that point just upgrade though). But again like I said this is an EARLY ACCESS game. Later on the optimasation will definently get better and the game will be better aswell.TL DR Its a good game but the optimasation is bad since its an early access game.

review: At first I was like "Hey this is 1 000 times better than H1Z1!" And then the lag hackers and crashes hit. Then I was like "Hey this is the same kind of turd as H1Z1 was!" Refund requested. Huzzah. Don't waste your $30.Addendum I stuck with it. I really did. In the last 2 weeks the game has been absolutely unplayable. The rubber banding desync and lag have gotten worse not better. I can't believe how badly this game performs even on an optimized system. Don't buy this. Use your money to get a copy of Battlefield COD or even *shudder* CS GO.Further Addendum So...have things gotten any better? I've won my share of games and gotten top 5s a lot yes. I've gotten better at it but as I've gotten better the game appears to be deteriorating in quality development and coding. At the same time the floodgates of cheaters and hacks have descended upon the NA servers which appears to be a direct result of 1) Paid crates with superrare items people are selling for hundreds of dollars on the Steam marketplace 2) The Tencent debacle of a parternership bringing the game to a wider Chinese auidience who amazingly seem to be the source of about 90% of the cheats. Leave it to greed bad decisions lies from the developers about microtransactions and an extortive model to ruin yet another BR game that had great potential.

review: I really like the idea of PUBG but I really regret playing more than 2 hours of it. I've never really liked the idea of early access due to the possibility of devs becoming lazy and charging full price for an unfinished game that will never be finished. Exactly like this game. One of the top games on steam still hardly runs properly.Also the haste of the game puts me off a little too. Feels more like a running simulator trying to get inside the safe zone constantly. A LOT more work needs to be put into the game especially as one of the top steam games. Once they sort the main issues out an actually make it playable and enjoyable then I will edit the review. In the meantime PUBG won't be getting much playtime from me and at it's current 27 pricetag (ripoff much) I really don't recommend it.UPDATE Game updated tried again and optimisation seems even worse than before. Used to be playable on medium now hardly playable on Low. I really really want to like this game but I really can't. Mass reports of loads of cheaters ripoff for early access terribly optimised and the lazy devs are still making millions off it. They actually done anything with the updates apart from (finally) adding jumping over walls a possibility?

review: With a few hours in the bank with this game I can say that this game deserves 5/10. Nothing really special. Be it FFA Deathmatch or Team Deathmatch. You will typically spend 30 40mins per match if you live long enough. During that time you spend 50 65% of the time looting for stuff 20 25% running around to find a house that isnt inhabited and 10 15% hiding just to lose it in seconds. I give this a thumbs down just because of the money involved. $30.00 is overpriced for this kind of game. You have 3 gamemodes 2 versions each. (Solo SoloFPP Duo DuoFPP Team TeamFPP) Also given that it's only 1 "large" map you dont really have much variety besides the weather and dropzones. On a technical side Desyncs in this game is like cancer no matter how many "optimizations" they do it stays. "Oh a closed door. Should be safe". NOT! Someone just phased through that door you thought would cover your behind and shot you dead while screaming profanity in their foreign language. Network disconnects and server disconnects happen often and more so during times when kids come back from their daycare centers.Back to the money issue i dont know how much it really for a crate to be honest but they started off pretty well when it just cost you NOTHING for a crate. But as human as they come greed sets in and with it comes that itchyness called GREED. Gotta pay to look good i guess?You ask why I have lots of hours with this game? Simple out of necessity not willingness.Here I end my rant/ review. Don't get me wrong I enjoy it only because of the shenanigans my friends and family come up with to make up for the sheer dullness of the game.Enjoy your "$30" game.*EHEM* $10! *EHEM* $10!*EHEM* $10!PS. If you want a similar game with more content and love for it go for Fortnite. At least that game is free

review: Playerunknowns Battlegrounds is a very great game but it has many flaws that are going to be talked about.First lets talk about the game itself.If you know anything about the lore then you'd know its set on the Island of Erangel. The island was abandoned after chemicals were released onto the island forcing everyone to evacuate. You are put on the island along with 99 other people to fight to the death with weapons from pans to LMG's.Pros* Fun and competitive gameplay* A mass of weapons vehicles and clothing to acquire.* Keeps you on edge makes you feel you are never safe.Cons* Poor optimization for any graphics cards (especially AMD)* Many bugs/ glitches* No good custom games and if there are they are password protected.Overall this game is great. I dont expect a perfect game as its in Early Access. If I were to rate it it would be a 8/10

review: This was my first battle royale game. After playing extensively I can conclude that the genre is not my cup of tea. The gameplay works well and performance is improving all the time but when played to win the game is nauseatingly boring. High risk high reward strategies are often more exciting but after the battle is done you'll end up camping where you are for at least 5 minutes if not more while you wait for the zone to close. The low risk more consistent strategy is boring the whole way through as you loot houses and collect a car to follow the zone inward. The game gets its replayability through RNG mechanics. Plane drops change loot spawns in different places and the zone movement is random each time. The aspect in which the game really shines is the tension that builds as the zone narrows and the players alive counter gets closer to 1. This doesn't set in for me personally until the 4th or 5th zone as anything before that is relatively low risk and encounters are seldom in my experience. The RNG while giving the game replayability is also what ruins the game I can accept random spawns and random plane drops but the random zone movement is honestly ridiculous. You can have the best laid and most strategic positioning possible and get boned by a random zone closing to favor your opponents. The RNG factors create a circumstance whereby it increases repeatability but also reduces the skill necessary to win which in my opinion is a big black mark against a game that is looking to become an esport. Outside of that the gunplay is decent and the driving and physics are quite wonky. My recommendation for those who enjoy that tension based game play is to play rainbow six siege because even though I don't particularly enjoy it (and it has its own fair share of issues) it offers a vastly superior experience that doesn't rely on RNG for replayability and generally doesn't diminish player skill. Now let's talk about all the PR backlash that has been going on recently. Bluehole has reneged on a previous statement regarding paid items before the final release. These keys to unlock crates creates even more RNG in this game and artificially inflates the price of items. This also renders the currency in game worthless at the time of this writing. When asked about this Playerunknown simply stated that he liked the CS GO method of selling skins and he wasn't going to listen to the complaints from his community and would choose the money grubbing route of paying for keys. Bluehole also implemented a ban system to deal with those who were squadding in solo queue. This has unfortunately backfired whereby a player was banned for killing a teamkiller that he and his friends were unfortunate enough to queue up with. Similarly another player was banned for stream sniping because a streamer (who has recorded himself stream sniping others by the way) complained and his chat reported the player. Again Bluehole went the greedy route and landed on the streamer's side when stream sniping can easily be avoided by adding stream delay. This is Bluehole attempting to go the route they think will maximize earnings rather than caring about the overall player experience. I wished I had followed my own advice I had given to friends never buy early access even if it looks promising. Looks like it was my turn to get screwed by early access.

review: If you are playing solo it's not bad a bit boring at it's core tho imho. The most of the time you are looting random items in buildings and try to remain undetected by other players and to stay in the safe zone that is decreasing in size the longer the match is running. Or you are camping somewhere and wait for someone to come around that you can shoot down or you are running into another player by coincidence while you are looting. The action is rare as soon you spot someone directly in front of you either you or your opponent is going to be dead in no time. And when you exit the match in any way you have to start all over no matter how you were doing. The only progression you get is your increasing personal experience (no not XP points) and to unlock more skins the more you are playing. So the most time you are either running/driving around are looting items to equip you with good stuff or you are waiting and watching your surroundings for moving targets. If you are only into action and want to do something like being on the move like feeling your heart pumping you will be easy prey sooner or later to someone who is doing the opposite. There is thrill in being precautious and stealthy to avoid a very quick death of course but if that would be everything about this game I'd cleary say it is overrated. But that is only if you are playing alone. You are way more versatile in a group. You can surround buildings try different tactics to outplay people etc. This can be really much fun. So at least thumbs up for the duo or squad playstyle.Technically it could be more optimised the FPS are kinda bad regarding how it looks but after all that's really not bad for an Early Access title. I didn't encounter any heavy or supercrazy bugs yet. Looking forward to more patches and improvements if they can avoid to put always new bugs into the game by accident (as seen in some other games) the game can only become better and better. I really like the vision of the developers here.So to sum it up imho it can be fun if you are playing in a group or are very much into being sneaky in an (almost) instagib shooter however the most of the time you are doing things in this game that I wouldn't call really much fun. And then all of a sudden you could get oneshotted out of nowhere or you are dying because you were just unlucky by being too far away from the safe zone for example. This is gonna happen a lot to you as a beginner you can't really avoid it it's how the game is designed.You become better by being sneaky camping playing carefully playing multiple hours to get experience and of course by being lucky. But you will die the most of the time if you just wanna play this game a bit to enjoy your time and in any case you will die a lot and start all over more or less. If that still sounds like just being your thing you should try it you will probably not regret it many people favor this game. But if you are rather like "uh maybe I gotta think about it" then it's probably a good idea to just stay away really. (You could buy it and try playing it for less than 2 hours though until you cant refund it anymore if this game follows the standard rules of Steam regarding refunds google it maybe to be sure.)I was tempted to buy the game because of the hype and because the people seemed to have much fun playing it at Twitch and Youtube but I can't really understand by all stretch of imagination after almost 10 hours what the longterm fun of it is for me personally. Yes I see that the game can be fun eventually but I am not really into the base gamedesign of it and all the stuff between the fun parts. It kinda bores me there and when it starts to bore you you gonna get oneshotted again because of how careless you play and then you kind of wasted all the time of the last match again and again. Sorry not my thing. If I could I would refund or sell it but Steam got different ToS unfortunately. For the time I was playing it and was motivated to play it 30 bucks are way too much money to spend. So be careful if you are not sure if you really wanna keep the game but are about to leave the refund zone for it. Because there is a huge and empty hole in this game you could fall into like me. And I didn't know or experienced that after only 2 hours not even after 5 hours.

review: I'm pretty critical of most games. PUBG is no exception. I do however really enjoy this game when it's working like you would expect. The lag issues at the beginning of games hackers poor optimization (even on higher end PC's like mine). The devs at times feel like they are simply trying to make the most money possible. After playing the test servers yesterday my hope is somewhat reinvented for this title. I still don't agree with them releasing an Xbox version before the game is even close to being finished but they are still making progress. The little detaisl that will be added in the next update feel really nice. Like the game is more complete. Both visually and mechanic wise. I haven't given up on it yet all we can hope is that PUBG doesn't us.
