review: An honest review without the hate.Fortnite is free so I will NOT compare the two.PuBG on PC is a fun game but to enjoy it you have to accept that it's not perfect (but given how craptastic some triple A titles are these days it's FAR better maintained then 90% of them)It's updates aren't as frequent as they use to be however the tweaks in gameplay don't need to be as major and the additional content they are going to add needs to be tested etc. as well so it's delay in arrival is understandable. I'm a gamer of 20+ years so my paitence will probably out do most people reading this review that's not bragging that's me simply stating that when I enjoy a game I'll comment on things that bother me (I came from Xbox One to PC recently so this game runs 100 times better then I'm use to) and so far I've not found much. Mind you I'm only 10+ hours into playing this game I came in expecting less given the reviews I read and found that (as I said before) it's better then they make it out to seem.I do however reccomend tweaking your GFX settings and the ingame settings to make it run smoother you can google the best or "Optimal" settings and find a bunch of reccomendations.Some things to take into account BEFORE buying Much like most competitive PC games Cheaters will eventually find thier way into a match you're playingIf you can't handle this don't get this game and if you think you can don't complain later. (Even CS GO is plagued with cheaters)Also some players are CHEAP snakes in the grass camping in rooms baiting etc. You'll find all types in this game either learn to adapt or stop playing.Finally unless you can tolerate it mute the ingame voice chat. The little kids LOVE to scream into thier mics there are amateur DJs everywhere and you'll get called everything from racial slurs to other unmentionables so either cowboy up or just mute 'em.However having said all of this if you manage to be one of the few who just love Battle Royal style games (or just PuBG) you'll enjoy (or like me love) this game.

review: The recent flood of negative reviews has caught my attention and I would like to have my say in this matter of Cheaters Mechanics/Graphics and The Game as a whole.STOP COMPLAINING ABOUT CHEATERS. If you are going to play an online game especially a FPS there are going to be cheaters. The developers are doing their best to reduce the number of cheaters. It's virtually impossible to weed out all the cheaters unless everyone would like to install a program that constantly scans your computer for files potentially breaching your 'privacy'.Hopefully the upcoming Kill Cam will help identify cheaters and the numbers will reduce drastically. But until then just stop complaining. You cannot define the quality of a game when you're a mad 12 year old kid who thinks everyone is a hacker because you're simply GET A BETTER COMPUTER. The game runs perfectly fine. You have a potato. There are some things the deveopers are yet to touch up on but the game runs perfectly well. If you're Frames/Sec are low try lowering your settings. If they're at the lowest setting and you can't run the game. Then it's your crappy computer not the lack of optimisation. Internet connection also can play a significant role in the performance of your game. Check yourself before you blame the game.THIS GAME IS NOT DEAD.Don't listen to half of the negative reviews here. They're all salty people who cannot play the game or try to run it on a computer that takes AAA batteries. The game is LOADS of fun and the developers are very commited to improving the game. Adding new guns fixing mechanics such as damage environmental factors and even the sounds in game. The game is far from going 'downhill' and if it does I'll be genuinely surprised. It's getting so much love from Twitch Streamers and YouTubers. My point to this review is to say it's a great game and you shouldn't let the negative reviews stray you away from enjoying a game that gives you a rush like no other.

review: Updating my review in light of recent developments 1. The game surpassed some of the fastest growing as well as largest player base game in history of steam games.2. It got funded 100 times over anyones expectations both from in game purchases and micro transactions (which got added during early access)3. Everyone expected the game devs to be responsible and hoped they wont 'scam' the community to make some money.Well 1. They did absolutely nothing even marginally good with the amount of funding they got. 2. The game is still in early access with almost every game breaking bug still there (server lag fps drop even on decent rigs due to exceptionally poor game optimization texture bugs sound bugs hacking)3. Where did the dev time truely go? Devs put most of their effort towards adding the micro transaction system in a early access game (first signs of a scam) and to top it off kept adding more and more content into the micro transations instead of actually working on optimizing the game.4. Canceled the ETA on the upcoming patch which was supposed to actually push the game out of early access. Instead the game is going to remain in early access (probably for ever). Cheap shot from devs as they want to make money out of the player base while dodging responsiblility of actually delivering a working product. Lastly fan base still going "Oh its early access they have done so much already". No they haven't. With the current sales they have been able to attain with 13 Million copies sold and microtranctional cash flow the current valuation of Bluehole is standing at 4.5 Billion USD.. Do you guys know what that means? This is not a indie game we are talking about. Its a legit company that has swallowed up 390million USD in last 6 months and has delivered garbage in return. P.S. We got scammed. Deal with it.

review: This game is a huge step up from H1Z1. This game is more clean offering much better and sharper graphics and style. The controls and mechanics of the game are simplistic and can be learned in a matter of 10 minutes of playing. The only flaw I have with this game at the current moment is the optimization. The optimization is horrendous and even if you have decent computer parts (e.g. 8gb RAM with i7 intel core) you will lag a lot in this game. This game seems to take up a LOT of your memory and CPU so just be aware of that. However other than that I would recommend this game.

review: So after nearly 500 hours here's my take. Yes there is bugs. Yes sometimes the vehicles are weird. And yes there are hackers on it. Mostly asians servers though. Most people rage and write reviews about hackers and such bc they got killed from someone actually being better than them. (suprising i know. better than you?!) I've seen maybe 10 total hackers. mostly aimbots. 2 speedhacks. but thats out of hundreds of games. The game is fun. really fun. It's even better with friends. You can be all serious or see where a crossbow can take your squad. Oh and the game is early access and kinda blew up over night so yeah they kinda have a lot of stuff to fix but hey they have and are working on it. Most people than tons of game sales means instant fixes. but it doesnt. anyone familiar with IT project works knows that. late dev work can have hiccups and set things back or other mechs may need immediate attn so then they get pulled there. or not enough help bc of the instant success. 100% the game is worth the price tag. 100% isnt perfect yet. Microtrans are just for looks. stop ing. If you die 9/10 times its bc you got screwed on rng/circle boned/caught with your pants down. So learn to enjoy the game for what it is. Fun and imperfect. kinda like life.

review: after a long time i finally buyed an early access game again after being disappointed by some others. well i should have stayed away from it. I don't trust a single word from the devs anymore. Games like Astroneer show clearly that Early Access _can_! work. But not this one.issues # servers# feels clunky not responsive at all# problems to jump over pebbles/fences/mini boxes# crashing vehicles on alpha pebbles/walls randomly# a spray of blood from the enemy indicates a hit for you but server said "no"# broken promise (microtransaction)# it feels like it's getting worse after patches instead of better# ah and i forgot the afk Battlepointfarming and cheating cause of client side processingaccording to twitter devs need months to make improvements for the game but want to release the game at the end of the year well i cannot take them serious at allupdate according to the official website servers are fixed. Developers seem to suffer from loss of realityMy opinion sheer greed for money i would refund it if i could. If _anyone_!!! who know what they do would make a similar game i would buy it.next update 10 30 2017 #they screwed up the controls in 3rd person

review: PUBG is incredibly fun that much needs to be said. It's a lot more fun playing with friends but soloq or PUGing is also great. The matchmaking is amazing from the time you die and restart it's less than a minute before you're teamed up and already in the next match.BUTThe game runs like absolute garbage. The game looks WORSE than garbage. You could show this game to someone in 2006 and they would be surprised at how bad the game looks. Granted graphics aren't everything. This is even more unforgivable because I don't know if there is a PC in existance that can run this game at 60 fps at max settings. Not that you would want to run it at max graphics anyway. The optimization is TERRIBLE. Sure it's "early access" but Bluehole have made millions off this game and there have not been preformace improvements. I give PUBG a big up for pioneering in a sense the 100 person battle royale style game but sincerely hope a better game manages to be as purely fun as PUBG is but looks modern and is properly optimized.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have not played any battle royal games before PUBG since I didn't think it would interest me that much. But the publicity PUBG got brought it to my attention because the focus of the game is your personal experience. Every game is unique. No matter your playstyle you will find enjoyment playing. You can be stealthy or go berserker and fight everyone you see. What matters is that you can do what you want. What I hope is that when the game leaves early access it will be optimized cause you need a moster pc rig to enjoy it to the fullest now. Other than that this is probably the game of the year considering the value for money it offers since you will be playing it for years!

review: Firstly "PlayerUnknown's" requires a space between the words. It bugs me beyond belief. Other than that 10/10 a toxic free eviroment fun for the whole family. If you like Dance Dance Revolution and Wii Sports then this is the game for you! Battlegrounds leaves the player moist beyond comprehension even after just one game you will be leaking like a tap! 'PUBG' encaptulates all positive features of every video game ever created... all the way from the release of Pong (1972) to present day. The game's story mode and lore represents the current state of society and shows us an accurate assumption of where mankind will be once Donald Trump and the Korean dude blow each other up (so in about 2 months). Who wouldn't want to be thrown onto a random island forced to kill one another? It sounds like my Nana's Bar Mitzvah.

Do like I do when I get outplayed laugh and make friends with the enemies about how dumb this game is. 10/10 everyone should play this game.

review: EDIT They added Microtransactions.TLDR Great game with highly competitive and enjoyable gameplay. Does suffer from some server lag every now and again and some optimzation isssues but all in all it's a fantastic game. 8.5/10This game is an insane amount of fun. It's the first Battle Royale game I've purchased as the others always seem sketchy with their poor reviews lack of content and pay to win mechanics but after around 20 hours I can't recommend this game enough. The loot system is awesome the gunplay is intense and the force field keeps even the longest matches to around 30 minutes. It does have some lag and optimzation issues but with my rig I get 60 fps in most areas. It does drop to around 35 40 in super dense areas but I can live with that for now.From what I've heard from the Alpha and Beta players the devs have been amazingly supportive and will continue to add content as the game's lifespan progresses. I'd love to see more weapons and attachments more customization options and more weather effects. I think we have a winner here boys and girls.PROS Large Player Base insures fast matchmaking times Highly competitive and high skill gap gameplay/combat Decent variety of weapons attachments and vehicles (need more weapons in the future!) Cosmetic items are earned for just playing the game no in game cash shop Allows for a squad of up to 4 players and incentivizes you to play with friends Streamlined healing no bleeding out Fluid game and gunplay Acceptable match lengthsCONS Mildly poor optimization Occasional server lag (US) Pointless melee weapons Poor character customization
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a great game and it will get better further on in the years (im assuming). Although it is still in Early Access it really gets your heart beating whenever a enemy is near. I recommend it to anyone that has the specs to play this game and you should get it while its cheap ($29.99 USD).If you dont play with friends you might find it boring after a while but pretty much everyone is playing it right now so it might not be a problem.This game still needs alot of improving and updates to make it better and more compatible for lower spec computers But I think it will be really fun for anyone that plays it.

review: Review(05/08/17) Guide for English KoreanI am really enjoying this game since it feels like fast paced Arma 3 Game.Although I havent played Arma 3 alot i found this game easy since the mechanic is similar to Arma3.Totally fun worth the money.Though I hate to say that the free costume will be disappeared after the Early Access.Other than that I'm really enjoying it. How to configure your game settings(게임 설정하는 법) RAM(메모리) You need atleast 16GB of RAM in order for you to enjoy the game without stuttering.최소 16GB가 있어야 원활하게 진행가능ScreenMode(창모드) set to FULLSCREEN for more FPSScreen Scale(화면스케일) (GPU Dependent/그래픽카드 의존)90 100 (본인 사양에 맞게 조절하시면 됩니다. 100은 본인 화면이 1920x1080이면 게임도 1920x1080입니다. 90이면 1920x1080 의 화면을 90%로 낮춘 화면으로 보여 조금이라도 프레임 나오는데 도움이 됩니다.쉽게 말하면 해상도 줄이는 효과랑 비슷합니다.Set this to 90 100 but this depends much on your computer spec. If you have enough power to maintain frames with your current monitor resolution then set to 100 if not reduce this setting to gain FPS. If you reduce this settings it has same effect as lowering your resolution so this purely depends on your system.Anti Aliasing(안티 앨리어싱) // (GPU Dependent/그래픽카드 의존)Very Low(매우 낮음) Disables Anti Aliasing // 안티 앨리어싱 비활성화LOW(낮음) FXAA // FXAA 설정 활성화Medium(미디움) Ultra(울트라) TAA //TAA 활성화This doesnt really affect your FPS when comparing very low to Ultra. There is only about 2 3 Frame rate differences.이 설정은 프레임에 많은 영향을 주지는 않습니다. 매우 낮음과 울트라의 프레임 차이는 대략 2 3 차이가 납니다.Post Processing(포스트 프로세싱) (High GPU Dependent/ 높은 그래픽카드 의존)Very Low(매우 낮음) All options are disabled // 모든 옵션 비활성화Low(낮음) Medium(미디움) Enables Ambient Occlusion. //엠비언트 오쿨루젼 활성High(높음) Ultra(울트라) Enables Chromatic Aberration. // 크로마틱 아브레이션 활성화This setting affects your FPS when there are many items on the ground and it affects your FPS from 10 20 when comparing Very low to Ultra. So if you have low med GPUs I suggest you to set this setting to Very Low or Low(depending on your GPUs).이 설정은 아이템이 많은 구간에서 프레임이 매우낮음과 울트라와 프레임 차이가 10 20 정도 차이가 날수 있습니다.그래픽카드가 안좋으신분들은 그래픽카드에 따라매우 낮음에서 낮음으로 설정해주시면 됩니다.Shadows(그림자) (High CPU/GPU Dependent / 높은 CPU/그래픽카드 의존)This setting affects your FPS alot. When comparing Very low to Ultra you will have 18 20FPS differences.Especially when comparing High to Ultra you will have 10FPS differences.IF YOU DONT HAVE HIGH END CPU/GPU i recommend lowering this option to Low or Very Low.이 설정은 프레임에 많은 영향을 줍니다. 매우 낮음과 울트라를 비교해보면 18 20프레임 정도 차이가 납니다.특히 높음과 울트라를 비교했을떄 차이점은 10프레임 정도 차이가 납니다.높은 사양의 컴퓨터를 가지고 있지 않는 분들은 낮음이나 매우 낮음으로 설정하는걸 권장드립니다.Very Low(매우 낮음) Low(낮음) Most of the shadows are disabledMedium(미디움) Shadows on grass tree etc becomes darkerHigh(높음) Ultra(울트라) Enhances shadows quality.Texture(텍스쳐) (GPU Dependent/그래픽카드 의존)For this option you will have to check your VRAM(GPU Video RAM) to set this option.Very Low(매우 낮음) 1GB of VRAM or Lower.Low(낮음) 1GB 2GB of VRAM(Does not include 1GB/ 1GB 포함 x)Medium(미디움) 2GB 3GB of VRAM(Does not include 2GB/ 2GB 포함 x)High(높음) 4GB of VRAMUltra(울트라) 6GB or more of VRAMEffect(효과) (GPU Dependent/그래픽카드 의존)This option details the effect from AirStrike in RedZone Flash from Gun firing etc. IF you have lag when this effect happens i recommend lowering this option. * This option needs you to restart the game in order to apply the setting.이 옵션은 레드존에 포격이나 총을 발사했을때 보이는 빛 등과 같은 효과를 보여주는 설정입니다. 만약 랙이 있으실 경우 이 설정을 낮추는걸 권장드립니다.* 이 설정을 적용시키려면 재시작 해야하니 주의 바랍니다.Foliage(식생) (CPU/GPU Dependent)After the balance patch this does not reduce the grasses or trees but it reduces the vision to see the grass and trees by distance. This setting also does not affect your FPS much. The diffrence between Very low to Ultra is about 2 3FPS.밸런스 패치 이후 이 설정은 잔디나 나무를 없애지 않습니다. 다만 거리에 따라 보이는 나무와 잔디를 제한합니다.이 설정은 프레임에 많은 영향을 미치지 않으며 매우 낮음과 울트라의 차이는 2 3프레임 정도 차이가 납니다.View Distance(거리 보기) (CPU/GPU Dependent)Same as Foliage but this setting reduces the building you can see from your point of view by distance. FPS may vary due to different number of buildings in different cities. This setting also does not affect your FPS much. The diffrence between Very low to Ultra is about 2 3FPS.식생과 같지만 이 설정은 현재 보는 시점에서 거리에 따라 보이는 건물수의 차이점입니다.이 설정은 프레임에 많은 영향을 미치지 않으며 매우 낮음과 울트라의 차이는 2 3프레임 정도 차이가 납니다.MotionBlur(모션 블러) This setting blurs your vision like real person when rotating quickly but this setting really depends on your preferences. So Ill leave this setting up to you guys.이 설정은 현실 사람처럼 확 움직일떄 흐리하게 보이는건데 이 설정은 본인 취향에 따라 다르므로 사용해보시고 설정하시면 됩니다.

review: PLAYER UNKNOWN'S BATTLE GROUND REVIEWWHY IT IS SO DAMM GOODi quite like the fact that its not limited what you are able to do with this game for youtube and twitch sake you are able to double dip beacuse this game wants you to see and share the over all experince its not one of those games that does it for the money beacuse PUBG is really caring about the players if you have a problom just submit it and the operators of the game will fix it also ive only had one problom with this game and that is when you tab out of the game and then go in again your mice is unsyncronized so you have to press a inch below the thing you wanna click but all in all its really good experience it got that battle royale and H1Z1 system but in ultra realistic quality i really look forward to the full game i pre viewed all the goodies thats about to be added in the closest future and i could only recommend this a 100 percent... but i would like to see smaller maps for newbs so we have a little play grounds for children *ish* beacuse i also came in late and really just got 1 kill after alot of hours but then i learned to get more and my record is 4 ive gotten that 5 times now and its pretty fun..... i could recommend it to eny1 and ive recommended it to some people already.....
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is really good gameplay is glorious and you'll love it.Then why am I giving it a negative review?Because the game itself is a freaking mess. Tons of gamebreaking bugs on a constant basis awful optimization poor fps models won't load you might get stuck on loading screens memory leaks are common and this game is supposed to be released next month.At some point the game glitched and all buildings became transparent for some reason I could see through freaking walls.Vehicles flip at the slightest bump riding a motocycle can be suicidal and not just becaue of that because it's also glitched and you can die even on fully flat terrain.Getting stuck in terrain? more times than I can count. Getting stuck with the parachute also several times. Getting stuck on doors? check. Memory leaks are common models won't load after the last patch optimization is awful most people have to play on very low specs even with high end computers just because of the massive fps drops. Oh and getting stuck on a loading screen while your character is in game? also check yeah you can get killed before you even load the game.The water is bulletproof. Aiming is clucky as for some reason they use the same button for the scopes and for aiming instead of different ones which screwed me at close quaters more times than I can count. Jumping over obstacles is a nightmare luckily they're working on that particular point.Trying to aim from behind cover is almost impossible because the game struggles to identify stuff as cover and your screen will shake like crazy.Looting without using the inventory menu is plain awful sometimes you have to press "use" the button several times to pick a single item.Cheating is commonplace basically because the report feature was non existant until a few days ago and cheaters are not even subtle getting killed by 3 headshots from a submachine fired at full auto from 600m away not subtle.Oh and of course microtransactions are now in game which they promised there won't be until release. Gambling microtransactions the worst kind there is buy a grate and then buy a key to the crate to get a random item.

review: The idea is simple be the king of the hill the last survivor. I enjoy the tension of the chase in this game. I find it is a game of hurry up and wait to be killed. Collect equipment load weapons move toward non constricting area wait. Loot more and repeat. 50 60% of the time I never see the person that has killed my character until they loot my remains. When I seem have to have the advantage on another player and start the shooting I loose the gunfight about 75% of the time. I enjoy working on a teams that do not kill/grief their team members. I have now been made aware that the company has aggressively started banning known game cheats (6000 per day). The mechanics of the game limit each play through to about 20 minutes. by that time a handful of survivors are sardined together to shoot it out. My Teamates have made it here a few times without me.

review: With a reasonable amount of play time I can safely say that PUBG it not completely worth the buy as of now. Overall the game suffers from quite clunky mechanics if not just constant lag. And despite being optimized the game still has troubles consistently pushing steady frame rates but if you can live through most of the above you ll still get mad at the game as it feels more like slot machine than a game at times. With 100 players in a lobby all on 1 map it's easy to die because every house you loot could have only pistols and attachments meanwhile someone can instantly loot 1 house at the start of the match and be set for the game (Loot distribution is very poor). looted or not the game heavily encourages camping houses and shooting at those who are moving in the open to avoid the zone or gunfire for easy kills this can easily wipe your friend or squad out instantly because if you have a teammate you only go down and don't die instantly meaning campers get a large advantage because they just res their friend in the house if you down them and if you push they ll be waiting with a insta kill shotgun meanwhile they gun down your downed teammates. When you do get into a firefight when both sides have the same amount of cover the game is much more fun as who handles their gun better wins (Till they decide to throw grenades at you). It's not a terrible game it just seems like an everyday early access game with a unique concept. Buy it on a sale if you need to play it.

review: I have changed my review. The bottom contains my old review for the Early Access build of this game if you're interested.I can no longer recommend this game. The developer is borderline criminal in their development of this game. They have made an absurd amount of money from PUBG in a record amount of time and have supposedly pushed this title out of Early Access and into a full release. From where I sit the only changes from then until now have been a new map some new guns and the much needed vaulting system (which should have been included much earlier and is still a buggy mess). This game is *not* a full release. It is at best a Beta. It runs like absolute crap everyone that know that plays it does so on the lowest possible settings just to maintain their 60fps even on very good hardware. No matter what the devs have said there have been zero improvements to optimization at least in any noteworthy capacity.It's a fun game and despite the Call of Duty community shouting constant racial slurs into the public chat it's still a lot of fun to play but I just cannot recommend a game that's going to keep feeding money to a company that seems to be doing little to nothing to actually improve the parts of the game that need it instead of trickling out new guns to keep people happy with a little injection of "progress". Let me first lead with the obvious this game is in Early Access. It's a bit buggy it runs like crap and it has limited features. But you knew that walking in right? ...Right?Either way this game is a blast. Despite FPS drops and the occasional bug or crash or wonkiness you're going to get with any alpha/beta the game is just fun. Sadly that's osmething I've been lacking in games lately. I picked this up because I needed a break from the garbage MMO scene that's currently happening and I'm so glad I did.I think the most important thing I want to mention is how tight the shooting mechanics are. Unlike similar titles ilke DayZ or H1Z1 (or even Rust) the shooting feels... competitive? I don't know how else to describe it. If you're a fan of shooters in any respect you'll feel at home with the shooting in this game I'm quite sure.The biggest complaint I have so far is with the default control scheme and some of the lack of control options. I'm sure this will change with updates so I'm not upset and I'm working past it. For example though you can focus your aim (tightening the reticle) by holding right click. If you want to use your iron sights / scope / red dot however it's a right click to toggle and there is no option to change that as of yet. I'm sure they'll update it and it's hardly enough to dissuade me from playing and I'm gettnig used to it. And honestly if that's my biggest complaint I'm happy.Anyway for the level of polish this game launched with compared to some of the others it's well worth the $30 price tag.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hell of a game but many hackers.8/10. 10/10 when there are no hackersEdit 6 out of 10 rounds you play you will be headshotted by a hacker. 1 hit kills even when you have a lvl 3 helmet are common.You will be killed by a punch even when the enemy is inside a house (lagg switchers)You will be killed through wallsYou will be killed by hackers who are coming from far with a car and run straight upstairs in a big building to the room you are hiding and 1 hit kill you with a pistol???I changed my recommendation to NO because of all the hackers. 30 euroes to get owned by hackers is a little expensive.Do not buy this game till the developers can handle all the hackersEdit #2Since the new update there is an invasion of Asian cheaters. 90% of the rounds you play you will be by 1 hit kills by Asians or you get shot through walls/hills or what ever the .There is no reason to buy this game anymore.

review: The crash dumps and logs provide no info on what issue occured that caused the error. Also if you die too soon in a match you're stuck reconnecting until a certain amount of times passes. That's fine and all... I understand it is to battle bots... maybe give us a captcha?? The long wait after a fresh death is extremely irritating. Or this is a bug?Get disconnected? If you take more than a minute fixing issues you will be told that you can attempt to reconnect... that is not the case. After you attempt you will ultimately fail over and over again. It's an odd bug... if PUBG isnt in focus it will load you in and you can see everything as if you were under the map a bit... upon clicking back into the game it will say "CONNECTION FAILED". If you stay in the game while reconnecting it will just automatically say it failed without EVEN PINGING THE GAME HOST. Also why when someone gets downed in a car are they suddenly crawling outside of the car? I understand you can drive away and heal them... that's their perk for being in a car! Make them bleed out faster if you need to balance it.Why when I need to hop in my vehicle and I hit F on the driver side do I jump to passenger? I've been shot to hell.. I've been killed by blue zone with seconds sparing I've confused teammates all because I cant run to the side of the vehicle and enter it without magically jumping to the other side. Im solo... my teammates are all dead. Do you really think I want to sit in the bucket of a motorcycle while Im in the blue zone and being shot at? I cant mash CTRL 1 fast enough and take off!Another note... why are all the guns set to single fire when you pick them up? I know for a fact that by defualt most fully autos are set to fully auto when the manufacturer releases them. Furthermore you're telling me everyone who died or dropped their fully autos in whatever way across the map ONLY ever used single? Mix it up or set it to fully auto. I hate hitting B EVERY TIME I pick up a gun. I will turn it to single if Im at a distance sniping someone or they dont see me at medium range and I try and draw their team towards mine. There is no reason to every pick up a gun on the fly and have it in single shot off the bat.Could I add anything more negative??? You guys are seriously releasing on xbox this month? Why the do I blue screen over unhandled exceptions constantly after the new patch? You're trying to somehow update my whereabouts before I have even moved and it is causing my goddamn memory to blitz and blue screen me. Stop that! Throw some fricken exceptions in there PLEAZE.!! I cant even play the game anymore because every two seconds I drop out. And why did you have an AI control my player? Or was that just full retard lag?? How did my partner watch me drive through two towns hop out of my vehicle and run towards the idiots shooting at me while I was rebooting my stupid computer that blue screened on an unhandled memory exception because you guys have no clue how to maintain frame by frame data!?!?!!?&amp &amp &amp $&amp $*(%$(*$*(Absolute nonsense! Garbage game gone viral.Fix all this so I can give an UPDATE response and go from nay to yay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I saw a video of this game and it made me want to buy it I came on and even though I couldnt find a single good review I still bought it. The came works fine for me... until I see another player then the lag kicks in my screen pretty much freezes for a couple of seconds while I try to shoot then next thing I know im dead I can literally tell when a player is about to turn the corner on me because of the ridiculous lag I get when near any other players. The game is unplayable like this I have tried on different connection and I know its not my computer as I run way more demanding games with ultra settings online and offline and never have any issues.Until this fixed there is no point in playing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game itself and the concept is nice but the game is extremely poorly optimized. The first person gamemode/cameramode is virtually unplayable due to clunky sluggish and non responsive controls. The game suffers from laughable network lag at times which in turn makes gunfights feel very rng (and doors stupidly hard to open and close). The whole game just feels "off". Hard to pinpoint exactly what it is but the camera and player controls just feel weird and unnatural and the network lag can also screw up the entire experience. Problems aside the game can be a ton of fun when playing with friends but from a technical/gameplay standpoint it's just way too bad for me to actually recommend this game. I have an i7 6700 with a GTX 1080 (+11% performance overclock) and even on the lowest settings possible the game is at times an absolute lagfest. All in all i have clocked in a ton of hours with this game and i've had alot of fun but at it's current pricetag (and with the technical issues) i just can't summon the adequate strength to recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Here is what we know about PUBG PlayerUnknown is a the producer and has had his hands in the developing stages of a couple other games like it (H1Z1). I think the reality of it is that BlueHole gave him an opportunity to really make PUBG his baby and he came out in spades. Think about this 4 million+ sold and its an early access game. PROS Vast open world. Survival at its rawest form. Plenty of weapons Plenty of various armor / weapon mods. Graphics are clean NOT PAY TO WIN Simple game play mechanics (Simple to play / Hard to master) CONS (Its tough to do this because its EARLY ACCESS / ALL THESE COULD BE ADDRESSED. Server stability The fluidity of the game is smooth although still some frame issues / network issues Game needs to have more stats across the board Weapon stats for each gun and kills Obviously Kill Cam Top 10 Top 5 Top 25 finishes. Allow more map options / be able to pin up more things or for you to save map edits on your account for the future. Bring in more vanity items (I know this will come anyways) Destructible terrain/buildings. Distance Draw / You can hide in the bushes on the opposite hill of someone else but he can see you because the way the distance in this game works you'll see him standing out like a sore thumb even though he is in a bush prone on his screen. Overall as I've said already a lot of the cons can be resolved just through more time in early access with lots of them probably already addressed or being slated for a future update or release update etc if you guys are hungry for a TPS/FPS true survival of the fittest game PUBG is without question the best of the best you have AAA developers that could only dream of making something this successful and BlueHole did it with a fraction of these big guys budgets. Developers watch and learn from PUBG. MUST HAVE!!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have fun playing this which usually is my indicator for a good game. Playing it with friends online is hilarious. There are however a few caveats You need a good computer in order to play this game at a decent frame rate. Graphics card CPU memory all need to be WAY above the minimum system specs. Loot distribution is very randomized which can be frustrating as hell. You will usually lose your game and unless you have good squad mates or are a fairly decent FPS player yourself your chances of winning are slim. The possibility of giving your character an individual design is directly linked to your ingame success as cosmetic items are earned via a random loot system tied to how "good'" you play the game. The game has a learning curve and is fairly unwelcoming to new players. That being said the game sits at a sweet spot of tactical thinking action skill and fun but still is in desperate need of some serious optimization efforts and ironing out glitches and kinks before getting out of early access. **1.0 release update** I'm sorry but the glaring technical issues especially regarding desync are unworthy of a full release.

review: Amazing game. After 3 days of having this game I had played PUBG for over 29 hours and did not slow down for several weeks. That being said this game does have its problems and I've had my fair share of complete t moments where I get angry at it forgetting that this game is still Early Access. Most often times they are extremely minor bugs such as hitting a tiny bump with your car and either going completely ballistic and flipping over your car or you might lose a little bit of health. But even though there are many bugs many of them are completely harmless and can even make you laugh at points. This game is extremely extremely fun and rewarding if you are able to get that Chicken Dinner. The first few times that I was able to win I was completely pumped with adrenaline and eager to try and win another. The pre game lobbies are some of the craziest places in the entire world at times going from 50 60 people crawling in a line to 30 people screaming into their mics at the same time. This is something that can either be extremely funny or extremely annoying. Near perfect score 9.9/10

review: I don't have hardly any time in this game.....YET. I heard all the hype and watched a few youtube videos and said what the heck let's give it a shot. I haven't played ANY battle royal games up to this point so I must be honest and say I don't really have anything to compare it to but OH the hype. First match I didn't do too bad (#55) the second (#40) the third with a few kills (#23) and MAN was I excited. I literally am going to have to pace myself with this as I can see how PUBG will get addicting as ALL HELL. I'm still tweaking my graphics settings and I haven't had ANY issues in that regard up to this point. I'm just gradually upping the intensity to be sure I'm not hurting the experience by pushing it too much. Overall controls are great. I even experimented with my controller and it works well except for making changes to weapons/attachments/etc. A little getting used to and I think I'll prefer the controller/keyboard combo. This game is the top seller for a reason. Intense fun and addictive gameplay. I could do without idiots playing music and other noise on the mic but that's easily muted. Definitely looking forward to getting a duo/squad together to play this. And with the possibility of cross platform...whoa nelly. My only complaint is the lack of a kill cam. Dying from a sniper hit isn't what sucks (although it DOES suck) I think it'd be more gratifying if you could congratulate your killer and learn more from little mistakes you might make.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I like PUBG. I really do. But sometimes it's just go in and be killed. Not because of lack of skill but because of in game lags that make the play unfair. It's surely better than it was in Early Access vehicles don't fly away (they still collide with pixels though) and there's no more rain on the maps i like it. But I would not call this a full game and that's why it still should be in EA. Of course the game is all about luck but after some time you can notice that there's more stuff in School than in Po i or Yasnaya Polyana. You could've wait with the 1.0 update as despite the fact that many things changed better there is still a huge amount of things that need to be fixed. 4/10Oh and add achievments.Theu're just cool.

review: Product received for free. I love this game. The fact that everyone starts the game with absolutly nothing and equal in every way is very refreashing to me. I am a player who is not the best at shooters and I am generally outmatched by most other players. With this game I can hold my own and make it pretty far either by myself or with a teammate. It has everything you need to survive if you are lucky enough to find it. It also has vehichles you can use if you stay in one spot to long looting. the player area shrinks at a good pace and lets you know when it is about to shrink. I have not found anything that I do not like about this game so far. I really enjoy this game and I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys pvp shooters.

review: So far NOT worth the price tag. Veeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeerrry poorly optimised. Most of the time doesnt load until its too late to jump out to land in a good spot. fun when it works 2 out every of five tries but awful when it doesnt. Also had to deal with random heavy lag spikes and unloaded textures. combat is all around clunky and loot distribution can be utter at times. To be completley fair I have yet to really pour time into the game but the short experience I've had so far has been... unpromising to say the least. All in all I would recommend if you have a beefy computer but if you dont wait until they patch it and make it better optimized. Also prepare to be frusturated. Alot.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I saw this game when it first came out and had absolutely no interest in picking it up. I've watched people playing H1Z1 and other similar games and they seemed alright just not my cup of tea but I could certainly appreciate them for what they are.After a bit a good friend was expressing interest in it and we decided to go in on it together since it's a pretty fair price. I had super low expectations given that it's early access and I had watched some streams by this point so I had some idea of what I was getting into but figured it'd be a fleeting thing.But I couldn't have been more wrong.After the first game I was entirely hooked the first game where I tried to swim across the river to get to my friend as the wall closed in around us and he found a lucky boat that we sped off in and ultimately got gunned down mad max style by some other boats.Since that fateful game our little group of friends has so many stories even after just 34 hours of playing together. An insane amount of memories and shenanigans are being built up in an incredibly short amount of time and we're constantly having a blast.The game absolutely has its problems of course and there are a plethora of things I hope they'll address in the future (WTB memory leak fixes) but it's a genuine joy to play. Matchmaking is lightning fast and we don't really care if we're popped out super early because we can very quickly get right back into the action without a hitch.I didn't think I'd like this game and it turns out I absolutely love it. Several friends went into it thinking similarly that they'd find it to be a poor purchase but we've all been proven very wrong. This game is a great buy. Do a little research find the launcher optimizations and give it a spin. 10x more fun with friends IMO. Keep in mind if you really hate the game you can ask for a refund if you have under 3 (might be 2?) hours played so you can always go that route.10/10 purchase would buy again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is 'fun' overall but the bugs make this game unplayable straight out. A game like this in this stage I don't expect to be fully functional and polished but I expect it to be functional at the very least. This game has loading problems so bad I can't even play 25% of the time. The loading screen freezes and sometimes never unfreezes and when it does unfreeze it has you mid game already and you're at a disadvantage. And even then it's not fully loaded most of the time. I drop down and the houses haven't loaded properly and I can't go inside to get started or even hide. I simply have to wait a while for it to load. And when the game is started and i've started and everything seems ok there's glitches that outright stop me in my tracks from playing. I've straight up ran in buildings and been stuck in the wall because the colliding it bugged. Cars too. It's just not something i'd say go buy for quite some time. On top of that i'm stuck with it.

review: After reading several reviews I purchased this game on a whim and wanted to see what it was for myself. It's really addicting fun and fast paced. You'll never get bored with the pace of the game or the firefights you get in to. I've seen a lot of negatives for various things like the lag issue with this I've only experienced it a couple of times and it didn't last more than a second or two. I've also seen the reviews that comment on the cheating element but so far I haven't encountered any of that might be due to the 20k+ bans handed down or people need to play better or get better rigs pick whichever makes you feel better. Also seen comments like damage indicators not sure if they meant better health bar or directional marking of who is shooting at you if it's the latter get a better gaming headset turn up the volume and you should be able to figure out the direction of where the shots are coming from. If you really need the indicator to register hits for you why don't you ask for one that gives the direction for footsteps as well sheesh. So far it's a great and fun game and as long as the Devs keep pushing forward this game can go far.Also if you play for the first time and come across a frying pan PICK IT UP!! You don't have to use it but it does provide extra protection for your butt. It's saved me many times as I run through the map and snipers take shots at me and all you hear is the "ping" sound as the bullet hits the pan and the "spark" visual from the hit. Frying pan Lifesaver!Cons An in game timer so I know when too take a break sometimes I forget dinner or I'm late too work because I keep hitting the "play" button Pros Frying pan butt armor (gotta protect the O ring!)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have to say i am really enjoying this game and the constant updates and fixes the devs are releasing is insane!Now i have to say if your expecting to be buying a perfect working game. Your not. But its in Early access as of right now and as i said earlier the devs are constantly releasing patches making the game more and more playable. The game is fun solo and with a few friends its even more fun. However.THIS GAME IS INSANELY DEMANDING SO DO NOT PURCHASE IF YOUR PC IS NOT AMAZING.But if your PC is good then get ready for the best last man standing game available today!I hope to see you on the battleground! FranTic

review: Early access has become a joke the past few years this game however redeems my faith of not only Early Access but also in developers!Battle Royale is a genre that every Tom and Harry has jumped into development with however these ex H1Z1 developers have used their experience and nailed the game even so early in development! After only a few months they have their game in the top 5 played games on Steam which is more than deserved. It feeds you enough adrenaline to keep you going and even when you die makes you want to jump right back into that plane and do whole thing over and over and over again! Pros Great gun gameplay Perfectly executed version of battle royale Perfect game to play alone or with up to 3 friendsCons Weird vehicle physics Latency problems Strongly reccomend for the full retail price ( 26.99)95/100
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is the best early access game i think i have ever played. The game is still very young but it already shines over competitors like H1Z1. It plays mostly as a stealth/tactical shooter but you can also drop in a populated area and fight from the very start. It has the perfect mix between arcade and survival. Despite a lot of faults still present(vehicle physics inconsistent loot sub optimal performance at parts like pregame lobby) this game has done great progress in the short time it has been out on early access with weekly and monthly patches and is in my opinion nearly good enough for a full release. It is the kind of shooter i would definitely recommend even to people who usually don't enjoy the genre. The game is full of funny tense and high adrenaline moments. It is fun enough as a solo but the game really shines when you play with friends.Overall if the game were to go away tomorrow i think i've already gotten my money's worth and it seems this is just the beggining for this very promising game.

review: Very fun game. Great multiplayer. Haven't had this much fun in a while.Graphics 8/10 Very pretty but unless you have a mammoth computer the great textures come at the cost of lag which can get you killed. Even the low res textures are pretty goodAudio 9/10 Foley is very good. Guns sound as you would expect them to. Able to hear distant gunshots cars driving up people opening doors in the house you're in. Very good very atmospheric.Gameplay 9/10 Very realistic shooter. Easy to learn difficult to master. One big map with many varied locations to choose from collect gear to kill other players and be the last one standing. You have very little health (2 or 3 Assault Rifle bullets will do it) and have to travel to the center of a circle that gets continually smaller without getting picked off by the other players trying to do the same thing. Play with friends you won't regret your purchase. Full price or on sale definitely worth it.

review: 9.5/10. Great game really addicting. The only major thing wrong with it right now for me is that it keeps freezing! No it's not that I have a "toaster for a pc" as my computer can play more advanced games better. I look forward to it's release but I find it hard to be motivated to play more when you repeatedly get to top 10 only to have the game freeze on 3 different scenarios. I'd also go on about how the vehicle controls need improvement but it seems that people already made their point with that. Though it would be nice to see more vehicles (both vehicle variations and slightly more vehicle numbers on the map) in the future. Another thing that needs work are the doors. It would be nice if the range for shutting them was a little farther and the doors seem to have a lag error for some people (so do the vehicles) including me. The jumping is also a little wonky but not too bad. Gameplay is fun and entertaining but can get kind of slow at points (not neccessarily boring but not the best part either). In the end though it's a really fun game and I'm sure they'll fix the optimization and freezing and most other problems that get reported.TL DR Amazing game needs minor improvements

review: I would wager that approximately half my deaths are the result of suddenly getting shot and being startled so much that my fingers slide across various keys changing my weapon unequipiing it changing the view and getting down into an unsprintable prone position all simultaneously and not being able to recover my bearings quick enough to undo the damage before being killed.The biggest negative for me is that too many Asian only speaking players flood the NA servers making teamwork impossible as well as counting for approximately 99% of hackers I've encountered. People also really dislike marketable items in game but you get them just by playing the game regularly. I've made back the money I spent on this 1.5x over to date which has essentially granted me this game for free as well as giving me ample spending money for Black Friday sales. In its current state I would recommend it because it's really fun most of the time especially with a good group. However the devs are really bad at fixing issues and updating things and are strongly pushing for an official PC 1.0 release. This game is nowhere near something you should see marketable on Xbox level sales. But you can get your money back by putting the time in so that's nice

review: Now i don't normally write reviews on games but my oh my where do i begin on this game. I can't frankly figure out to criticise this game in a good way or a bad ill start off with the bad. The jump System hit box area and the sucky skill i have as a solo. I must say that this game will be great now for someone like me you will feel rage some rage like no other. I can guarantee that you have never felt any kind of rage when you make a small mistake and you have a SCAR fully decked out with an 8x scope and you miss a shot on a fellow player and someone beside you comes out of no where and murders you. I must say though when you do have that 8x scope and you kill someone from a great distance you will feel like a badass but when you fail man you will have it haunt you for a very long time. Overall i will say that this game has a lot of potiental and i do know the devs are working on fixing a lot in the near future so i must say this game is one for the books.

review: As of right now this game can go 2 ways. It can run perfectly fine or it can completly suck. For example the two major cities in the game lag a lot when you get into them but ill give them some slack since its in EA still. Sometimes when I land from the plane the buildings dont render in and I have to wait a minute or 2 hoping I wont get shot. This glitch only happens sometimes and im sure it will be fixed later on. So as of right now I honetly would recommend this game but be aware of the bugs it still has. It can be loads of fun and it feels so good when you win your first match. Overall as of right now I give it a 6/10 but once most of the glitches are gone I would give it a 10/10.Edit.After some bug fixes the game feels really good now but there are a few bugs like getting stuck in a rock or stupid little things. The game is great now and if your thinking of picking it up then do it for sure.

review: I've been playing the game since April this year and I can say that the game has been updating quite nicely the first few months. But since the July/August update I (and many others from what I've seen on forums) have been experiencing massive FPS drop when dropping out of plane world loading extremely slow (so called "melted buildings").The problem is not in my setup since I had no major issues when I first began playing the game.I played the game for around 300 hours but each time it is more and more frustrating to play because I can't parachute to an area where other people are parachuting. Either I have 1 frame each 2 seconds or I can't enter buildings to pick up weapons to fight. I got bored of low loot zones.They plan to release the game at the end of this year but they still have this game breaking bug since July/August.

review: The game is great i usually don't like these arena or battle royale games but this feels very good.And now it runs in 100 FPS! I did not play it for a few days so the last update was downloaded...after that i had 100 FPS before it was 30 60 Fps.Good work bluehole!Gameplay at all feels kinda like a modern ARMA Game not like a arcade shooter.There is only one map but it is huge even with my over 60 hours i didn't saw all the places of the map.Like today i saw a campsite which i never saw before.You have the choice play SOLO with a friend or with a full squad of 4 people against others the same size.Also there are custom servers for special people with zombie mode and many other stuff but with that custom servers you do NOT get ingame currency.The ingame currency is only for cosmetic items so no need to buy them!The Gamescom crate on the market has really great items (like a skirt for both genders or many other stuff from the battle royale movie!) you could buy but it is very rare.False ban? (Bluehole know if you trying to fool them...)try https //forums.playbattlegrounds.com/topic/35993 process to appeal a ban/

I have opened 2 rewards nows. I have received 1 set of boots. Yes 2 reward chests have netted me 1 set of boots that i already owned anyways. Completely confused on why you would put a currency into the game and a reward chest only to give nothing on the first reward chest and 1 set of boots that come with the game in the second. Kind of dumbfounding.

review: Two issues. I loved it when it came out weird glitches were almost comedic. Lately the hackers make it no fun. The aimbots seem to be most common hell even the 2x world champion DrDisRespect misses on occasion. The other issue is NA servers full of chinese players with lag issues that might as well be a cheat. Shoot where they are get killed from the teleporter. Can't go into voice at all just one person screaming over the other in Chinese. Developers are atleast making comments about the cheaters but with China becoming the number one market for PUBG I think I will have to keep playing with the odd rubberbanding I see. I hope they are truly going to be more proactive and make it harder for cheaters. I really want to come back and make this a positive review in the future. I come back and play once or twice a week to check on it. Today was par for the course.

review: PUBG has a lot of flaws. It can be buggy some glitches are weird you'll run into a cheater every once in a while etc. Day to day my biggest complaint is other players. Randomly getting teamed up with racist s or for whatever reason getting paired up with a squad of Chinese guys so it's really hard to communicate.The rest of the time? This game is a pure thrill. My first few matches were solo games and I was on edge for a couple hours straight. Then I started joining squad games. The pure heart pounding thrill is less but you're more likely to survive and when the hits the fan it's way more fun.

review: The game is pretty badass. Chinese Overflow into North American Servers makes it difficult to enjoy day time Gaming. Could use a bit more fluidity in Meeting up with random players you enjoy playing with. This Failure often leaves Players not able to reach out to other players post game. Overall it is fun and the large map provides many variations and scenarios that will almost never repeat. Circles do get repetitive but the Late game is still intense if you are crafty to make it that far. Many styles of Gameplay work. RNG can be a bit saddening and Early game is entirely dependant on Location and Population. Sometimes games can last 20 mins or you can Die right off the plane. Overall its a game that pulls you in and then traps you there like a kid in a crate.

review: Game is an all around masterpiece only problems I have had are few and far between what I like about the game. Current bugs that I have faced are textures on buildings loading slowly though it only takes about 30 seconds most times (Prevents looting at the start of the game due to not being able to open doors or see loot) and a few times I have faced the bug in which no buildings have spawned for another player and they have been able to run over anyone they please as long as they are on the ground floor or simply shoot through the buildings. Positives for this game far outweigh the negatives playstyles are adaptable and fun duos and squads are also a really nice aspect that makes the game entirely more enjoyable. All in all game rating is an 8/10

review: Absolutely wonderful game and a ton of fun with friends.Also I don't see the point in harping on the game's recently added paid crate system it's as simple as don't like it? don't pay for it. all the crates allow you to get purely cosmetic items at a faster rate nothing is stopping you from playing the game naturally and getting the crates yourself (excluding the gamescom crate). Sure the backlash would make sense if it were similar to other paid systems in other games that would give players advantages over others but as i've said this is all purely cosmetic and I for one support the decision to add this system into an already amazing game of battle royale goodness.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is a WHOLE LOT OF FUN. Either playing alone or with your friends. However I have to mention Those spec requirements? ADHERE TO THEM. This isn't a game where it's possible to play with slight frame skips. It's an honest to god battle royale as such the more FPS you can get the better. Buildings have a tendency to stay out of existence until about 3 minutes after you land. And even that when they DO spawn a lot have an issue to be low graphics to the point of not being able to enter their doors. And recently (for me at least) the game has a "Network Lag" game pausing glitch. The last match I most likely will ever play had me stuck in it. Let me elaborate on the glitch when the game detects network lag it SHOULD pause everyone in place so the game can keep up. I got paused but no one else did so when someone entered the building I was in I couldn't move so the other player got a free kill.In conclusion the game is in constant development.The game is SO MUCH FUN but there ARE glitches in it and if you don't adhere to the requirements god bless your character's frozen soul.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I haven't played this game for a very long time however I feel as though my small amount of experience gives me exactly what I need to give an opinion on this game.I was very critical of PUBG before I even got it. When I was finally suckered into it by a friend I decided I'd only play 2 hours of it and then refund it. Obviously this wasn't the case. I have plenty to say about this game so I will break it down into topics.Topic 1 The Good StuffI expected this game to be absolute garbage and make me never want to play it again. However the genuine experience and unique playability I found myself facing kept this game in my library but only for a few reasons 1. The intensity and excitement I felt playing this game is one I do not feel often. I feel as though the developers did and excellent job of grabbing ahold of the player and building up tense adrenaline pumping moments.2. Gear is not rare and weak and finding a gun with bullets is not the most difficult thing in the world to do. The option to jump out of the plane whenever you feel and not just be randomly placed. The constant shrinking of the map area keeping everyone in one spot. These gameplay aspects give everyone their fair chance at actually enjoying their experience and being on level ground with everyone else.3. Playing with a friend improves the experience alot.Topic 2 The Bad StuffThese are the reasons why I do not recommend this game 1. It should NOT cost $29.99. That price is far too high for such a limited and underdeveloped game. I have also tracked this price for months on end and never saw it go on sale once. This proves to me that the developers are far too focused on making as much money as possible with as little work as possible.2. It should still be in Early Access. There are far too many bugs graphical issues and kinks to work out that I have a feeling will never be worked out.3. Playing this game alone or with competitive friends will make this way more stressful than it needs to be. You can very quickly become frustrated and waste hours and hours playing angry.4. There are way too few maps and character customization options. This is pretty nitpicky but still something that bugs me.Please only purchase this game if you plan on playing it casually with friends every once in a while. That is the only way I can enjoy it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: hackers make this game almost unplayable but i continue to play because i hate myself

review: I know a lot of people give this game poor reviews and a lot of the time they say that the game is "Horribly optimised" but persnoally (using a GTX 980Ti) that ive never had frame problems. People also say the game is really laggy which for the most part is correct but in the latest patch a lot of those issues (massive d sync at starts of games) have actually gone (for now). You have to remember that this game is in its fairly early days and there are inevitiably going to be problems but for the most part I reccomend it.

review: If you're lucky enough of not having encountered a single enemy for 20 minutes you can can run your off across the map with an intensive case of general paranoia. Then if you haven't found a vehicle yet because everyone else has taken them the blue line will catch up and reduce your hp bar from 100 to 30. You use your bandages but that's not enough. Then you finally make it to the white zone and still haven't seen a single enemy. You finally find a vehicle hop in and drive towards the white zone cause your hp can't take another stroll outside the white zone. And so you drive on and boom you meet your first enemy. You have a full backpack of useful resources but you can't use them cause by the time you start getting shot at you're already dead. Might as well call this ing game a Running Simulator.

review: PUBG. Despite the lag issues that most people are experiencing and controversy of microtransactions. You must look past this because these things happens. They need money to sustain the performance of the game and the work put into this game for the long run. Its only comsmetic for these microtransactions right? What is there to complain because there are games that have this kind of stuff implemented into the game. I do think PUBG should consider getting rid of keys then should switch to points earning system to unlock items and rare drops of items for top players in the round. PUGB is a lot of fun espeacially with friends in a squad or duo. If you like a battle royal type of game then this is for you. It reminds of rust and other survival type games.Definitely recommend this game.

review: Microtransactions.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I really enjoy the game a LOT of un &amp I've met great people! I can play for hours and hours! For this I believe the game deserves a positive review! HOWEVER The downside The devs let me know they think im a chump by adding micro transaction BEFORE the game was out of EA which they promised they wouldn't. Their answer to this was that "They had to test these things before the game was finished" So...you can't let us test these for free and take them away when the game goes live? This CAN be "tested" for free the logic of "We need to sell these to people so that they are ready for people to buy" answer lets me know they think im a chump.The NEXT answer we were given was that "Oh i mean its going to charity and the tournament" Well guess what I think we have already paid enough for you to afford your own tournament and your own charity donations... SO...the bug hit me and I (regrettably) bought keys and opened crates I now have 4 pairs of white school pants for boys (im not a boy tired of boy clothes being the norm) and 3 pairs of white sneakers. THAT ARE NOT SELLABLE OR TRADEABLE!! You cant even sell it for BP's like normal items!!! You're just stuck with 4 pairs of white school pants for boys. Because the Dev's want ot be SURE you feel sick when you give them money. Im starting to feel rage when i think of this game. Im a chump. Why did i buy these keys why did I feed into this!??! I wish I could have kept my positive review rating I have to change it. I just have to. I feel sick when I think about this game now. Will I play it again? Probably the damage is already done they have my money. I just wont recommend buying keys
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have to say i'm very dissapointed in the direction this game is heading. The greed is real and they're milking every dollar they can out of this game. As if they wern't already making a pretty penny. This whole microtransaction in EA is absurd. I've spent around 10 dollars to get the same item 3 times. If you're going to add microtransactions at least sell the whole item set together. You want to add microtransactions? Why don't you add actual game content to build a strong community first then when you release the game add microtransactions. SATISFY YOUR COMMUNITY LISTEN TO YOUR COMMUNITY. DO NOT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE PEOPLE WHO HAVE SUPPORTED YOU THUS FAR.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I didn't have high hopes going into this game and in retrospect I shouldn't have bought it but lesson learned. The hit boxes are absolutely unrealistic there are rampant cheaters who use every glitch possible to take people out. I shot at a guy and in the time it took me to turn around he was behind me and I was dead he some how went COMPLETELY through a building and did it. Asked for a refund and denied due to "excessive time played". It's 9 hours. I'm sorry the 2 hour rule is nonsense you can't even really get a feel for some games in 2 hours. It literally took about 9 hours for me to realize this game is rubbish. Lesson learned. Uninstalled and won't go back. $30 down the drain.

review: Was enjoying this game until today. Was playing pubg with family. All of us got killed. Left the game. Went to start a fresh game with my family and find that our accounts (yes plural) are under investigation for 24hours. Got a chuckle out of us. 4 of us play pubg and magically the 2 of us in the same room get a 24 hour ban at the exact same time. 30 minutes later that 24 hour investigation turned into a full steam ban. We don't cheat our stats are horrible. This has me more dissapointed more then anything. My family was enjoying playing together. Family says if this doesn't get fixed its 4 customers gone not 2.

review: There is some magic here the intensity in the early and end game is unmatched and I couldn't put it down for the first 50 hours. Eventually though things just start to get frustrating. In so many ways this isn't a game of skill the de sync the lag the bugs and the completley random nature in most aspecs of the game makes it impossilbe to prevent so many of your deaths. Over time this just became a frustrating experience semi random deaths followed by at least 10min spent getting into the next game and past the loot phase. Mixed in with these were some amazing rounds but just not enough and at much too high a cost in time.I'll still play with my friends but I've mostly moved on to other titles.

review: I had previously posted a positive review of this game while it was still early access. It is still a fun game to play but 50% of all games I play are ruined by cheaters/hackers.Now that they've implemented deathcam and replays I can go watch how I did each match and what other people were doing. I can put up with hackers if it's a rare occurance like it was before but now it's too frequent and I'm sick of it. The way the game is going it'll die within this year if they can't fix the hacking issues. Bluehole have said they're trying but nothing seems to be working with more and more people not getting detected and been less obvious with their hacks.My 50% statistic above is how often I report people for cheating after viewing the deathcam and I don't normally do it unless I believe it to be true else I will check the replay later from their point of view if I just find them suspicious.There are also network issues with the game. They're taking steps to fix it and slowly it has been happening but it's very slow. We still suffer from some lag at start of matches spikes of lag during games at random time incorrect character positioning leading to players been not where they are and getting killed arounds corners etc.It's good they're adding new maps and balancing gameplay but they need to fix network issues as well as hacking.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Honestly a great game with so much potential the game has come a very long way since the initial beta test. The games a bit rough around the edges but it's in early access so I'll give it a pass. One thing that is a bit disappointing is we were promised there wouldn't be any micro transactions which isn't much of a problem honestly because it isn't effecting my gameplay in any way but it does show that the developer doesn't show very much respect to the community. If you make a promise you keep it simple as that so if a promise is broken why should I or anyone for that matter trust any other promises? So hopefully the micro transactions will be removed and we can ONLY use the bp system. Other than that amazing game keep it up!

review: Before you read this review keep in mind I didn't even want to buy this game.Once I finally gave in I can't stop playing... The intensity of every round and every kill situation just throws you into another world. It's so intimate and exciting. Me and my cousin can just sit and watch each other play it's so entertaining to play and watch. Most of these negative reviews are because of microtransactions... which goes to charity and the winner of the tournament. Not sure why people are being so anal about it.Overall it's an early access game. It needs heavy optimization but I have so much fun playing this game that I can honestly look past most of the downsides to the game (which are few to none).Buy the game. Give it a try it's not for everybody but definitely for most of us.

review: Product received for free. I received this game as a gift. As you could probably guess based on my playtime I enjoy this game overall.Before each match you'll be placed on an island with the other players. There are several weapons nearby on some tables. After a set amount of time all players spawn in a plane passing over the land where the match takes place. Many people choose to drop off in areas with large quantities of equipment. Consequently such places (military base and large cities) are usually a high risk high reward landing location. Landing in these places or somewhere (hopefully) safer is up to you.Each match can be different.A plasma looking wall progressively closes in at set intervals. Make sure to avoid being outside that wall (marked on the map by a blue circle) as much as possible. If you find yourself outside of the wall your character will receive damage over time.Your landing location will determine not only your starting equipment and number of early game confrontations but also how much effort will be needed to stay within the shrinking wall. In your journey to win the match you'll probably loot multiple buildings or fallen players engage in firefights or car chases and plan your next move (you can play solo or with one or three teammates).This game can be played in 1st or 3rd person. Additionally there are servers that restrict players to only playing in 1st person. Many players turn down their graphics settings to make it easier to differentiate players from the environment (affects grassy fields for example). This allows for a competitive edge over players that use high graphics settings.In addition to medical supplies protective equipment gasoline for vehicles and upgrades for guns you have inventory space for 2 large weapons a handgun grenades/molotovs and a melee weapon. Large weapons found typically consist of assault rifles sub machine guns shotguns and sniper rifles. Inventory space can be increased by wearing additional clothing/armor or backpacks. Equipment such as armor and backpacks range in levels of endurance/capacity.Living in North America I've noticed that the North American servers recently have many Asian language speaking only players. This can sometimes make it challenging to coordinate tactics with your teammates but does not always make it impossible.Regardless of server locations I tend to enjoy matches in which I have only one teammate. Typically we come to compromises much more easily. Additionally during a confrontation there is less "noise" in tactics coordination due to the smaller number of teammates.If you're still uncertain about purchasing this game check out some videos on YouTube. I highly recommend this game if you're competitive and/or like fighting alongside a team.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've played for half a month and I love it. I love the idea behind Battle Royale and it works well in the game. The weapon and gear variety and balancing are great. I do wish that updates would come a bit faster since this game is obviously making a ton of money but I think we'll get that soon enough. There are still a ton of bugs (mostly being unable to epuip weapons sometimes and clipping with objects). Aiming a gun in this game is a bit clunky. The First Person aspect needs some fixes. There is also a huge problem with people using aimbots and other ways to cheat in this game! I've already encountered several individuals like this. This deperately needs to be addressed in order to keep the community straight so that people can have fun and enjoy the game. Despite the glaring issues this is not a AAA developer and you cannot expect everything so fast. This game definitely holds up despite all of the issues with it and is a blast to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To you people who are looking to buy this game I'd suggest you keep your money. Now don't get me wrong the game itself the idea of a 100 players battle royale is indeed fun.Coming out to be the sole winner either as a solo or a group the feeling is exhilarating. But it is ruined by cheaters/hackers to a point where it is unplayable. I have 500+ hours in this game and skeptics went from "video of it didn't happen" &amp "maybe you're just bad at the game" to not having a choice but to agree because almost every game is infested with China hackers running around shooting everyone. ESP Aimbot NoRecoil Speed Hack Shooting through walls you name it this game got it.It has come to a point where cheaters are fighting cheaters and the chances of regular players coming out top are very slim.Just save your money the banning of cheaters shows the result in terms of numbers but the % of ban is so miniscule compared to the % of hackers in the game.Do buy if you want to have a firsthand experience of being on the receiving end of the hack tho
