review: I've had very little time with this game but so far I'm in love. I'll list what I love about it and since it is still in early access I'll spout off a few of the obvious things devs could work on.What to like1. Matchmaking is fast and premades are in seperate servers from solo players.2. Vehicles are in short supply making this less of a GTA road rage game and much more about tactical engagements.3. Tactical engagements Every encounter comes with a decision fight or flee wait or rush bait or scare.4. Every room you enter could be a gold mine for gear or a trap.5. The island is huge and as players die off the map squeezes a little tighter on the playable zone but it does it in intervals instead of a constant shrinking. Tis allows baiters campers and snipers time to setup shop so that they can still have a little fun...but not so much that they ruin the game...in the end they will HAVE to move.6. Just a personal fav here you can sprint while crouched while not as fast as running upright it is still faster and I love that they implemented this because it is very grounded in what a real person can do.What needs work.1. Character movemet/collision mechanics honestly there's a collapsed stone wall barely taller than my ankles in front of me and i cant even jump over it much less walk over it.2. Crawling in prone makes more noise than crowch walking...if im trying to be as invisible as possible you would think that this would be the way to go...but it's not.3. Buildings all over the map have a bit more repetition than I like. There are some unique buildings out and about but if anything can be learned from games such as the battlefield franchise repetition gets boring and if anything can be learned from planetside 2 those buildings can be replaced and upgraded in patches so that no fight ever feels the same.4. Zeroing mechanics need some sort of explaination I served in the army irl and I know what it does irl. In this game though I have no idea as there is no reason to "zero" a weapon in this game. If however its allowing you to adjust for wind and elevation then kudos I love them all the more for it.All things considered the things I love outweigh the petty gripes that I'm sure will get hammered out in due time I'm giving this game a big thumbs up and I hope it helps sway people towards it...this is a game that relies on player base and id hate to see it go.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This review was originally negative because of the problem of optimisation. However after the number of unofficial fixes provided by the community and the lack of chrome (8GB ram isnt enough for once good luck Xbone players) the game became playable on high settings. There is still a problem with buildings not loading after landing for a few seconds so I have learnt to avoid dropping with enemies.As far as everything else goes it is a really fun and engaging game. Gunplay is very good when compared to other games in the battle royale genre and the variety of guns means people with different play styles can still thrive. The map is also very good and many tactics can come into play to make the most of it.The developers update the game fairly regularly with new features and fixes and seem passionate about wanting to take the game into the future. Im excited to see what else is in the pipeline.

review: This is probably in my top 10 games ever. If you need an idea of what the game is about it's sort of a mix of DayZ and Hunger Games. I used to own and play DayZ but it was typically boring as hell. Running around hoping to find loot and then just existing because there was no real purpose. PUBG fixes that. Your purpose is to be the last man (or squad) standing out of the 100 people that start in each game. This is the Hunger Games aspect. After the game begins a series of circles begin appearing on the map that show safe and danger zones. If you get caught in the danger zone your health will quickly deplete. By doing this players cant just camp random corners of the map and are eventually forced into confrontation. The average full game (if you win) is around 30 minutes and is basically broken down like this Early game this is full of panicky "ohshitohshit" moments. You're scrambing to find a gun and hoping people near you did not. You will die alot here when someone gets a shotgun and other gear while you find weapon attachments and no weapon and are forced to confront them with bare fists. You'll be booting up a new match in no time. Mid game this is the majority of the game. You survived the craziness are now focusing on getting completely geared up. You will hopefully find weapons you prefer and attachments to go with them as well as get a nice supply of healing items and high level armor. The conflicts here are more spread out but more rewarding then the early game ones because your enemies have been hunting for gear like you and you'll be looting their corpses like treasure chests. Endgame You've made it. You're geared out of your mind and the safe zone is shrinking into nothing. All the panic from the early game returns. Every bush is a possible enemy. Houses are few and typically occupied and the center of attention. You will usually be crawling peeking over hills or running behind trees trying to spot your quarry before they spot you. Picking whether or not to take a shot has never been so important. Just a few kills and you could be enjoying a nice chicken dinner.I'm a little excited just thinking about it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Blueballs are too busy implementing new skins and crates instead of fixing some of the core issues around the game.1) Hacking is rampant and all attempts to nullify this has been made redundant.2) Loot spawns. They're absolutely terrible. Clothing needs to be removed completely which in turn will increase weapon spawn rates as a side effect. You should not be able to loot 5 buildings in Po i and only come out with a P92 alongside enough clothing to fill Michael Jackson's wardrobe. 3) Server tick rates. There's been several instances where myself other players and even streamers have been tagged by another player and no hit has been registered. The visual "blood" hit marker is showing hoowever no damage has been inflicted upon the recepient of the shot. You SHOULD be able to trade kills considering this game does not employ HIT SCAN gun mechanics.4) Optimisation. This is a big one. Upon 1.0 release optimisation of the new map increased drastically however with every update/hotfix the game is slowly running worse and worse with increased memory leak issues. I've played this game on 2 systems 1 system with an i7 8700k 64gb 1080ti and the game ran smoothly on ultra at 144hz. The other system is an i7 6700k 16gb with a 1070 and the game runs at 70 fps on medium with memory leak issues switching between 70 40 fps (and yes I've reinstalled windows/drivers.) Not everyone has vast amounts of cash to build a system just to play this game Blueballs.Until the core issues are fixed mainly hacking then this game will eventually die a slow death like H1Z1 if Blueballs continues to prioritise profit from Tencent in the Chinese market and loot crates over player enjoyment.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is rediculous. Don't get me wrong it is a fun game but don't expect much from the devs. Even though I have just recieved the game I have followed it for a long time contemplating a buy. My buddy decided to buy it for me. Even though the community is constantly blatantly telling them to Region lock Asian Countries as it is unfair to NA and EU players they will not. It has gone far enough as the community to go to Change.org to put up a petition. Don't get me wrong the game is fun but it is just drown out by constant Dsync issues and chinese hackers. It would be ok if they would region lock asian countries and leave NA and EU unlocked or have a ping limiter and then eventual boot from the game. I understand the Devs not wanting to Lock China as it is a mojority of their player base and they don't want to lose sales but ing over your Western Community is discustingly selfish. Devs now adays just think about themselves and not their communities.TL DR Too many Chinese with Dsync and hacking.

review: Lets get something out of the way first as anyone reading this you should know that this is a game not everyone will play and enjoy now i dont mean its unplayable i personaly have encountered very little in the way of game breakings bugs. But in no way do i say that this game is unplayable me and my duo partner enjoy this game because it gives an elemant of fun to a game of skill. and sure bit of server lag sometimes you are behind a rock and die because server wise you wernt there yet. but either way thats to be expected considering the game is stil early access and servers are hard to run. especially multiple servers of 100 or so players.i can recommend this game for anyone who enjoys some solo pure pvp action because i play this game solo and i still have fun. so yes i recommend this game. but be warned it isnt for everyone so you may not like it in the end but that doesnt mean its a bad game. also on the note of "hackers" i havent seen any and in any game there will be hackers. we are gamers put your big boy pants on and deal with it.

review: To all the negative reviews with over 200+ hours in the game I can understand you not being happy with the lagging and cheating but you brought the game in early access you knew the risks. Now does it have problems? Yes it does should these problems be fixed now its out of early access? Yes they should be but they are not. Don't buy this game expecting it will ever be perfect because it might never be but even in the state it is in its defiantly worth playing.

review: Enjoyable? Definately. Frustrating? It can be very much so. Especially when you spend ten minutes running from one building to the next looking for weapons and ammo only to be gunned down by a more experienced or luckier player who have managed to pick the perfect landing spot and getting their hands on the right bits of kit(equipment). On the other side of the coin you do get moments where YOU get the drop on the opposition and that can be strangely satisfiying. Especially when you clobber them with the OP pan while they are trying to feed some bullets into the breach of their most coveted weapon.I would recomened this game to anyone but I have noticed a lot of controversy in other reviews about gunning down a player who is also streaming at the same time. I personally haven't had any issues with this myself so I can't give any feedback on that area. As a whole PUBG is fun to play but be warned if you plan on going in solo you had better be in favour with the gods because your enemies will not show you any mercy.

review: 1.0 Review Honestly it's a pretty crappy game that was rushed to 1.0. Numerous early access bugs/aspects remain such as late spawning loot poor hitbox detection early game dsync non loading terrain at distance (even while looking through scopes I might add) HORRIBLE melee system and many more. While the core gameplay can be fun at times and keep someone engaged on occasion for hundreds of hours (look at my playtime) I get the sense that a lot of players are just waiting for a better implemented game to come along. Many have already found that in Fortnite. It has improved significantly from early access in areas of average FPS and overall dsync but it is still FAR from a "1.0 packaged product". The developers are slow to roll out updates and bug fixes or even to COMMUNICATE future updates. PUBG is a phenomenon of a rushed game that filled a vacuum of battle royale demand with the large help of Twitch streamers and other content creators popularizing the game. I myself will most likely continue to play it until a better game comes along which I imagine will be soon. If you haven't picked up this game already you surely can wait along with me. Don't waste your money or time.

review: Too be honest I'm not quite done with this review. I still need more hours into the game to solidify the statements I'm about to make but for now I can not recommend PUBG without a friend. With a friend however this game is a blast. ( As with pretty much any other game.) Having a bunch of funny moments to look back on is always great but without a friend you start to see the critical flaws with how this game plays. You start out with around 100 people all sitting in a plane that is flying towards a large island. You are then ejected out of the plane at your given choice and sent into a map filled with houses with a then filled with guns. You then must either make your way towards a white circle that gets smaller periodically over time. With a blue area denial type circle forcing players towards the white one. This system would work great if it wasn't for the fact the whoever gets in it first or more likely whoever was the lucky one to be dead in the middle of it didn't have a complete advantage over everyone else who have to make their way to HIS turf.Another issue is the optimization but this could soon be fixed for some with the 1.0 patch. As it stands however the game 3.6 gb of RAM while not in a game so for anyone with 8gb of RAM might have some issues with loading in things like buildings quick enough to be effective. I personally have a powerful enough system to run this game smoothly at 60 fps with little to no issues.Then there is the crashes so far I have had around 6 crashes since I started playing with all of them being in the middle of a match. If the playtime/crash ratio is correct it is close to 1 crash every 2 hours. That is insane even for a indie title especially an indie title with millions of dollars. Solo play is frustrating and very much based on RNG. You checked the left corner instead of the right corner while sweaping a building dead. Busy looting a house when a decked out man drives up and one shots you? Get better at the game and I'm sure that won't happen again. Grow some balls and go straight for School? Sorry someone got a gun a second before you and has already started screaming into the mic to mock your noobness. You get the idea. I've heard a lot of people saying there is a lot of hackers. Well I personally have not seen any hackers ( At least from what I can tell.) and mostly only see people who do nothing but play this game and shoot me with their AKM from half a mile away. Though maybe their the hackers.Now on to the positive side of things. This game can be fun when RNG is on your side and get the S12 and walk into the building with all the naked people bunching eachother. Quite satisfying indeed. Plus playing with friends is always a blast hearing your dead friend scream "HOETO" at a hawainn guy who also screams the same thing at me is a wonderful experience. Of course when your friend leaves and leaves you with Solo it is pretty crappy. Excuse the grammar. kappa
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The recent addition of a new desert map and constant DEV tweaking of the weapons and character abilities make the game a challenge and fun to play.There are down sides as in every PC game the hackers cheats and exploiters will we ever see them go and play PS4? Not likely makes the game more challenging than it already is. Once you get to know the maps the game plays easier which while more fun on one side makes the game a bit droll at other times.

review: I wasn't really a fan of Survial Games since H1Z1 but I still tried out the game and it turned out I still dont enjoy them. Just to make sure I will put also some of my own opinion in this review so its maybe a bit more relatable. First of all I have to say the Performance is really bad for my spec (Nvidia GTX 960 4GB AMD FX 8350). I mostly just got 40 50 FPS on the lowest available settings. I also think its really frustrating that when you are new to the game you baerly have anything to learn how the weapons work or how their recoil is. When playing 1 round for around 30mins and then dying instantly cause ur weapon is maybe a sniper and you didnt realised it its pretty upsetting or when you get killed from 2 people behind you. Really feels like wasted time. Im aware that there are a lot of people liking Battle Royale games. But personaly its not my type of game. The performance for Player Unknowns Battlegrounds is as said not very good. And not every normal PC Player can afford a huge setup to get a decent performance in games like these. Hopefully they will do some more changes in the near future but for now it really is just laggy and the whole World just doesnt really look good on lowest Graphics.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fun when you're engaged but the game gets boring very quickly as you run across the whole map and only see 1 2 teams unless you're lucky. If you dont have a problem with passive play this is a game for you but if you're aggressive you'll find it hard to find teams outside of the initial drop into a crowded town. The hit detection is also horrible as you'll be aimed right on someone but hit the obstacle you're taking cover behind even if you're looking over it. But other than them issues the game is pretty fun if you're playing with a friend or friends as you can keep eachother entertained while running 2 km to not find anyone. So i have mixed feelings here but yeah why not go for it!

review: I can honestly say that this game is one of my favorites. I've played it more than I should (considering how much free time I had) and I actually won a match after 12 14 hours of playing. It's slow paced unlike H1Z1's KOTK which is just fine by me. Imagine the best parts of H1Z1 KOTK boiled down to the essentials and slowed down so us common people can participate then add some patience requirement and you got PUBG.I highly recommend this game to anyone and all.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Love this game but there a few problemsPros Great game in general Quick matchmaking especially for 100 people. Cons Loot is still terrible. Some houses will have 3 backpacks (all levels or will vary) just have energy drinks &amp clothes or just heaps of micro UZi's/UMP's shotguns &amp handguns. When you die you aren't shown where the person killed you was standing (I get this can't be allowed for teams but this would be increasing the amount of reports). Still limited range of fire arms. Only a couple of good guns which are hard to comeby. Vehicles are somewhat common but necessary if you need to travel a fair distance. circle closes way too quickly you can never outrun the circle you have to start running way before the circle starts to close. Would be great to see additional maps added.Apart from all of this you should definetly buy this game. $29.99USD is an absolute steal for what it is!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a really fun game especially with friends. Pros Game can be played in different ways by jumping either into crowded or uncrowded areas so unless you jump school every time your experience can be different every game. Then if you like jumping school or military base every time you can do that too.Guns are pretty balanced according to how easy/difficult they are to acquire.Very active and responsive development team (mostly).Cons Desperately need to implement leaderboards for First Person Perspective. FPP is the future of the game I think. Optimisation server tickrate server consistency all need improvement. Clothing items need to be removed as in game lootable items. They serve absolutely zero point other than obscuring other loot. I feel like this would help improve the game's loading a bit as computers and servers wouldn't have to render hundreds of extra useless items. Note A lot of people have problems with getting banned but I don't really see why it's such a huge problem. For the most part if you're not a jerk you won't get banned. Going around yelling "F YOU" to people is pretty stupid. I personally don't think someone deserves a ban for something like that unless they're yelling racial slurs and stuff. But in most games targeted language of any kind can get you banned. Saying "OH WHAT THE F JUST HAPPENED" is different from "HEY BIOTCH GO F YOURSELF F ER." Maybe you think you're just having fun but in reality you're being an I turned off all chat in game though so I can't hear if someone's cussing me out or not.

review: Extremely un optimized game. You get almost the same FPS in Low settings as with Extreme graphics settings and its barely breaking 60 fps Average with a GTX 1080 and a 4.2 Ghz 4 core cpu. Been this way for the past 6 months dont have my hopes up concidering the new map is prettier but you get only a slight increase in performance. The game is buggy so you'll have to adapt to the games flaws instead of just getting good. About 50% of Vehicles are pretty much unusable unless you want to kill yourself cause your team is dead and they're waiting for you to die so you can play another round. Servers are unstable to often and no this is not a problem with my network since everyone im playing with experience these issues at the same time. Server stability issues result in a sluggish rubberbanding shots not registering getting shot behind cover t experience. Way to often. In about 1/10 games you're lucky enough to get on a stable server that stops lagging after about 5 minutes. These are game breaking issues that are present in almost every game you're playing.I can see past some things like the map being too big which results in you either sitting in loading screen most of the time since you felt like jumping in a high risk area or you're just running around looting untill there's about 30 players left. Or the fact that theres no game mode to practice with different. Or that the sound is probably the worst i've experienced in a game that sold over 100 copies it's basically impossible to sneak up on people or accurately locate other players without flinging your mouse back and forth over the mousepad hoping they shoot/step enough times so you can point in the somewhat right direction.This game is only fun for a couple of hours to be honest i've put 200 hours into it and i can only recall a few good memories most when i was new and unaware of all the I'm alot better now not because i've mastered the game but i've adapted to the flaws of the game. Based on my own experience I'd say you'll enjoy aproximately 2% of the time spend on this game. But it's the old "My friends play it so i guess i'll join untill something better is released."
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has the potential to be great. Unfortunately you won't be able to play because 9 times out of 10 you'll die because of things you cannot prevent such as hackers teams that are so good at res scumming that you can't even kill them or just the game on you with its terrible sync. I want to like this game. And I've won plenty of times. It isn't worth it. It makes my day less enjoyable and ruins the only time I have away from work. PUBG is like chips. It just makes you reach for more when in reality you don't actually want more you just want all the frustration and pain to be worth something. You think that in the end surely it must be worth it. It isn't. It feels great to win but I would rather be permitted to play a fun game and lose than endure a terrible game and win. 10 times out of 10.

Currently my best "time" is 43 players remaining. I then either go pistols only no weapons at all or just try to sneak around till the end quite frequently getting in the top 5 10.

It's ONLY for fun and laughs etc...The only competitive part of the game is towards the end of each round where there are 15 20 people left. They probably have fool gear by then and they can compete "evenly". The rest of the game is run run run pray for loot and die PTL DR 90% Luck10% SkillCompetitive level LowRecommended only for those who looking to have fun with friends. Nothing more.

review: Addicting a lot of replayability. You might think of it as a copy of H1Z1 don't! This is so much more realistic and balanced you don't just need to have good aim you have to use your brain as well in order to eat chicken at dinner time.I'm not just fanboying PUBG it really deserves it and is probably the experience of the decade nothing really can compare to it right now it's such an innovating idea/experience that makes this game replayable for infinite times because it's just so enjoyable to play it! That's also why it has beaten every record in the Steam Record book you thought it was for no reason at all?! Hell nah they deserve it.Oh and if you want an even better experience play with friends it's even more enjoyable that way.People might say the devs don't care for the players' opinion but they're completely wrong I've been following the latest issues in the game for the past two months and most of what people were complaining is already fixed/balanced. There was an issue were you didn't earn BP at the end of the match for 2 weeks (not every match just a few) guess what two updates after they get you all that you deserved during those weeks your all mighty BP you were all crying about (I was able to earn 22k BP compensation for that time).We were complaining about the game optimization they optimized it and still continue to optimize it even more every single update.There was a hacker rampage on all servers for a few days and after everyones complaints there aren't nearly as many JUST A FEW DAYS AFTER and yet they say they don't care for the players' opinion.Not looking for just fun you're a competitive player that wants to be the best? Don't worry this game got plenty of competition ahead of you.Go for it! It will be a great experience and it's definitely worth the money. (Also I've recoreved the game money just from skins so definitely worth it)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. (Original for July 2017)I've logged quite a bit of hours into this game.The first 40 50 hours were very enjoyable but as time went on I started to notice the flaws of this game.Now the game is a drastic improvement on H1Z1 in most if not every way imaginable but is that to say the game is great or even amazing?Far from it.First of all regardless of who you are regardless of your pc specs you will have crashed not just once twice oreven three times.You will have and will continue to crash a lot.I have logged over 1000 hours into DayZ call me bat crazy but in those 1000+ hours I can tell you I've crashed at least 10x more in slightly less than a 10th of the playtime in this game then I have in DayZ which is absolutely absurd.Secondly The desync.The desync is very very weird in this game.It spands from you getting shot despite being behind cover to getting hit by a vehicle despite having a good 5 meters between you and it.Whilst this may not fall under desync the fact that players obviously don't see the same things as other can bring many complications.An example would be smoke grenades.I am not sure whether or not they fixed this in Rainbow Six Siege but not too long ago you could throw a smoke grenade and to you you feel as if there's enough smoke to the point where you should not be seen but au contraire what you see is different from what your enemy sees.To you you're clouded to your enemy you're just running out in the open hence what's going on in PUBG you may throw a smoke thinking you'll be safe but if yourenemy sees differently what you see no longer applies and you will most likely get shot and potentially killed.Optimization is an odd topic as I myself have rarely been affected by it but I've read many reviews of people barely even being able to play the game because of it so I don't know.I've read many reviews PRAISING the "bullet physics".I'm sorry but the game's ballistics are how can I say this VERY limited?There's bullet drop. That's it.You want legitimate ballistics?Go play Arma 3 with the ACE mod.Although despite it all I do understand that the game isn't trying to be overly realistic but come on no bullet penetration? Really?Wooden guard towers are bullet proof.Water whilst yes realisticly it is good at stopping bullets it is not an impenetrable shield.Basic drywall...walls. Bulletproof.The game is not Rainbow Six Siege but bullet penetration to additional objects would make it remarkably better.Another aspect of the game that many people praise far too much are the visuals.They're fine. Get over it.We are not looking at a AAA title and hell they didn't even dsign their own weapon models.https //www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/animated ironbelly fps starter kitThereare more but I simply posted this one link as aform of reference. Dig around yourself.This game has the absolute worst way ofdealing with lag.Should you be unfortunate enough to encounter lag you won't be rubberbanding around you'll be standing still unable to do anything whilst the game goes on all around you.All you can do is sit there and wait.This is the only game I've played that has done this and it is frustrating.I may lag in another game but it does not stop medead in my tracks I'll still be able to move although be it at a very wonky pace.A friend gifted me this game and with friends is the only time I can enjoy this game and whilst I do get a bit of satisfaction out of winning a game I much prefer just messing around rather than actually playing it theway it was intended.Also who the hell decided to make care packages drop snipers without scopes?The practicality of the "sniper" just nose dives into a 4x might make a bit more useful but any less than that and the whole thing becomes borderline useless.Any who If I were to give the game a rating in it's current state It'd be a 6.5/10.It's enjoyable with friends.Pretty damn flawed but it's an early access game.Can't wait for 1st person only servers.Edit Jan 26 2018 Stopped playing the game in September of 2017 and recently came back because a friend asked me to play.Figured why the hell not.Joined my first game in months and the game crashed. Wonderful I said.After finally getting into a game that worked I found myself in shock and awe at how smoothly the game ran since the last time I played.It felt like a completely different game because of this and I actually found myself enjoying the game a bit more since I last played purely because of this although the deeper I dug the more and more I despised the game like I used to.PROS Game runs like butter They added a new map.CONS bad_module_info Entire game freezing for everyone Desync that still has yet to get fixed Scripters/Cheaters/Hackers Awful map rotation (The map played being Miramar like 80% of the time) Inaccurate patch notes ( PC 1.0 Update #1 "Fixed the issue where bullets couldn t penetrate particular fences from both sides." This legitimately was not fixed until a week or two later after the official release of the patch) There's probably stuff I'm missing on both negative and positive spectrums but these were the most appealing/unappealing of the bunch for me thus far.As I've stated game runs like butter and can be very enjoyable but the sheer amount of sketchy I've witnessed in the past two weeks of playing has just made me hate the game even more due to the fact that even with the game's "official release" it still feels like a beta.Official release and still a plethora of bugs some game breaking either legitimate cheaters or the death cam is ed DESYNC and lastly I know there's a new map but I'd rather not play it 8/10 matches it gets horribly dull.5.5/10.

review: Quickly became addict to this game. I've always like ffs however games like csgo and Cod have never been my style with their too quick to follow gameplay. While you can choose to have some of those moments in this game it's especially fun being in a squad looting the land and searching for fights while sometimes running into one unexpectedly. The blue circle is great at forcing the players together and is sometimes a deadly obstacle itself when you haven't properly planned when to move and where.Many people have issues with hackers but they usually die quickly anyways and are rare to run into. If I could change anything it would be to have the choice to which map you can play. So far we have the original island and the desert but I've been forced to play the desert 95% of my games and it gets tiring. Overall an amazing game that I highly recommend to anyone.

review: (((PLEASE FIX CRASHING BUG)))PUBG used to be an amazing unique game nothing was quiet like it and both myself and many others i know really enjoyed it have ever quite recently the game has develouped a number of faults from major lagging to crashing of the game having to completly shut either the game down or the entire PC.one in every 3 games there will be a fault from a number of things thus ruining the game. If you are able to exit the game and reload it in time with your squad still active then it leaves you with a huge unfair advantage due to time being shortened each round and you loosing out on a good few minutes.I am currently writing this review looking at my second screen at the game that has crashed and has done many times this last few weeks forcing me to shut my pc down.It cant be my pc as It does not do this with any other game and being lucky enough to own a good gaming pc its highly unlikley its my end.I really want to support the game as it is brilliant and have spent countless hungry and frustrating hours trying to get a chicken dinner and really enjoyed it but something needs to be sorted regarding these bugs.Im slowly turning my back to PUBG which is a shame as its one of the top games out there ( (sorry for the terrible language).

review: I honestly see why no one can dislike this game. Sure it's not for some people but the reasons people say its a bad game are just stupid. 1) Of course there will be hackers. Any highly successful game will have them. The devs are always working on this issue. Out of the time I have played I haven't run into any hackers.2) Sure there is some lag but again games like couter strike have on some occasions laggy servers. We have to remember the game has not fully launched yet. If you want a completely perfect game buy it after launch3) Gameplay. The gameplay is all but boring. Some games you get killed in the first 3 minutes. Some games you win. No matter which of these happen to you the adreniline pumps every second you jump off that plane.

review: Well. I am seeing a lot about performance issues but I have the settings on High (very high?) and run with a consistent 30 40 fps. This is in the midst of combat sure you get dsync and what not but I have yet to experience any issues with the game outside of the normal nonsense.On a note to those hesitant I too hesitated. I bought it and sure as hell there was or are insert expletive here issues to deal with but the game itself and the optimisation im my case is fun and not an issue.I have a Nvidia 1050 tiI have a i5 7600 3.5 GHz CPU (usually its running at full closer to 4.1 or something)I have Windows 10I have 16 GB RAMThe problem im afraid while this may not always be the case lies with the end user. In most cases. Not all.EDIT I do not recommend solo. Play with friends that way the game is fun. Get killed by a hacker? Suck it up kill 5x as many people next round and when the hacker does kill you you'll feel accomplished in having killed as many people beforehand. All is well and balance is restored.

review: This game is in early access there will be issues. When you consider how many people in these reviews have hundreds of hours in this game you think "what's so special about this game"? I think its the perfect balance of hardcore and casual battle royale games. More UI and indicators than something like ARMA but still holding more realism than Fortnight BR. The issues with this game I believe will eventually be worked out. Most other early access games are dead by this point but PUBG has shown continual patching with an overall trend towards a better game.

review: When I first played this game I didn't like it. Was it buggy? A little but it is early access. Was it too complex? Nope the idea is simple. What was it that I didn't like about it then? I sucked at it. Plain and simple. I couldn't be a run and gun spray and pray gun wielding maniac. It took all of my experience in FPS and all over it and screamed at me "You are a noob!" I was affronted and left it in my library like an old book that didn't captivate me in the first few chapters.Some time later I came back to it and boys and girls was I glad I did. I came at it from a more mature approach. This game was about strategy and survival. About thinking and out thinking 99 other players. Now admittedly I don't play solo. It doesn't do it for me but I love duos and squad play is a good bit of fun too. It challenges me stresses me frustrates me and urges me to do better. And when you taste the sweet sweet victory and experience your first chicken dinner it makes all the hours worth it. Highly recommend this game for people who like a challenge and can accept that they won't win every single game.

review: This game has hands down the most unbearably worthless user interface that I've ever had the displeasure of using. The anticheat is obviously absent from the game. You're unable to add anyone in your squad to you friendslist or communicate with them other than primatively. Razer and several other hardware companys all make products that come with software that you can use to make macros to abuse this game. They have no plans on stopping this. The ping limit is &gt 2000ms allowing players to abuse lagswitches and long distance server pings to not get hit. (ie why there are so many asian players in the NA/EU servers.) Erangel is so wide and flat that if you don't have an 8x scope within the first few moments you'll be trapped in buildings until the end of the game. I sincerely hope that western AA or AAA producer is watching all of these reviews and getting ready to put out a complete title that delivers on every point where this shitbox fails.

review: Well now that the 1.0 version is out and the game is officially out of Early Access I guess I can drop a review.First things first even though the game is out of Early Access it doesn't mean there are no bugs. There are. A lot. But I believe it will decrease over time since it's a constant work in progress. Improvements made on the 1.0 version The 1.0 version is a huge improvement over the beta version. The main improvement here is the game optimization. It runs so much more smoothly and at a stable frame rate than before. Congratulations to the Bluehole and PUBG Corp team for that. Also the new map Miramar is so much fun to play and gives the game a breath of fresh air to know that there are two maps to play from (not to choose from yet). Of course the new map runs better than the old one since it's a desert map and there's way less trees grass and other stuff so it's less GPU intensive. But Erangel saw a huge improvement in performance in the 1.0 version. Servers and connection Now regarding the servers and the connection. It still has a lot to improve on. Game starts are literally unplayable at least 7 out of 10 times. You try to reach for a gun at the very start and your character keeps rolling back it's like one step forward and three steps back. The infamous ''rubber banding'' still needs to be taken care of. Only after the first twenty or thirty players have died it starts to wear off. Sometimes it doesn't happen at all sometimes it happens it's a lottery. Gameplay As for the gameplay experience you will have playing this game. No complaints regarding that. It's so much fun! Every match is a different match and it feels fresh again. One thing I especially like about PUBG is that you can play a new match very quickly after you finished the other. You die in your previous match and in a matter of seconds you are already in other match. This is very good! The game is such a huge success because it's a breth of fresh air in the gaming industry it's unique unlike any other survival game that came before PUBG. People say it's an H1Z1 rip off but what people don't seem to know or remember is that Brendan "PLAYERUNKNOWN" Greene was part of the team that created H1Z1! He also created the ArmA III Battle Royale mod so it's original. And this game feels amazing! So much better than H1Z1 DayZ (NewZ? hahaha) and every other survival game out there and in my opinion it sets a new landmark in the gaming industry. Definitely the best game of 2017. Too bad they gave the GOTY award to a freaking console game than to PUBG the most played game of 2017. But that's okay it's just a title. The numbers don't lie. Graphics and weapon handling And what about the graphics? Well the graphics are amazing. It's made on the Unreal Engine 4 what can I say more about the graphics? They are very good and realistic if you have a good rig don't refrain from putting it all to ultra settings it feels amazing.Weapon handling is good too. Weapon sounds are realistics realistic bullet drop and weapons too. To sum up Pros Great graphics Fun to play either solo or with a few friends Fast paced action packed gameplay The next round will always feel different from the previous one Huge playerbase meaning that you'll never have to wait longer than 5 seconds to get into a match Cons Sometimes it can feel a bit laggy on game start Cheaters It's not region locked so more often than not you'll find players from other regions playing in your region which can be a disadvantage because their latency will be off the charts making it harder to kill them It's still poorly optimized meaning that even the best of the best PC's will encounter some trouble running it on ultra settings on a stable 60 (or 144) fps Not being able to chose what map you want to play. Final score 8/10 recommended!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game i would recomend it to anyone. That being said im not sure if the game shouldve really left early access yet it still feels unfinished. Mainly there are latency issues (when i watch the "death cam" the person killing me is aiming way behind me). And something about the overall game feels pretty unpolished.AND...! What i truly want to see is more game modes. Battle Royal Duals and Squad are great but i really want to see how this game would handle more conventional game modes (ie team deathmatch capture the flag conquest etc.) I think turning this game into the end all be all of first person shooters would be amazing. I dont want to buy COD i dont want to support EA I want a game that replaces everything else on the market. The "feel" of the game is better than most. The engine is almost perfect. Now i want to expand on that and have custom classes respawns a progress/unlock tree with. Basically i want this game to replace every other shooter i own and give me and my friends the perfect FPS.

review: This game is too good for a review so I'll just explain how to make chicken dinnerIngredients1 4 lb. roasting chicken giblets removedKosher salt and freshly ground black pepper1 Tbs. extra virgin olive oilFor the pan sauce (optional) 1/2 cup dry white wine 1 Tbs. chopped fresh parsley 1 Tbs. cold unsalted butter cut into 4 pieces Freshly ground black pepperPreparationRoast the chicken Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 450 F.Put the chicken breast side up on a roasting rack in a medium (9 13 inch or similar) flameproof baking dish or roasting pan. Tuck the wing tips behind the neck and loosely tie the legs together with a piece of kitchen twine. Season the breast all over with 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper. Turn the chicken over. Season the back all over with 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper. Drizzle the oil evenly over the back of the chicken.Roast the chicken breast side down for 30 minutes. Turn it over by inserting sturdy tongs into the cavity and flipping it. Continue roasting until an instant read thermometer inserted into the thigh reads 165 to 170 F an additional 30 to 35 minutes.Transfer the chicken to a cutting board loosely tent it with foil and let it rest for 15 minutes.If you re making the pan sauce While the chicken rests remove the roasting rack from the pan and let the pan sit for 10 minutes to slightly cool the pan juices. Tilt the pan so the juices run to one corner. Use a large soup spoon to skim off and discard as much of the clear fat as possible.Position the pan over a large burner on high heat. Pour the wine into the pan. Using a wooden spoon scrape up the browned bits stuck on the bottom of the pan. Add 3/4 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer. If the liquid does not cover the entire bottom of your pan tilt the pan to move the liquid around. Continue scraping up all of the bits using the back of the spoon to dissolve as much of the browned bits as you can until the sauce reduces to about 1/3 cup and is a deep mahogany color 8 to 10 minutes.Take the pan off the heat add the parsley and swirl in the cold butter until it melts. Season to taste with pepper and transfer the sauce to a pitcher or bowl for serving.To serve Snip the twine from the chicken s legs carve the chicken and serve.

review: PUBG is a great game. Currently there are issues with hackers and textures loading and a million other things but the game is still to fun to put down. Hopefully the release of 1.0 in 20hrs will show improvements in some areas. Ping lock is coming and will help with server lag. As far as gameplay prepare to die. Competition is tough. I am by no means a good online shooter player but I am not the worst and I have yet to win a chicken dinner in 100 hrs. Third is my best finish. Kills are so satisfying because they don't come easy. Stealth is the name of the game. The player that spots another first has a huge advantage. This is not a run and gun game. Many different strategies to try some players camp and play to survive some players like to drop at the school and big cities and fight it out early. It's up to you. The one thing that is for sure is ya better keep your eyes out for the BLUE WALLEDIT Review to be updated since release of 1.0...its a whole new game standby

review: Ok so to start off the review I have to say that this is one of the most frustrating games that I've every played. Now that I have your attention the frustaration that I encounter is not on the game itself. It has to do with me as a player. I love this game but the only thing that I have against it is my inability to break the top 5. You think that you are going to play it smart that everything will be fine if you take it slow and just try to make sure that you sweep the area. Boy are you mistaken when you play this game it will be intense! I love this game. If you have any time what so ever you need to play this game at least once. This game will take some time to learn but when the learning curve is over then you will have the time of your life! Don't play this game if you have somewhere to be within the next hour. But do play this game if it is hot or too cold outside.

review: Fix your of a game before I can play this and have fun with it. I'll go into pecado for example and not find a single gun in an entire two story building and someone pops up with all lvl. 3 armor with a SCAR L and just obliterate me in seconds when the game starts. This is ridiculous! The main focus should be a way to deal with all the hackers and not rushing the game to full launch. I love this game and the idea behind it but it needs a lot of work before I can enjoy playing it. Oh and don't even consider buying this if your internet is just below anything great and don't even consider it if you dont have the optimal upgrades for your PC either.

I'm not sure how to fix it either but now that it's 1.0 people aren't gonna stand for it much longer. I would say save your money tell bluehole to get it's stuff together and fix the anti cheat system then go buy another game. With all the money they've made off this game there's no excuse.

review: PUBG is a game that I certainely think is a must try for every fan of multiplayer games. This game is not with out a ton of flaws but in my personal opinion the flaws don't out weigh the good. The game is fun to play. No two games are really the same. You never really know what is going to happen which is great for a game that is only multiplayer. I enjoy playing solo games while my friends watch over my shoulder and playing in duos and teams. I love the crazy and cool things that can happen. I like how in almost 30 hours played I still don't know the whole map. I like how matches don't soak up a lot of your time and you don't have to be heavily invested to do well or have fun. I just think it's a fun game that everyone should try out.Now here is why I can also agree that this game is t. Since being in early access the constant frame rate drops game crashes lag texture rendering gpu/cpu murdering that happens can be beyond frustrating. I'm running an I5 66k with a GTX 970 and sometiems my game STILL has issues running it. Considering the game has never waivered from a $30 price tag and selling over a million copies you'd think they could fund fixing the game faster and making it stable. I think the developers are doing what they can but I think greed plays a factor and they aren't focusing on ther right things. Another flaw in my opinion going back to the money they've made you'd think there would be a little more variation in maps guns and customization. Overall for $30 you get a better multiplayer experience than some AAA titles. It's a trend setter and honestly the best battle royale game in my opinion. You can expect fun and exciting games and you can expect lag and performance issues. However ignoring a questionable port to console and future plans to port to mobile devices. If the developer focuses more on customization stability and content you have a game with a bright future so long as the hype doesn't die out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG's fun comes from losing. If you don't like losing constantly before you even get a chance to get anywhere this game isn't for you. If you do enjoy it and you also enjoy getting beaten with a stick 24/7 as punishment for simply existing then go ahead! It's the best thing for you!However it does have solid gameplay and good graphics even if it had a very wonky development cycle. So I guess for that it wouldn't hurt to try if it's on sale.

review: I have a love hate relationship for this game. Sometimes I get like really random great kills other times I'm just a nervous wreck and I die. why? Because you spend half the game running away from blue and hoping you don't get sniped in an open field.Pros If you aren't an idiot you can consistently make top 5. But you'll average like 1 4 kills a game. Yeah. Not a big killer game. More stragetic and common sense orientated. If you want to head toward 3 different squads fighting then you'll probably lose. Or end up in a fight that takes you into the blue death circle and then it was pointless. So people who want to get kills like cray should stick to BF or something. You have 1 life and it's important. I've won games where my entire squad died way early and I just finished off the last two people fighting hiding in a bush because they had no idea I was there. Yeah scaredy cat tactic but it worked and I played through an entire 89 players without getting caught. Near the end it's kinda a game of someone running around being distracting so you can lure the last of the squads out (maybe the last 4 players) so your team can get a good view. Will you die? Maybe. Team work is a big deal. I end up being the medic the spotter call out while my other friend is better at finishing off people near the end because I'll suicide mission so they know where they are. Someone else in our team is probably a great sniper. Another person is a flanker. It's almost a survival horror (LOL) because you're running and you're very aware there's people behind you who WILL die to blue but want to take you out anyway. Oh well. That's why you have other teammates. Playing smart gurantees wins. Playing super crazy and aggressive usually makes you lose unless you're actually very good at it. I'm not because I startle too easily. This games goes a long time without a lot of action then bam you're getting flanked. Used to faced placed shooters so I try and be more of the helpful teammate. Share my loot and what not. Anyways I like it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This review is subject to change. I've played since Alpha and had to deal with hackers constantly. That's annoying but what has now become more annoying is the NA servers having players from china come on. It wouldn't be bad if they spoke English. My whole game is dealing with a language barrier and it pisses me off. I get english speaking players 1 out of 15 games. So unless you have friends on or you can understand asian languages this might be great for you. If you have no friends and can't speak anything other than english. Buy something else. You took my money now fix the servers. Even a soft lock on servers would be great. Like the only way a chinese person can be on NA is if he's grouped with NA players. You do that and you fixed a huge issue.

review: THIS GAME HAS ITS FAULTS.It's not optimized the way one would expect I've got a GTX 980 get a pretty solid 50 70fps on high but experience some weird dips every now and then. I personally haven't experienced any hackers most death cams have looked fair.I think this game is fine to play solo but I would prefer having a friend or group of friends to play with. It makes the whole experience a lot better. It turns the oh this motorcykel just flipped exploded or some other weird occurency that would in singleplayer make you a bit mad into something utterly hilarious.Would I in its current state recommend this to someone with a low end Desktop/laptop?No not as it is now. I would recommend Medium to high end PC's.7.5/10

review: So I'll recommend the game sort of.It's kind of way over hyped.Really it's not a great design. Most of your games will only you off sometimes you'll get a few good games but that's mostly with friends. In fact unless you have friends to play with regularly I highly recommend not getting this game. Solo sucks.Also the game will forever continue to have huge cheater problem.Camping is also 90% of the game the other 10% is getting ed by the circle.It's a fun game with friends in the right mood but it really doesn't deserve the praise it gets. The whole BR design is kind of when you sit and think about it. It'll always favor the lucky camper with a sniper rifle if your the one being forced to move often times it's better to quit than give another player a kill.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm just an ordinary Chinese players I often encounter plugin this leads to my game experience is very poor but I don't think you should call for game companies lock area but let them against external mechanism of strengthening this I in many regions have met some very nice friends for example three friendly American brothers a fierce Russian brothers brothers an interesting southeast Asia a cute British brothers a silly brothers South Korea and Japan's brother a hentai. Although we only met once but I always remember their friendly voice we have some wonderful memories I am very happy to meet these people. I'm sure you've all met with foreign brothers and we shouldn't let them ruin our feelings. t game company strengthens the anti hanging mechanism!!!我只是一个普通的中国玩家 我经常碰到外挂 这导致我的游戏体验很差 但是我觉得你们不应该呼吁游戏公司锁区 而是让他们加强一下这狗屎的反外挂机制 我在很多大区都碰到过一些非常友善的朋友 例如 三个友善的美国兄弟 一个勇猛的俄罗斯兄弟 一个有趣的东南亚兄弟 一个可爱的英国兄弟 一个有点傻的韩国兄弟 以及一个绅士的日本兄弟 虽然我们只见过一次 但我永远记得他们友善的声音 我们有一些美好的回忆 能碰到这些人我很开心 我相信你们都碰到过外国兄弟 我们不应该让外挂破坏我们的感情 狗屎游戏公司加强反外挂机制
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The Good Best BR game play I have experiancedDecent gun mechanicsThe BadHackers/Cheats As you go up the rankings you end up in matches with so many cheaters. Now with the replay fuction you think it would lower the ammount but nope. Not surprised tho as even after reporting players with video link of clear ESP and Low FOV aimbot the responce was "we will watch him" well its been 2 weeks now and he is in the top 5 and still playing with a 60% headshot rating.Part of me wonders if the cheaters and hackers are allowed to play for a set time before the bans so that they will buy the game again. (Business Plan maybe?)The best matches you have are after patches when most of the cheats are worried if the patch will catch them.The Zone The zone moves too quick towards the end of the matches you should always be able to run the same speed of it. It ends up being counter productive to gun play as if you end up on the edge and get into a fire fight 90% of the time your gonna die. So you end up choosing not to shoot people in a shooting game. Also if you get unlucky with your location and the circle ends up on the other side of the map it ends up becoming a running simulator. Maybe the first circle should be up before you jump so you can choose if you really want to be that far away from it?Overal Love the game despise the Cheaters. Devs need to do more against the cheats.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To start with the game is very challenging for your gpu it's gonna give it hell but if u fit the minimum requirements u will be able to play but players with better graphics will always have an advantage vs you because they can spot you more easily. The game have some bug issues but since it's not released (yet) you cant do many things about it . On the otherside the game is fun adventurous challenging and breathtaking even more if you play with your buddies as a squad. I tell you guys you are in a hell where you can die at any moment from a sniper at the mountain across but if you make it to top 10 your heart starts feeling funny you calculate shots with your heartbeats pumping at your finger at the mouse triger. I have been a gamer for 13 years and i have never had so much emotions playing this game . You can play it hardcore with your headphones to hear every snikky little at the next building or you can just have fun with your friends driving shooting hiding. Also the game responds very well at combat tactics and you really gotta use your brain to win the chicken dinner ! I just won my first solo chicken dinner today and i was thrilled its like you survive through armagedon just imagine being the one who survived between 99 more guys . The game is getting better everyday. If you have a bit of patience i totally recommend it especially if you have some friends to play with (or you can make new at discord etc) ! This game is gonna be at the hall of fame of Gaming if developers keep up the good work . This game is born to raise hell! Join the battle

review: This is the most addicting game ive ever played i can't pull myself off of it i played all through the beta and now on early access its definitely worth the price it does have a few minor bugs here and there but nothing game crippling and you can tell they are working on it and making it better it could use some better optimizing but i get around 70 fps with everything on medium i have i5 6600k GTX970 8gb ram. 10/10 would definitely recommend it!Now that the initial hype for this game has died down a bit and now that i have a decent amount of hours in im updating my review while i still recommend this game i recommend it with caution if you dont have the patience for the devs to fix what needs fixing then this game isnt for you i have personally incounterd hackers on several matches but i ve may be seen 20 hackers total out of the hunderds of matches ive played and as of recently i havent seen any anymore the fps and dsync are a factor but each update i can see it getting better so if you have the patience the good matches on this game are super fun and make all the other crap worth it.

review: I think that this game is fun for mucking around with friends and in general has great visuals and allows people to come back and continually plsy. However in saying this for someone who takes this game seriously will dislike this game due to the many flaws that some of the modes such as the third person mode provides such as being seen from around the corner. Other game breaking glitches such as spawning from the airplane being able to not see any buildings and rocks allowing the person to drive vehicles through a apartment building killing a person who is looting for weapons. Overall this game is great and fun when playing for fun and taking it casually but i would not recommend it to a person who wants to take this game seriously.

review: If you like tactical shooters youll love pubg. there are so many different ways to handle a situation and for $30 you get your money worth. there are bugs but its never been "unplayable" with version 1.0 in the test servers right now its looking better and better. i have an "ok" laptop and can run this game at 60+ on low settings which i dont mind because it still looks good. they are working on it and optimizing it every big update. its not a super fast paced game but it has that middle ground where at one point you might just be running through a field and a couple minutes later your in a city caught between enemys from different sides. not a perfect game but no where near as bad as H1Z1 can be.

review: The game it self is stella and great fun in 4 man groups or duo q. Not a fan of solo personaly i play the game to play with friends. Game play is pretty fluid the lag in game is really good playing any where in the world. Im aussie but play NA AS OC all pretty good. Server tic rate is not the best Gun accuracy is also not the best even for the profesional streamers at times you see them on target but miss often.As for the cheaters..... There is not enough being done its very bad at this time with running into cheaters every second game in squads and 3rd person. I like 3rd person alot dont alot do its personal preference at the end of the day.... 50% of the cheaters are from china and the weekends is where the cheating is rife my small 3 man group would run into hackers 50% of the time in games. Thing is they esp hack aim bot so they are always geared level 3 and silences. With rifles they can auto first at range and instantly knock you down or kill you. There is no way to report people in your own squard who are cheating. My advise is to knock them down if they are cheating and leave them there. Thats what we do.Unless player unknown does something about the cheaters and takes a hard stand on them i would stay away from this game in its current state. Most of my friends who played no longer play because of the hackers. Its a pitty the game has come a long way but the cheaters are ruining it for every one and not enough has been done to stop it.

review: This game is a mess I feel bad for both buying this for myself and for a friend of mine as a birthday gift. Ever since the start it has been getting worse with patches and updates that so far haven't helped the game much or have made it worse over time. During the beginning of its release it seemed to be a fun game because there was always a lot of action and it involved some fun teamplay. I see how the concept of the game is fun and great even but the mechanics of this game don't work well along with it as do the servers because it can't handle the vast majority of players that play the game (Which they still haven't fixed to my knowledge).Also worth mentioning is that these devs are not trustworthy as they have broken promises such as when they said microtransactions were not going to be part of the game and they included it anyways with loot boxes for cosmetics. Sure it may not be a big deal for those who don't care about cosmetics but some people care about cosmetics as they like to look cool while playing the game.All in all this game has bugs and glitches as well as bad server performance and consumes your CPU GPU and RAM if you don't meet its required hardware specifications. Stay away from this game if you can and tell your friends the same buy a different game that is worth the money you are willing to spend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game seriously addicting being a Veteran this game really simulates real world combat. A great audio system or headphones are a must. Remember this isnt CS GO the bullets actually have physics. You have to lead people account for range by shooting higher etc. A few errors here and there nothing game breaking after all it's not even officially out yet. I seem to crash maybe once every few days but I'm starting to think that might be my GeForce Experience Replay feature causing it.If I have a major complaint the only one would be restricitng servers by ping and/or region. Chinese hackers are pretty rampant I run across one every few games. Sad part they are mainly hacking on NA Servers if you play the Asian servers you dont see near as many cheaters.If you want a really fun but hard game grab this. I've been having a blast since I started can't wait to see this new map coming out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It is the best multiplayer FPS since CS. Quite a lot of fun but must be played in a squad with your friends to realise it's full potential. Playing with Randoms is exactly that random. It's not without it's glitches and lag rears it's ugly head quite a fair bit but when it's all going well it's excellent.Skill cieling is extremelt high so expect at least 80 100 hours of play before really getting into it.As for the negative feedback this game gets yes there are some crashes and bugs this was after all early access. It crashes you restart the game and continue where you left off. To be honest I did not have many issues with crashing. Make sure you have a beefy PC to handle it and it's quite fine. Even with the issues it was quite playable and once you get past the millenial "must have it now or else" attitude it truly is an awesome game for $29. I've purchased games three times this price to not even play 10 hrs.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: love this game won once feels verdy good!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I resisted the hype for so long only to end up thoroughly enjoying the game. 1up Refreshing take on a survivalistic game. Single Duo and Squad options. Never a problem getting 100 players to matchmake There are many addictive factors that bring you back for more. (Including anxiety) Hackers and bans for killings streamers occur far less than many lead you to believe. The sound phyics are fantastic. You'll rely on the sounds far more than any game you've recently played.1dwn Optimization is meh. However likely will continue to improve. New map releasing soon is just as awesome as the first. Lame system for unlocking items to customize your character. If there isn't a few more solid patches/ expansions for more maps etc....the player count could begin declining. TL DR There is easily $30 worth of fun in this game. I'd give it a shot. I was pleasently surprised after I did. Since there are many games now copying the same premise .You know they have to be doing something right.

review: PlayerUnknown's game has seen it's 1.0 update this major update has delivered few improvements and many flaws. Servers continue to go down in fact server problems are a daily occurence. Client side hit detection has seen no improvements peekers advantage determines the result of a large proportion of firefights and running from a fight will often see you die behind cover. Though the main menu has seen a major redesign it remains unreliable and buggy it's a main menu it shouldn't be broken. Performance has been improved in terms of pure framerate but server performance is still lackluster at best and shoddy at worst. Poor tickrate means firefights are often unsatisfying and hit registration even though it is client side is abysmal. Weapons handle like Arma in the worst way possible with games like Battlefield or Siege or even Rising Storm for inspiration how did this development team create such a sludgy clunky mess?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is loaded with issues the greatest being instability/poor optimization hackers and more bugs than one can count. Even still it is a deathly fun game. Some of those things can ruin your fun if you close to wining or you are a constant tryhard but those moments when you beat all those thing standing in your way or you just have relaxed games with your buds are the most fun moments in this game. So yeah this game can be a salt factory but many fixes are on their way to handle a lot of the causes. Win or lose horribly broken or not this game is a damn good time especially with friends. And a word of advice never trust vehicles.

review: Before I start this review let's keep in mind that the game is still in Early Access and most of the negative reviews in here are Chinese players that for some reason had ads in their server and they didn't like that.Now moving from that aspect.The game it self have its bad and good parts.Pros Fun to play alone and with friends. Good optimization (if you are running a potato computer its normal that it will crash/lag) Few bugs (for an Early Access game) A lot of weapons attachments and vehicles to use. Huge map to explore and try different tactics to win that precious Chicken Dinner.Cons Only one map (so far the devs are going to release a desert map very soon) Hackers (even though I've only encountered 2 in 200 hours of gameplay there have been reports of some hackers in game even though they get banned quickly).The game became popular for a reason it was not the marketing that was done it was not because it was made by a huge company but simply because it's fun and easy to play and even though you can get frustrated at some point you still have fun in the end.

review: This game is supposed to be 1.0 but after playing 4 games of squads we all cannot get into a game together. After constant server errors not seeing each other in our lobby etc. Besides that this game is poorly optimized for being "released." I have a GTX 1080 and play with everything on low because I still get frame drops rather frequently. The only reason people still play this game is because there's not a replacement for it yet (besides Fortnite but building isn't for everyone). PUBG can be fun when it's working properly but that's pretty rare.

review: I have 99 hours logged and I cannot understand why I have not stopped playing after the first 3 5. In the 2.5 months of me playing I do not think there was a single night where I or one fo my friends have not had some sort of a connection issue. Take tonight for isntance. I managed to play 1 game because the servers were too busy on a Saturday night. I am sorry I cannot play at 11am on a Tuesday. The 2 3 other games I did manage to connect to were frozen in the start screen. If the poor server quality for a game is not bad enough then there is the gross amount of hackers in hte game. The one game I did manage to get into and play I got kille dby someone with a kar98 from a rediculus distance with one shot. In fairness he fired 3 more shots at me but I do not count htose due to the 2 buildings that were between us because I was not in sight. I wish I could check off that I recieved this product for free but sadly I did pay for it and for a game tht has made millions these servers and hacker issues should be better ironed out. If they want to improve gameplay I would also suggest that there is a reward for winning like a crae or a key for these stupid locked crates that I do not have a choice if I want to get. To make the map experience better having the first zone appear from the start would be a HUUGE improvement. Let the player decide if they want to spend 90% of a match running or land where the action is likely to take palce. Land just to find out that I am on the complete opposite end from where the zone is located is annoying and frustrating. This is epecially true in the new map where you can die running before you make it to the zone. I didnt purchase this game to run for 15 minutes just to die. If all I wanted to do was run aimlessly for long periods of time I would play Zelda or WoW. If this game seems interesting play fortnite for free with less headaches.

review: At first this game was amazing. Recently it's become a cesspool of cheaters and hackers. It's fun basically until late at night when all the Chinese players get on. They are literally the worst. Nothing but open mics and hacks and of course the team that produces the game is so convoluted due to the nature of the collaboration that they won't or can't do anything about it. At it's base it's a great game but it's been abandoned by the developers more or less. At the time I'm writing this it's been five days since any social media updates for the game have taken place. No update on the anti cheat (which appears nonexistent) or region locking the cheating Chinese players out. If this game doesn't receive some support soon Fortnite is going to take it over which is too bad because I'd rather play a realistic shooter than some rainbow sprinkles dumpster fire for kids.I'm clicking no for I would not recommend this game currently. That could change depending on how the developers handle the next few months.

review: Great Game. Most fun Ive had in a multiplayer game since Modern Warfare. I avg about 125 fps for the past few months after optimizations. People complain about hackers like theres multiple in every single game they play thats just simply untrue. Ive ran into a total of about 5 or 6 hackers with over 600 hrs on NA OC and AS servers. I rarely crash or disconnect unless its on test server which should be expected. Overall the game has come a long way and the PUBG Corp team has done a great job. Dont let overreacting kids ruin your opinion on the best Battle Royale game available.

review: PUBG is far from a finished game. It never runs consistently. There are so many glaring issues like rubberbanding at the start of a game and periodically throughout that are glossed over by developers and the people that play this game. Nobody seems to acknowledge them or really push for a fix. Instead of fixing these core game issues we get things like vaulting unnecessary ballistic effects and a new map. After playing test server prior to v1.0 it is clear not much has changed. Regardless of the enormous hype for the game out there do not buy this game.

review: This game is pretty solid however it is another king of the hill style game in Early Access. First how is it as an early access title?Well it's badly optimized but not unplayed. I'm playing on an Acer laptop with a GeForce 840m and I'm getting about 30fps on low settings so it's not great... but it's not unplayable like some of the community may want you to think. There is one map there's a good variety of weapons. The essential sound assets are here like accurate location based footsteps and gunshots. The graphics sometimes bug out when you land on the island and everything is blobby and looks as if it's made from clay.How is it on the gameplay front though?So you join a lobby with 99 other people after a minute of making sure everyone is there you get put into one big plane and you fly over the island. Once over land you can enject whenever and parachute down. Once you land you scavenge for ammo weapons armor weapon mods and safety. There is one problem with this spawning system. Sometimes you may go the entire match without seeing a single person until the end... or you may spawn right beside 3 people and die right away. See everyone is in the same plane so it's dropping 100 people accross the map in a line. People are going to jump out over or close to cities which means 7 times out of 10 you're going to be right beside another person and die. This sucks. It's part of the experience yes but it's brutal and is very frustrating.However those moments when that doesn't happen when you get a good arsenal going and are making it house to house that's awesome. And it's better in duo (50 teams of 2) or squad (25 teams of 4) when you have people to back you up.This game is great it's got some optimization issues and frustrating spawn mechanic but it's solid. If you want to wait till it's out of EA okay. If you want to know how the EA is going it's going good no issues yet. TL DR Is it worth 36 bucks? If you can get over 7/10 times dying right at the beginning due to frustrating spawn mechanics poor optimization 1 map and some graphic bugs... yes! a million times yes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The gameplay is awesome. Maps (both) are maybe too big and circles moves a bit too slow. If you're a w4nker the game can be extremely long which is boring and there are obviously many w4nkers in this game i myself i have way too much ADHD so i cannot wait like that.Pro awesome game so much tactical stuff it requires aiming skills af which i really like especially the bulletdrop which makes everything even more realistic.Cons A lot of w4nkers WAY too many russkis give them a region so they can speak their demonic language freely. And here comes the nuclear bomb. The worst thing in this game is the optimization. It is so bad. My computer should have atleast 70/80 fps but it doesn't. I've heard that players with 1080 i76000s and 16gb memory are struggling as well. That simply makes no sense even though it a big map and everything. So if you have a sucky PC don't buy it because you'll have a bad experience even though the game is good. FRUSTRATION is the key to avoid in this game D.Overall i like it but i will not continue to play it if they won't optimize the game it simply runs so bad.

review: I really liked this game during early access. It's best played in a squad with friends. After playing too many hours it's become apparent that the gameplay is not consistent enough. Too many RNGs coupled with loads of ineffective loot have killed any sense of joy in the early game. It's impossible to become acclimated with each weapon along with each variety of attachments without pouring hundreds of hours into a game that changes as soon as you feel comfortable. Land in the right spot get your favorite weapon from the start? That's not going to be enough... you'll need attachments armor backpacks meds... and you'll likely find yourself in a situation where a different weapon has the advantage. Ok you'll try grabbing the first weapon you see and skip looting every building... oh you're sure to run right into somebody with a decent weapon/attachments and you will be outgunned.I'm looking forward to better games that will draw inspiration from PUBG's lengthy experiments. Watching twitch highlights on youtube will be far more rewarding than repeatedly losing 25+ min rounds for the sake of practice.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
