review: To be fair I've played and enjoyed this game from the start. I have had no problems throughout the development with my rig (I7 6700k GTX 1070 16GB RAM in a nutshell) but there have been small snags such as crashes from time to time but very infrequent. Anyways here's a review after playing a couple of games on version 1.0.FRONT END MENU Front end menu is much more clean crisp and tidy. Much better to look at than in a supposed room with a crate next to your feet. New replay feature which is nice to have in case you forgot to record your last match so you can go in and do your own videos. Game modes and lobbies are very clear and give a description of what you're going into before hitting the play button. Leader boards also possess a much nicer layout than before as well as your own in game stats.ANIMATIONS Animations have been cleaned considerably and with the addition of vaulting it makes the game a lot more fluid. Remember before when you had to run all around them 5 foot white picket fences? Nah. Can now vault straight over them. See that Level 3 Helmet stacked on a load of crates you can't get? Well come here you little blighter I'll climb and get ya. Animation looks very fluid as a whole and am glad they kept in the jumping mechanic as back when this was mentioned there were rumours of this being scrapped altogether for vaulting. Picking up animation is now working correctly also which is a nice change and every action is as swift as the last.WATER They state in the patch notes that they have reduced the waves to increase optimisation. I previously had no issues when around water or swimming but I must admit that although they reduced them you would never know. I've read in a past article that Microsoft Studios were going to help them with the water and it looks like they have an have succeeded. Absolutely beautiful. Water splash has also been added as well as gunfire splash which is a nice addition. One small note is that visibility has been reduced when swimming as I struggled to keep my bearings when underwater and was close to drowning. Luckily you will always know which way is up because of the light from the sun but just bear this in mind.POLISHED PRODUCT The best thing for me is the amount of polishing they have done. The colour is now absolutely amazing spot on and completely immersive. Everything blends beautifully. This goes from the crates to the sandy ground the grass to the trees and the buildings as a whole. Everything looks like it has been upped and without requiring additional hardware power. In fact I would say that it HAS optimised better than before as again I would like to say that everything is completely fluid. I don't have a FPS counter and I don't plan on using it as it's something that would play on my mind and I would 'feel' as though I would notice it more but I have a 144Hz monitor and I would go as far as saying that it feels as though it's taking full advantage as it plays seamlessly. Other things which have been polished are the car sounds air strike sound which sounds much more realistic and the overview map has been spruced up and looks very nice with the additional shadowing under the mountains and the colour as a whole.All in all would highly recommend and glad I purchased this game from the beginning to help fund and see how well it has progressed and how far the developers have gone. People saying they have done nothing have absolutely no idea how hard they have worked over the last half a year and how closely they have worked with the community on their forums and they should be proud.

review: 100 players all dropped from an airoplane that flies over a huge map. you choose when to bail glide down in the direction you want then pull parachute and glide to the town you choose. You start with nothing have to run into houses and buildings and shops and pick up guns / medical supplies / petrol for cars / ammo / weapon attachments.If your unlucky you will pick up a frying pan as a weapon and the guy who lands next to you (if one does) picks up an M16.This is a great game the only reason its got mixed reviews is because of all the butthurt players who want game breaking changes they suggest to make it easier for them (because they are .Man up and play the game its intense. Best played with friends as you can squad up.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. NOTE This Review has been UPDATED! Read the updated part below!After playing this and H1Z1 King of the Kill for a good amount of time I can gauge both equally and say without a doubt I perfer this over H1Z1 for sure.Pros Gunplay feels so much better and it feels like my weapons actually hurt the opponents. Group play is amazing with friends more so that H1Z1 for sure. You can choose where to drop when the game starts (to an extent) where as H1Z1 makes you drop where it wants you to and possibly next to several 10's of people. All methods of playing (Guns Scavenging Surviaval) feel fun. You can choose your playstyle and it can easily be done without worrying too much.Cons There are minor compatibility issues but it comes with most Early Access titles so it is expected. Due to the above this can cause lag spikes and signifigant frame drops randomly. It is very rare on high end PC's however. For $30 it is a steep price for a game like this. I feel like there isn't much here to warrant that price tag but if you can play with multiple friends even if it just one friend it makes it better. I definately reccomend purchasing this alongside 1 or more friends. Don't buy it unless you love playing solo!Bottom line it is a very fun game with friends and it's main attraction works VERY well when the game functions the way it should.Despite the very rare frame spikes and lag the game keeps you engaged as you explore the Russian island that has many others on it planning to murder you in cold blood.I give this game a solid 8/10!UPDATE 1 This update irks me to type. I had this game purchased for me by a friend. But that doesn't really change what I am about to say so bare with me.PUBG was fun when you first start out. At least it was for me. The current problems I am having with this game is being able to not only see people to see them before I am shot and killed from a mile away. This could be a mixture of odd settings me and my eyesight or both. I say this because anyone I play with is able to spot people and direct me to the exact location and I STILL can't see anyone but I digress. Now I have a beefy PC to play this on and it still has frame drops and lag spikes ALL THE TIME.Now this is STILL expected as it is Early Access but then they announce this title is coming to Xbox One as an exclusive? Im sorry what?The game is still pretty unstable not to mention hit detection is terrible and most fights end with someone beaming you without your game even showcasing them shooting but sure lets move it to a weaker platform.That shouts logic!Salt aside the game died off for me very fast. The update that included motorcycles and Crossbows was around the time I stopped wanting to really play. I have absolutely no desire to Solo Qeue and since the previous issues mentioned above still happen I don't even want to do multi member parties.Get it on sale if you REALLY want to dive into it.Update 2 This update is coming at you the day of the 1.0 Full Release of PUBG. After 1 game ONE GAME I was able to say that almost every complaint I had from the last update was fixed. I was able to confidently qeue by myself and was able to see and kill anyone I saw but the game ran at 60 fps 60% of the time. The other 40% was 30 fps but it was all VERY playable! Lag spikes? ZERO.It seems the PUBG team is very much listening to the feedback of how completely garbage this game ran and finally took the big steps to fix it. Since the last update of my review they fixed my issues and added in a few new things as well.Vaulting over stuff now exists making traversing a hell of a lot easier in fenced areas. They added a new gun I believe a repeater rifle. They also added a new map to play on which was a welcome addition to the one my group and I came to enjoy over time.So my final verdict. Should you buy PlayerUnknown's BattleGrounds?My answer is a solid yes. If at any point you question the price then I reccomend it on sale if anything. The price right now is still a bit steep even more so if you are going to be playing solo and would rather queue with friends. But all in all the team behind the game is listening to us that is a huge plus.

review: Bought it just a few days ago. Still on early acces but already very playable. Can t wait for the final full version! Highly addictive different playstyles possible. I like to sneak most part of the game staying at edge of circle slowly coming to center of closing circle. Graphics are more than decent sound as well. Further optimization is needed but for a 100 person multiplayer game already very fluent operating. Combat system is still something to get used to. I play CS GO most of the time on the PC and PUBG is something entirely different. Often lost close combat situations just because nog being snappy at shooting not adjusting aim correctly. Armor is very important headshots difficult when opponent is wearing level 3 helmet and facial protection. All in all very satisfying experiece after death I quickly join another server. Looking forward to further optimization of engine and combat system as well. But gameplay in general if fluent usefull artifacts scattered throughout the map even on far away desolated places. I give it a 7/10 at the moment if combat system is improved probably a 9/10. Overall look and feel is just great as well as the concept itself. Really hoping this one turns into a final finished version with map upgrades maybe even fog and snow effects. This game is decent at the moment but has so much more potential. Creating team can go a lot further.

review: Lets be serious for a moment. We can all agree that those who are new to this genre will really enjoy it but if youve played from the very beginning you can see the flaws within this game and through the community.The game is fun the first map was great and very easy to learn. The second map is kinda cluster . Too many props and vaulting directions plus the map is huge to run across.The cosmetics is fun to play with but i think they poorly executed this. The playerunknown set was fine until it skyrocketed to unbelievable prices. Then there was the gamescon which i didnt have a problem with but made everyone mad and then they thought that making some exclusives such as the twitch box and pioneer crate to be sold on the market is a big f you to your face. People making money off crates with every individual item inside worth far less is just . The cheat system seems ok thry talk about banning thousands a day which is nice but i dont recall ever seeing someone getting banned during a game. Maybe they havent introduced that yet but lets see. Good job on getting those hackers off this game.Stream bans was funny to me everytime someone actually got banned fot cheating or breaking the rules they think that saying it was the streamers fault makes me crack up. If you were banned from an actual streamer its probably because you are sniping and your just upset that you cant play. Grow up.Overall i think pubg as a whole was pretty good and fun to explore their changes throughout the year. I cant wait to see what changes comr in the future.8/10

review: This game is still being developed but as of right now it boasts a highly replayable game mechanic and is extremely popular in the community.Graphics 8/10 Could be better could be worse. I think we will see a lot more in the future and this excites me. The graphics are already great and camouflaging yourself is a great tactic with the current graphics.Audio 7/10 Not a bad musical score for the menu but in a game like this music is NOT needed. You would be better off listening for footsteps.Controls 9/10 Extremely easy to learn and almost perfect for the game mechanics. The control scheme is very familiar and will make you feel right at home if you ever play FPS/TPS.Multiplayer 10/10 Off the chart! Great interactivity between players and lots of little helpers along the way. Most of the people you meet are jerks but it just adds to the feel of the game. It's like Rust meets Battlefield without the ability to build anything.Overall 8.5/10This game is still in it's early stages and there will be many new updates. I hope you are along for the ride with me! Because I would definitely recommend this game to anyone!

review: At first PUBG was barely running on my GTX 760 HAWK but now holds a stable 30+ (usually 60) FPS and delivers great gameplay. 50 hours or so and I still love it have never felt like it wasn't worth the full price. Gunplay was really tough to learn (similarly to R6seige if you can't shoot you can't practice shooting so it's a low practice learning curve) but once I got it I started to get consistent 2/3 kills per game and make it to the top 10 about 1 in 3 games. The learning curve itself wasn't unenjoyable either.The new UI and vaulting system are decent the new map doesn't feel unpolished like I thought and better suits my gameplay style and the new guns are very shooty. The game is good.

review: I've never had PTSD from a game.....laying awake until 4am thinking of how I could have won that last round I played at 11 00PM. There is a bit of lag when you drop into a zone with 10+ people but once you get used to that and the overall mechanics of the game it's not so bad.You may play 50 games and not get a win but have satisfaction by getting a couple kills a game. Then the sweet sweet adreneline rush of winning your first game....whether solo duo or squad and yelling because you got that last kill. Chicken has never tasted so good.I'd highly recommend the game as long as you don't have high blood pressure or heart problems because your heart rate will double when you get down to 10 players remaining. Good luck and have fun on the Battlegrounds.

review: I'm a bit conflicted about this game and i'll do my best to explain it here.English is not my mother tonuge so I hope I can make my point.I had a lot of fun in the first few hours with this game but as you get better and start to learn about how to survive and get the last ten survivors I noticed there are more and more "nothing" in between fights and shootouts.. just running from one circle to the next followed by a bit of looting and more moving to the next circle.The thing is that around half of the server jumps into high contest zones right at the start so most of them will die within the first three to first five minutes. that leaves around fifty to sixty something players to run around the very big maps.There where games (thankfully rare ones) that I went from one circle to the next not meeting anyone for over 20 minutes until the circle was so small that I finally saw someone.Most of the time I found myself landing looting killing the one or two guys around and then nothing until the last 10 to 15 players meet at a small circle...At this point I started landing where there were the most players just for some action I died most of the time but so what? it was two minutes in game so I had no real investment. and the few times I didn't I got most of the loot from everyone else.Well... the point i'm trying to make is that this game has a very small replay value as it is now.I think if the maps were smaller and the circles closed faster it could be more fun or at the very least there won't be so many hours filled by just running from one point to the other meeting no one..

review: Ive been reading all the recent reviews and many people are complaining about the people who play the game while not talking about the game itself. Let me start with this This game is almost BRAND NEW. The developers are very active and they listen to what we the players have to say. There are constant updates coming out with fixes and new features and I have yet to see an update "break" the game. The game itself is very fun. You parachute down to wherever on the map youd like and survive. Thats it. There is little to no luck involved its purely skill. If you like games where you can easily win then this is not for you. This game takes skill situational awareness and good aim control. The maps (now 2 different ones) are HUGE and creative and it takes many playthroughs to explore all the areas.Sure there are still many bugs but they are getting fixed almost as fast as they are popping up. To sum up Great game great dev support and great fun. I Highly recommend this game.

review: I haven't played a shooter since Quake III. I just got so burned out on them back in the day I haven't touched one since. I watched a few Twitch streams and gave it a try. What a mistake! Next thing I know I'm only sleeping 2 3 hours a night going into work like a zombie and doing nothing but watching the clock until I can leave work and go home and play again. I'm horrible at the game (only 2 chicken dinners....but would have been more if I didn't accidently hit key to stand up from prone in the final 2 three different times! lol) but man is it fun. Most games I feel like I'm a loot collector for someone else since I lose most fights....but man. When you get into the final 20 the heart starts to beat a little quicker. You enter that final 10 and your pulse starts to race. You're in the final two and your body is shaking a little. You win that first chicken dinner and you're dancing like a kid around your gameroom!

review: I have to rewrite this whole review becuase after some thinking i've come to the conclusion this game is a solid 6 1/2 out of 10. My reason for this is because I think at least 200 HOURS OF THIS GAME I WAS JUST LOOTING AND WALKING AROUND. Seriously only buy this game if you have friends to play with because it can be so boring solo. The reward system just doesn't feel at all well rewarding the reason for this is because if you get lets say 7 kills and a win you only get about 1000 POINTS I mean I suck and I proabably can't even buy one loot box with that sh*t. I mean shroud got 34 kills in one game and only got 1600 POINTS why can't he get 10000? Lets talk about the mid game oh wait this game doesn't have any because everybody just camps in houses then hits in the final few cirles but its already been 20 minutes so whats the point. Ok so why the positive review? Because the game has its moments you will never have in any other game and is just too addictive. Did I enjoy those many hours? I mean I could have learned a new skill and done something with my life but i'll just play a trash game instead thanks.

review: If they call this Version 1.0 im done with it ...This game runs on UnrealEngine4 wich i have seen a lot better running games on. So there was the 12GB patch now ... and the GREAT RELEASE DAY! ... I gave it another try without expecting anything and ... i started the game and got stuck in the pre loading scene ... so i restarted ... made it into the menu selected Solo started got into a lobby and something between 40 80 frames ... wich is "okay". Game started i jumped out landed and well ... server are still bad ... really bad i rubberbanded so hard but my connection was allright ... IMO this game is so far away from beeing 1.0 ... this is beta stage right now ... but they dont care about performance (game and servers) they want a third map and new loot boxes ... cause thats more important ... i'm glad something like Fortnite is doing a great job in the same genre PUBG could have been great but never will be!

review: New to this type of game as im coming from console .. Yes i use a comtroller. Its a funny type of game. I've played for around 8 hours think ive only killed 3 people in that time. I spend most my time looting for items and running around. My first game i opeded the door to a house and got wasted by a house sitter ( not camper its a survvival game "camping" is a great tactic) after that i only wanted to play more and learn from my mistakes. As an early access game they have a long way to go but if the game is this enjoyable at this point then only good things are left to come. I would recommend this game to anyone willing to try something new. My main key points and tips i think anyone should take away from this are.1) Dont expect anyone to teach you how to play ingame even if you are in a squad or duo. Be prepared to learn the hard way2) Be awae of your surroundings sound is key in any situation3) learn how to lot quick and efficiently. 4) When you walk into a house close the door behind you that way you can hear someone walk in if you are upstairs.

review: Here's a completely down to earth and I dare say so honest review of the game. Firstly I'll adress the game itself then move on to the recent scandal concerning broken promises and the devs.So the game It's good. I'd very much disagree with people who argue it's brilliant. It really isn't that brilliant although it being accompanied by rather thrash games such as H1Z1 KOTK and other similar games it's not that hard to stand out and look decent. But what about so many sales? Must be good? In my judgement Twitch made this game. People like Summit1g jumped onto it got very hyped for it. Hence hyping his own community. And when you have a minimum of 20k people watching you that is quite relevant. And then the word about the game slowly spreads other big streamers hop on and essentially the hype does the job for it and everyone wants to get this new game that everyone's playing. And mind you I really AM NOT hating on the game. I enjoy it I do.But to say this game is something unique? It's not. To say it's great? It is in it's genre which is very much flawed. I mean come on. You can't say that the fact every other game in the genre is thrash doesn't by default make PUGB look better. Gunplay feels satisfying a perfect spot between arcade and realism. Vehicles and driving are.. Well they work got some bugs but nothing major at least I barely encountered them but it really does feel wierd. But hey driving isn't really the big point of the game so whatever. Movement is okay no remarks there. To sum it up I'd say the gameplay out of 1/10 would get a 7.5. Once it eventually hopefully gets polished solid 8.5 Not a ten because of personal preference. That is I think there are unecessary RNG elements which have no purpose other then to randomly the player as if there aren't a thousand other things you have to watch out for every game. For example the Rec Circle. I also think the blue circle should serve to simply bring players closer and closer as people die and the map needs to be shrinked so people actually find each other so I'd say the blue circle should be slower but again that's preference.With that I sum it up. Now onto the "juicy" part the recent broken promises.The moment I saw a Korean company was behind it a red flag popped right up. RACIST! No.. Not really. But if you've any experience with Korean games most infamous their MMORGPS free to play most usually their companies have a tendancy to milk the living hell out of their games as much as possible. But hey the majority doesn't define everyone just the majority. But here's where I actually lost it where I'd say I "busted" them. So for the past how many months PUGB has been the top selling game. Steam summer sale comes along they don't drop the price whatsoever it still remains the top selling game on steam. I think we'd all agree they probably made a LOT of bank. A LOT. What's your point? Here it is They put in the crates which they said they will not put until the game is finished which it is not. And.. Lord this is the most triggering thing I've seen in my life.. The reason for it is because.. They need money to fund their tournament? W H A T THE A C T U A L ? You're just some braindead hater. Trust me I HOPE THAT I AM. I hope that the game turns out to be as grand and awesome as they said they were. I hope they don't brake any other promises. I hope everything is nice and dandy. I really hope and I want that. But wake up folks. You're gamers second in this case. You are firstly consumers. You payed X for X which stated it will have X X X X and it will not do X X X X. But how many of these Early Acess titles turned out like this instead You pay X for X which instead has X other X gets removed for some reason third X is only 30% of what they said it would be and the fourth X is actually a Y. Buy the game play it. It's fun.But for the sake of us all this game BOYCOTT AND DO NOT BUY THE FREAKIN' CRATES. Because they most certainly don't need money to fund a tournament.

Le game works fine for 3 days.*Le devs update game**Le graphics goes to hell*Me gets around 60 fps on every thing on ultra low.*Plays match after update* textures wont load in game crashes 7/10 times game freezes as son as i move game works with minor flaws 3/10 timesHitboxes are the worst in this game Me and friends have shoot out on bridge against other team We take cover behind a truck the other team can shoot us but we cant shoot them because the trucks hitbox is screwed so our bullets hit the truck but not for the others. We get le fcked by other team. Other hitbox example U can shot someone 3 times in the fckn face with a m16 they dont even get downed but if they touch your toes with a pistol u instantly die. Game thets 10's and milions in sales. Devs promise to fix things. *Next update*We have aded Microtransactions (that we promised not to add in early access! YAY!) Made servers and game lag even worse!Where is this money going to? Skins and crates instead of making the game playable?What we have not done Optmimization Fix bugs and well known errors Fullfill our promiss to the community to fix server lag!Game fysics Hold a nade to long it blows up in ur hand solid 10/10Jump over a half meter high wall? NOPE!Jump over a 3 meter chainlink fence? HELL YES BEACUSE FYSISCS!Vehicles Riding the motorcycle having fun? Well Bluehole is gonna be like hold this imma flip their bike with invisble objects.Jump out of vehicle when barely moving? no loose 90 hp or die from "falling".Jump out of vehicle when moving at 20 mph? yes get knocked out or die ofc atleast they got that right!Run towards vehicle moving at 1 mph and touch it? yes your gonna go flying 300 yards and die.Driving a vheicle? Good luck hearing because the rest of the map is going to hear u from 20 miles away because it sounds like NASA is launching a fckn rocket!Dev logics Oh our game is and barely works?lets put "network conection error" when u have 100/100 fiber optics speed with ethernet cable when our game is having problems! Great idea 10/10Notes Yes i know that the game is in early access but if your going to release a game it should atleast be functioning in early access and not make their customers want to kill them self... Is it still not fully optimized? Yeah slow rendering sometimes. Is it still really fun? Yup really enjoy the game and it is really fun to play with friends.

review: Still a little buggy although highly addictive!This game is still being developed so I was prepared for the occasional client crash and other related problems but its intuitive gameplay and addictive feeling barely make it worth your money.You're injected with a rush of adrenalin from the moment you step your feet on the ground and run to the nearest house hoping you find some weapon that may allow you to survive the first in game seconds. You're constantly suspicious of every house every tree every sound... It makes a 30 minutes game go by like you've only been playing for a couple of minutes and after you die you just want to play it once more.The gameplay could be improved. Specially the interface used to pick up items and use vehicles.In the end it all comes around playability and the server (the EU one at least) is way too laggy at the moment for you to enjoy a nice game. I died countless times without even realizing I was under fire until I got shot like 3 times because of imense and consistent lag. I frequently last until the last 15 or 10 players but every fire fight I'm in I'll most probably die because of the game lagging the moment I'm shooting the other player... Barely worth the 30$ as it is right now. Devs will be in a real trouble if the hype for this game runs out before they optimize it...EDIT The dedicated EU servers are currently overflown with asian players (apparently because of their own overflown servers) resulting in even more lag than before despite the devs efforts to optimize the game. This combined with the recent rising number of cheating players (last night died 3 times in a row to cheating players) makes the game almost unplayable for me... I'm guessing this is the beggining of the end for PUBG...EDIT 2 My frustration in being killed endlessly because of lag led me to this tweaks page (http //forums.playbattlegrounds.com/topic/12299 great tutorial on how to improve performance in pubg/) that improved the game's performance drastically. I'm serious it's a whole new game in terms of playability!

review: I'd like to make it clear that this game is fun but to a certain degree. The game has given my friends and I a new refreshing experience since none of us have played a game such as this one before. Overall I find myself playing this game with my friends but regret most of my time spent on it. Here are some pros and cons Pros Great to play with friends New fresh ideas that make the game fun Adrenaline pumping at timesCons Vehicels such as anything with wheels can and will flip causing you to die. 90% of this game should be called running simulator because you literally hold W and Shift more so often to just end up dying by a camper or the zone. Games seem too long and slow paced. Getting glitched into something in the map. (Rocks Mylta power Apartments..) Redzone is seriously useless. Camping in the bluezone. (seen people sit in houses in the start and kill incoming people) Basically this game is fun but not really worth it right now. The moment they added crates with keys I lost some respect for the game. All of this is my opinion so yeah..

review: The premise of the game was great. I wasted about a 1000 hours on it so I can't downright not recommend it. Instead I have a mixed opinion of this game. It's really fun for the first 300 500 hours depending on your patience level but then it becomes a grind once you realize that you're playing a game based on headshot accuracy/loot and less on tactical wit. It becomes more like Counter Strike and less of what most people started playing it as in the first place a somewhat open world realistic shooter with some tactical elements. Now it's basically an open world arcade.Also the lag/netcode became unbearable. I've stopped playing because of it. Most fights became RNG shoot outs. There have been many engagements where both my opponent and myself should have killed each other at the same time yet since the game picks and chooses what shots register it instead becomes RNG in close quarters combat. Give it a few days of playing and you'll see plenty of times where you'll see blood register on yourself or the player and the game won't count it as a damage because God forbid if both top 2 players killed each other in the final circle and no one got a chicken dinner. Instead the game chooses what shots count and which ones don't to avoid a mutual. As for people who might be confused on why I'm not recommending this game when I obviously got my money's worth from a 1000 hours of entertainment (adding my hours on the test server) I only played this because I didn't bother exploring what other content was available. It's very similar to when someone keeps going back to an old ex not because they enjoy their time together but because they don't instead put in the effort to find someone new more exciting and ultimately better for them. Simply put this game became a simplistic no thought boredom time killer. TLDR PUBG is the Bud Light of games. Gets the job done nothing special nothing too bad. This game is great for a couple hundred hours until you learn the maps and learn the exploits. Then it becomes a mindless time killer which is great if you can't be bothered to find anything with stimulating above mediocre content.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is great but let me just list some of the issues that are pretty annoying 1 Game still needs optimisation but it is not an issue for me since i can run the game pretty good and this will be fixed in the future but i do get some weird drops like from 80 fps to 10 hopefully this will be fixed.2 Hitreg and desync is a big ing problem that hopefully wont take that long to take care of hitreg with shotguns and pretty much every gun espically shotguns though is very bad and desync is pretty annoying.3 Quite a bit of bugs ofc this will be fixed in the future.4 Veichles need some working on them since they flip for some dumb reasons.This is it for the big cons suggestions for this game 1 We should be able to have a kill cam feature so if someone gets killed in a very suspicous way that person can make sure he got killed by a hacker.2 Add new modes even though we have zombie mode but it's pretty boring i'm thinking about adding like some crazy shit like team deathmatch with 10v10 and we can choose what guns we want that would be pretty nice to get better aim and understand some weapon sprays.3 Add a feature that makes us see how skins look before buying them like if i want to buy a 10$ item i want to be able to see how it looks before i buy it that would be really nice to.4 Shooting range this is for weapons and testing out guns where you have bots that we can shoot and test out how many shots it takes to kill someone that has a lvl 3 vest with an ak stuff like it would be really helpful.This is it for my suggestions i think this game has a great future if they don't it up with a update the game is already succesful and it's going to be even more if they don't it up.

review: It was fun for awhile until you get circles that are on the other side of the map and half in the water and you have 5 or so mins to loot before rushing over as fast as you can to get shot by the people lucky enough to have dropped their. I really enjoyed the game early but after hours of play the little things add up. One major problem is the driving and the randoming flipping while driving anywhere. Jumping to area that have large groups of people dropping in can be fun if you can find and gun which sometimes loot seems really jacked up since some house may not even have a gun. If you do manage to overcome the getting a gun and engage on people if you didnt get the circle or its not close by better just make a break for it since you dont have much time to fight and loot before having to run for it. So IF you get a gun and IF you have the circle you can have some fun as long as the servers and having issues which has been a serious problem since I started playing the game. The core gun play is fun when you have time to fight but most of your time will be spent running across open fields because you didnt get a car spawn or rushing around looking for so place to setup in the new circle before dashing to the next area. I'm not even going to talk about microtrasactions because I could care less one way or the other since it doesnt effect core gameplay and I dont ever plan to spend money on cosmetics.Edit A lot of the problem have been fixed since I wrote the review. The game is fun again and also runs much better. Seems the devs care more than most early access and keep adding and improving the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is fun as long as you are the best fps player in the world. The mechanics and feel of the game are a little goofy like movements and the guns themselves. Theres way too may bugs in the game. Like sometimes if you step out of your car after its flipped youll die from falling even though youre only 3 feet off the ground. Cars will randomly explode cars will fly in the air if you hit something too fast or collide with another vehicle. I know it is an early access game but theyre rushing EVERYTHING when they dont have the basics down. Theyre already starting esports tournaments although I bet you half of the competitors will die from bugs alone. This game can be fun with friends or if you win. Thats really it... But you have to get through the hackers and bugs first.I reccommend waiting for them to improve the game or wait until its out of early access and it becomes a full release.Dont buy it YET.

review: The only good thing about this game is the first person and the gun play. This game is poorly optimized I constantly crash or the textures in the game won't load in (this usually gets me killed at the beginning of a match). The devs need to focus on fixing glitches and optimizing the game instead of adding crates. Over 5 million people have bought this game thats about 150 million dollars in profits. they did not need to add them in at all because now it looks like a cash grab. This game on the highest settings for graphics looks like a CoD game and CoD does not have the best graphics. Anytime there is a patch more things get broken than fixed and its really annoying with the game gets even more broken especial when they have test servers for the upcoming patch. The devs keep rushing out patches without testing them for an extend time. I feel like this game has a speech impediment for how much it stutters. If I was able to I would refund this game its not worth it right now. Lets face it we all know this game is going to be in early access for the next 4 years.

review: I love PUBG but not because I love these types of games. I love PUBG because it's so difficult to win and so frustrating when you lose that I HAVE to keep playing another game. It's addictive. The cheaters are horrible. It's the biggest problem with the game. There's no doubt about that. And there are a lot of cheaters. It's a shame too because all the other minor glitches and negative things would easily be overseen if it weren't for the cheaters. The cheaters make it a lot worse. Example I was over a hill there was nobody in sight I was on the other side of a tree on the lower part of the hill. There was nobody around me. NOBODY. The zones would have made it impossible for anybody to survive in a direction that somebody could've seen me. I hear somebody coming over the hill behind me. Hmmm? I peek from behind my tree wondering how where they were coming from. Now even if they had SEEN me go down over that hill there's NO WAY they could've known which tree I was behind but not this person. I peek out to see where they're coming from and this person comes straight over the crest of the hill straight at me with no hesitation and fires three shots all hitting instantaneously and killing me. That player knew EXACTLY where I was out of all the trees I could've been behind and there was no vantage point they could've had that would tell them where I was. I can deal with the three shot kill some people are actually that good but making a bee line straight to me was not possible. I'm afraid the cheating could really ruin this game in the future. How can you really know who is that good or not? You can't. There are other issues like how the ammunition is distributed around the map when it spawns and things like that but I think that all those things can (and will) be fixed in time. But the cheating? Hmmm. Come on PUBG. Would I recommend this game to a friend? Well I'd tell them my experiences and explain about the cheating and then let them decide but I wouldn't recommend it or not recomment it. It's a real shame too. Hopefully as the updates and official release come things will get better. I have to say I'd recommend it here I guess but with that big caveat (cheaters) as I've said above.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game is very much so unfinished. It has very bad spawn rates of items as well (4 helmets in one room Three large houses with nothing but pistols in them etc..). View distance bugs a aweful. Being able to see someone running up a hill hundreds of yards away becuase foliage doesnt load at that distance is just bad. I have also experienced parachuters poping up seconds before landing even though I was scouting for them the entire time I was heading to a destination using the ALT key. Hit boxes seem to be off and melee combat is just getting lucky becuase everything moves around so much and the punching animation takes to long. This game can be fun and is entertaining to watch streams play but after waiting to load into 6 games and dying within the first 20 sec to 2 min becuase above mentioned problems makes this game frustrating so those moments are few and far between. Picking up items is bulky and slow. In a game where I can place the same whether I have no gear and crawl through the weeds or spend time looting to die in combat there is no real point to looting and armor seems to be useless as 90% of the time if someone gets the drop on you you are dead instantly with no chance to run or turn around and fight.

review: People fail to remember this game is not fully released yet. With that said I have put 300+ hours into this game. I've experienced all the frustrating things and all the high points. for $30 this game is well worth it. I can't tell you the last time my heart has RACED playing a video game. This game is extremely fun to play with friends. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys FPS. Just be ready to die again... and again... and again... but all those deaths are definitely worth the adrenaline rush you get when you kill those last enemies and you win!

review: This is an Early access game if your expecting polished triple A graphics you will be disappointed if your expecting a third person shooter that plays as smooth as Ghost Recon Wildlands you will be disappointed. If you have heart problems or are an woman with child be advised this game will at times make your heart skip a beat. It's a fun game less stressful when playing with a squad borderline horror game when playing by yourself. You'll laugh you'll cry you'll curse the day your ever bought this game. But you'll come back to it day after day after day. Just do yourself a favor and stay away from the Asia server if you can avoid it that place is like 80% hackers at least the other servers are only 30 45% max.

review: PUBG is the most competitive game I've ever played even more so than playing mario kart with friends... Despite recent reviews being mixed or negative I see no reason to write a negative review about this game. For the moment it does seem to be poorly optimized but the game is in early access and the developers have promised to have this fixed (to some extend) in a few weeks. But hey I love the crap out of the Fallout series but those games are also poorly optimized! In that case we are talking about games that take 5 6 years perhaps more in development before release and it's still poorly optimized. I've never encountered a hacker but that is perhaps because I'm low ranking and playing in the EU (I mostly hear complains about hackers in NA and Asia). Nevertheless I believe those that complain about said hackers and I wish there would be more done about it because I don't want this game to lose its playerbase. I can't say that I enjoy playing this game solo so for the most part I play it in duo (as 2 players in a team) or squads (3 4 players in team). It is a lot of fun to play with friends but only being able to enjoy it in duo or squads has its down sides. For example I will have to wait for my friends to finish school/work etc. to play the game. Therefore even though I've hade the game for about 2 3 months I've only played it for about 76 hours. There isn't much that the developers can do about that its just the nature of the game. There is of course the matter of lag spikes which is infuriating but those seem to be the worst in the beginning (roughly first 4 5 minutes of the game). I've heard the reason being that in the beginning there are about 100 players online but in those 4 5 minutes about 20 players (often more) die and the number of players drop which subsequently results in a more more managable lag. Also as part of the optimization update the developers have promised a brighter future in terms of a more stable connection. Yes it is extremely competitive! Dying in the first 5 10 minutes can suck a lot or going 5 rounds without a single kill may be discouraging... You will however become better with each round! In 99% of the cases you die in PUBG it's because the opposing player/team had an advantage over you (higher ground better cover etc.) or is simply better than you. A large part of this game is to develop a strategy to plan and (when playing in teams) to co operate and communicate.I thoroughly enjoy this game it is the best online FPS I've played and hopefully the game will get even better in the near future.

review: To start off I really enjoy this game but there are many issues that need fixed. I understand that it's still in early access but there's a lot of things like lag problems. Sometimes I get rubber banded back which isn't too much of an issue unless you're in a gun fight with another team. One out of a few games me and my friends go through "network lag" all at the same time. When that happens if you're moving it makes you constantly move without stopping. If you're at the edge of the safe zone that could easily cause you to die. And as for punching say at the start of a round I could be about 10 meters away and they're able to punch me easily while staying far away from me. Some of the driving mechanics need to be fixed as well. If you hit even the smallest bump it could send your vehicle into a spiral make you take damage from hitting the small bump or flip your motorcycle over and cause you to fly off taking damage or even killing you. Lastly at the start of some rounds none of the buildings loud in and if I try to go inside one I'll either get stuck in a wall that rendered while I was in there or fall through a floor if I try to land on top of a buiding. I still love the game but if these issues would get fixed it would be so much more fun.

review: EDIT *There are still a tone of frustrating bugs or people that just ruin the whole experience such as No gun fire when pulling a gun fast (even though the animation of the guy getting ready is over)Frustrating angles when forced to play third person (third person is and when no one is playing first person you have to deal with that .Dealing with third person IF I DIDN't MAKE IT CLEAR THIRD PERSON IS Getting camped in third person.Getting camped with a shotgun in third person.Doing everything correctly and still losing because there is someone that finds it funny to stay behind a rock with an ump (also in third person if not he wouldn't have seen me coming from behind a tree) The lag servers aren't the main forte in this game...The game is good but honestly spending 30 minutes on a match and losing not because you got outplayed or you made a mistake but rather a head standing behind a ing rock in the midle of a rocky mountain is not funny and it makes you want to quit*Finally the servers work as intended (almost every match).The game's performance is really good (compared to what is was before).The game's server conection is playable!!!!!!!!The gameplay is tactical shooter that motivates camping on thirdperson but on first person it does really well.The sounds are ok cant complain but they aren't great.The bugs that are ingame are those that you can predict.My only complain are the chinese people ing some matches and joining squads and not comunicating at all.The game is finally a full game release and NOW it is worth the 30 usd.The ingame microtransactions are worth nothing as the game will spawn the most expensive clothes (you can literally loot a 1 hundred usd worth coat ingame and its not rare but really common actually most clothes are lootable).Pros No random recoil (looking at you fortnite and now h1z1 with the latest unplayable update).Cons You might have walked a long way to get killed by a cheater or someone that was camping inside a bathroom.If you like tactical shooters go ahead and buy it.

review: Great game that requires your full attention if you want a chicken dinner the difference between not hearing that footstep and hearing it could mean your death. Im not sure why alot of these reviews say they can barely hold 30 40 fps on a pc when i can play it in 2k with a consistent 60 fps cant do 4k but im only running a single 1080 and like they said it isnt quite optimized yet.Havent noticed much in the way of bullet inconsistencies either if anything i think alot of the bullets follow the correct arcs specially at distance. My big complaint i run into most frequently is the sound. Sometimes i hear footsteps and its from 2 3 buildings away inside.Servers have been slightly laggy lately as well so if you dont have a good connection you will lag. Must introduce region locks asap. And of course its always the funnest when with friends alone i can usually only play 2 3 matches before I need to switch to a story based game.Overall id say 8/10. Needs alot of work but hopefully with their backing well see alot more pushes in content 3rd map already announced and heres hoping 1.0 fixes some optimization. Quality &gt Quantity

review: In PUBG I liked many things. I liked how there was options to change your POV and your gun to be an automatic gun a burst gun or just a single shot gun. It is a great game to play with you're friends and team up. All you have to be in this game is lucky and good. Though this game is good it could still use MINOR adjustments. like you should be able to have an option to play a solo game with you're friends that are in you're party. There should be more guns and more things you could unlock in a package than just clothing. PUBG should even make up a mode where you could also just get guns out of crates and use them in a mode where you could play with guns that you already got from crates and are able to make a class. I also think this game should just be a few dollars off for now or just permantly. I know PUBG is an Early Access Game but these are just a FEW of my suggestion they should add on to thier game as they are going along to make an EXCELLENT game! Overall if you did not get the hint this is an AWESOME game that you should go check out!

review: This game got big quick in my opinion. I'm hooked on it! I've never played the other games that are similar to this genre like H1Z1 but I think PUBG has done very well! This game has great graphics and the weapon selection is great! I really like the attachements for the guns. There are still some glitches in the games issues with lobby being laggy and objects or people phasing through doors or walls. Gameplay also has quite a bit of lag. For the most part BlueHole is great about keeping up with the issues and gettings bugs worked out. All in all it's a great and addictive game!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Very fun and slow paced game. Alot of sneaking around to survive and running long distances across the massive map. The customization for the character and weapons keep me entertained. I love the Duos and Squad modes when playing with friends or other players that communicate. I especially love the game for the great moments of popping out around a corner and getting multiple kills. Gun fights are very satisfying because the pops and bangs sound good. Some core issues I've seen is that it can lag very bad so I have to restart the game and that takes care of it. Also some times the microphone function is disabled for the whole lobby which is annoying when you're playing with teammates. Nothing that ruins the game for me though.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game... there's a lot of great things about it but there are also some huge glaring issues. Let's start with the good it's great fun to play with friends and have voice chat going. It can be a fast action packed game or you can take it slow and build up your player slowly. There's so much replay value I could see myself playing this for far more than the 6 hours I have put in. The gameplay feels great as well tactical sometimes a bit slow but the moments of firefights make up for that. Those are just some of the great things about Battlegrounds. There are a few issues though... The primary one being the performance. It's horrible but still playable. I have an I5 6500 1060 3gb model and 8 gigs of RAM. Not the best but quite decent and I have to run this at very low to low settings to get a consistant 60 70 frames. And still I have a few frame drops now and then. Some other issues are the bugs I've been stuck in a loading screen and had to force quit the game. There's quite a few glitches. But seeing as this game is still in Early Access I can forgive some of it's cons. Overall I would really recommend picking up this game especially if you have a few friends to play with.

review: copied and pasted this review from CST Meticulous7because it says all the things i experienced and i couldnt of worded it any better thanks CST Meticulous7This game is incredibly enjoyable exciting and gets my adrenaline rushing like nothing I've ever played....BUT until the devs stop banning people because streamers say they were "harassed" I'm giving it a thumbs down.Devs honking a horn is NOT harassment. Explain to me how that effects someones stream or is harassment? Kill the person if they're doing that and if they're in your squad don't play with that person again (DUH). Also when you're constantly being thrown into random servers the odds of actually "stream sniping" someone is virtually impossible. This isn't like other games where you can find the server name and follow the streamer into it. Who the hell made this decision?Also the broken promise regarding microtransactions. That is pretty goddamn shady. That's bad enough but when there are so many glaring areas that need work ignoring all of that to add a feature you said you wouldn't add until release is a straight kick in the nuts to your supporters. Devs don't forget We made you successful and we can undo that by choosing not to buy anymore games from someone who isn't trustworthy and thinks prioritizing streaming to the point of BANNING legitimate players who may not even be aware the other person is streaming is INSANITY. Whoever made this decision needs to be FIRED.You guys have created a PR nightmare for yourself and until you make it right it's only going to get worse. It's like you started out with a row boat and now you're flying around in a Yacht. Except now you decided to blow a hole in the bottom of the yacht allowing it to take on water (which will inevitably sink it) but you choose to pretend the hole isn't there and that you didn't make it. GET BACK TO REALITY.Actual hacks deserve a ban not because someone did something that some sniveling streamer didn't like.

review: Playerunknowns battlegrounds is an exceptional Battle royale shooter with it's popularity growing by the minuet im sure you'd want to give it a try but let me list the pros and cons first so you can get a little more information of what your money is getting you.PROS Strategic fun Great graphics Huge map Ton of gameplay Map loot spot analyze and predict with your pals making this game a communication powerhouse. CONS Buggy Servers are too busy Swallows your PC L A G (due to lack of servers) Hackers and misconceptions can occur although the developers are taking care of the hacking issue.Sure it's got bugs and cons but im recommending this because it's an overall good game and honestly very entertaining with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is a love hate and hate relationship.It's the purest form of hate. Satan is nothing compared to this game. The only god is PUBG RNG.You can will get shot from the other side of the universe and not know where the shot came from.You can will get stuck between 2 Teams (Or people but i recommend Duo or Squads if you have any friends (If you don't then look around on Tinder maybe you can find some friends there ) )) and get destroyed.You can will get bad loot but somehow make it into top 10.You can will get good loot and die in the first 5 minutes.You can will find people who are clueless and will stand still while you shoot them.You can get 2nd place every time (Like every god damn time i survive longer than 5 minutes)You can't get 1st placeYou can get 2nd place (Like seriously)You can get any other place except 1st.You can will have an urge to smack your head against the wall until you pass out.You can will die.You can't live long enough to get 1st place.Your bullets can turn into nerf darts mid flight.You take 900% increased damage from all sources unlike everyone else. Also you can have a heart attack IRL.Only for you and your teammates your accuracy is the same as a Silver 1 player shooting the m249 in CS GO (Or Haitham (Inside joke)). The enemies have the accuracy of Robin Hood if he had a bionic arm 90x zoom and a weapon with projectiles that break the universe when fired.It will make you suicidal (Credit to one lovely person who knows it's him ) )You will wish that the game never existed.You will want to cry yourself to sleep because you didn't get 1st place.Enemy bullets will bend time and space and hit you as if your hitbox is 3 seconds behind you (Spoilet alert it is a god damn snake if you're getting shot)Enemies apparently have infinite meds and no hitbox.They have a thing called RNG on their side.They have a better position than you even if you think you have the best one.They can only be killed by Shroud.Yeah i guess it's the impossible game converted to Battle royale. I Guess i like hate it.Hi mom hi dad. Hope you liked my review. Can i buy 984 Gamescom crates now? I believe they will go up in price. Trust me please i'll buy you a new house later. Scratch that please kill me.Forgot to mention that the rest of the players will somehow still gang up against you accidentally and then you will get Uranus destroyed from all 83 Directions.You will always get trapped between 2 teams. Even if you're at the edge of the zone someone will still somehow be behind you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First of all i really like this game. Nonetheless is the new 1.0 update nothing more than a joke. Releasing this game as a finished product while the menu has to load for several minutes on a mediocre gaming pc by western standards (poor russians) and having to wait while the game loads the map while your allready in the plane is not acceptable.I m really disappointed and I hope this will be fixed in the future but at this standpoint this game is nothing more than one of the typical "early acces garbage" which gamers are getting served now for years just with a different concept which works well. I m sad that this game cant reach its full potential.Sorry for mistakes im not an native english speaker.

review: Devs need to stop developing the game and spend a bit of time on optimization and fleshing out the bugs of the game.Fix the game before adding more to worry about. Its not like that $700+ million dollars in game sales and being offered massive sponsors from the likes NVIDIA has left the devs and team broke. Microtransactions makes gamers hate game companies. review: Note My system specs are listed on my profile if people are interested since performance is obviously relative to hardware.TL DR Review here. Some additional thoughts below.Gunplay 8/10 Fairly unique and challenging but feels very rewarding to learn.Performance BEFORE 1.0 patch 4/10I had pretty bad drops in big cities sometimes as low as 30fps.Performance AFTER 1.0 patch 8/10 I typically run around 140FPS with some drops to 70 80 or so a massive improvement.Movement System 7.5/10 Vaulting added a much needed element to movement and works great.Developer 7.5/10 Bluehole and PlayerUnknown seem to be fairly in touch with the community more so than many dev teams.Overall Score 7/10I think this game could stand to be improved and clearly will be and has been already. Considering how new this game is and how much it has progressed already I look forward very much to seeing where the dev team takes this game. It is absolutely worth your money if you are interested in the genre and it is a TON of fun with friends. Additional thoughts and some comments on recent negative reviews.Honestly I see a ton of negative reviews for this game mentioning performance ever since 1.0 I have been running at or near FPS cap with zero performance issues on either map or settings. I have to call them out for being wrong. My advice buy this game if you have serious performance issues then refund it if not congratulations you now own one of the best games of the year. This is assuming you enjoy the style of gameplay it offers which not everyone does.To speak to the "chinese hacker/lagger infestation" people are talking about this is absolutely nowhere near as big of an issue as people are making it out to be. On EU there have been zero hackers in my (limited granted) playtime. I have also never even seen a chinese player let alone died to one. neither have my friends and they are closer to the 600 hour mark of playtime than I am with my relatively short 100 (at the time of writing) hours.I understand this might be different on the NA or OCE regions but I am simply giving my experience. The developer has already mentioned that they are looking into a solution for it so leaving a negative review just because you died once to someone playing on the wrong region is quite childish and only serves to harm your cause.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: still kinda buggy but probably one of the better early access survival games out there. Graphics are poorly optimized be sure to add malloc system USEALLAVAILABLECORES to your launch options to get a 30 FPS boost. The gameplay is really chaotic and fast paced. 9/108/20/17 Update They're just not fixing bugs and have ridiculous rules like stream sniping that a real esport (csgo) would never ban you over. Not only is it extremely easy to avoid getting stream sniped but the reports of it are greatly over exaggerated. Several streamers have been banned for UNAVOIDABLE GLITCHES where a house won't load or a rock will be see through. Maybe I'd understand if this was a legitimate competitive game but there is no ranking system it's early access and these issues are totally on PLAYERUNKNOWN's part but Bluehole refuses to fix them. The game is very enjoyable to play if not badly optimized but PLEASE FIRE YOUR COMMUNITY MANAGER AND GET THE RULES IN CHECK YA DAFT S
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros Balanced weapons Every gun feels strong for what its worth even the pistols Gameplay Gameplay feels rewarding whether its getting kills finding loot or just surviving it feels pretty cool Squad/Duos Because of the nature of the game squad and duo queues are a lot more fun than in gmaes such as H1Z1 (In my personal opinion). Theres a lot more teamwork involved in encounters and if you get caught out on your own you're screwed Variety There are loads of different weapons and mods at your disposal. Whether you choose to be a stealthy sniper or rambo is up to you.Cons Servers Spawing in is horrific. I've noticed it more in solos but during landing (another con) and the first few minutes people will teleport around and you will occasionally rubber band. After a few minutes its alright. Landing Jumping out of the plane fine. Flying down fine. Actually landing with the parachute Painful infuriating and slow. If you're not over flat ground be prepared to decend at around 1 nanometre a second and if you land on a wall or in between a narrow space be prepared to hang there for around a minute spamming F to cut your parachute but it wont let you. Perfomance Not really a con more of a warning but I run the game at around 40fps with a 960 with everything on low. You'll need a beefy card to run the game well.PS Buy the game its great. Once the server issues are fixed I wont see much wrong with the game. For an early access game this is one that I would say is worth buying.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There are a lot of negative reviews recently on this game and I can understand why to some extent. The seemingly random bans some people are receiving are problematic but with near 100 hours in the game I have had zero issues. The feeling of getting your first chicken dinner is incomparable to almost any other game. The crates can currently still be opened for free or traded for steam cash to get their keys. Fpp is an amazing addition and server performance seems to be way up. If you have a friend or two who plays it's absolutely worth the purchase.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off I bought this game for me and a friend because I heard it was much better to play with friends. So I've spent $60 to get me and my friend a chance to play this. I had heard that the optomization was bad but this is just absurd! I understand that having a gtx 1050 means that I wont be playing any game at its best but at the very least I expect to be able to run at 60fps on low (1080p) but I consistantly get 30fps in completely barren fields and drop even lower at times! This game is in desperate need of optomization. Heck I can run Ark better than this! And just to be clear I do enjoy the game. The gunplay is great and the tenseness of battle royal games is ever present. The only thing I'd fix would be the inability to hop anything waist high without crouch jumping. Adding an ability to vault or something of that nature.In conclusion I would like to say that this game is fun bu not worth the money at the moment. The optomization is almost as bad as Ark when it first released and I've also had a few issues with being stuck on the loading screen whilst being able to hear all the audio. And thus a DO NOT BUY (yet). EDIT The game has recently been crashing everytime I load into a match and the optomization has improved a little bit.

review: From the patchnotes of a game/developer that does it right (unlike Bluehole) and does it in every patch Client stability has been improved.Update Version 1.0 has been released. One could think that when a game is officially released is runs stable. One could think that the release candidate 1.0 has no major bugs.This is false. PUBG ver. 1.0 has major bugs. Bugs that affect gameplay and makes early game sometimes impossible to play. The official forum is filled with bug reports and compared to the last beta version the release version is worse and more bugged.Sadly i could not refund the game since i exceeded 2 hours of gameplay when i got aware of how many bugs there are or how badly the game is optimized.But hope dies last they say maybe Bluehole will eventually hire capable developers and this game seriously becomes a stable game worth to play.Best bug so far run into a wall and die from _falling_ https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 7CI0a9sCO_M

review: This game should be taken in two parts for a good review. Playing solo I would give this game a 4/10 mainly because it is almost unplayeable without a team. It can be enjoyable but you more often then not end up walking around for 5 minutes grabbing gear only to be killed by a guy sitting on a random door waiting for some passerby. If you don't have a group that will play this with you I would pass this by and find something else. If you have that team I give this game a 7/10. I can't give it any higher rating because as it sits right now there are just too many technical problems that need stabilizing before it is a great game. Rubberbanding lag and random crashes plague this but happen at moments that can drive you insane. The team play is awsome and can show some awesome fire fights but they only happen once in a blue moon.I really wish i could love this game but it just drives me insane with both its technical issues and the toxic people who have come to plague it also. If you are into battle royale games sure sure give it a shot if you think this is a stable game with good solo play then at least I would say search elsewhere.UPDATE This game needs a lot of fixing before it is playable again. Rubberbanding is gamebreaking weapons are inconsistent hit or miss hit detection which is on average miss. This is a prime example of another game ruined when it attempts to go out of early access.

review: READ EDIT3 Wait until the game is finished. Super buggy and not optimized. On the plus side the game is fun but only when it works. I can't even get through a full game without having "network lag detected" appear. The problem isn't my internet because I use discord at the same time without any issues.Wait til next year then consider the game.Edit Fix found for "network lag detected". Install the game on another drive and move it to another one via properties local files. This fix may or may not work for you. Bugs still persist such as random game crashes.Edit2 Will update review as soon as the new update rolls out with the new map. The test server is showing promising improvements. The game developers are clearly trying to solve the issues present in the current patch.Edit3 After a long time coming the game is out of beta. The development team has done an impressive job updating the game. Optimizations make the game playable on almost any mid range system and the gameplay is impecable. Great job Bluehole and the entire PUBG team!

review: December 27 2017 Encounters with hackers has dramatically dropped since my last writing. Our squad encounters a hacker about 1 out of every 20 to 30 matches. The new map is amazing game optimization has improved about 20 to 30% a lot less desync a lot less lag in the beginning. Overall the PC 1.0 launch feels almost perfect I'd give it an 85/100. Excellent job Bluehole. Why can I put an 8x on a S12K but not a M16? October 18 2017 I'm not one to complain about hackers but my squad encounters hackers 1 out of every 5 games. Blatant hacking some dude running so fast he's a blur or some guy using an aim bot he kills our whole squad in 4 seconds. Banning these guys isn't working DO SOMETHING DIFFERENT so they can't come back.March 31 2017 A great game for all types of gamers. Whether you're a hardcore gamer or casual gamer. If you prefer to solo or run with buddies. If you prefer going balls to the wall or slow and strategic. Or maybe you're the guy that likes to create traps and ambush people.The dynamics of the Map terrain vehicles and weapons gives you a lot of options. Similar games don't offer this sort of diversity they're either running simulators or driving simulators.The performance for this game is average. With a GTX 1070 it runs at 60+ fps on ultra settings but has big dips occasionally. I keep my settings in the medium to high range to avoid those big dips.It's 100% worth the price tag.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is much more fun than I ever expected. And it's still growing and getting much more content.But i can't help it to get mad about the rewardsystem of the singleplayer / solo mode.In fact you get a lot of less of "Points" when you play with your friends. So I always feel a little punished by the game when we play full Squad (which is way more fun at least for me )So yes I recommend this game to everyone. But you should be ready for splitting your "Points" and getting less rewarded than some solo mainac douchbag p.Go have fun its woth it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Since the 1.0 launch I've encountered quite a bit of lag on the servers but it usually goes away quickly and I've never encountered it during a battle. Fantastic game even better with friends in a squad. The search for weapons and equipment can get tedious if you suck and die in your first firefight but playing with a good group of friends makes it totally worth it.

review: I recommend this game as an early access game because even though it has "officially" come out it is still pretty much in the same state as it was in early access. Still filled with bugs frustrating at times but when it works it is fun and challenging (emphasis on when it works).In my eyes this game has not yet come out of beta and is still far from a finished product but I believe it has potential to become a great game.I strongly recommend trying this game with steam share with someone who allready has it before buying it as the game may be less apreciated by some than others.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
